loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years now.

Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rasian

texts.en:
Rasian is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town.

Rasian has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet her customers' orders on time, to earn a good amount of profit.

This monetary help can take Rasian closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet her customers' orders on time, to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to repair his taxi, because the current condition of it is not good, and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Alia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Alia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily, providing better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Alia also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future. Alia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Chhengchhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chhengchheoun, a farmer living in Prey Veng Province, is 48 years old and a mother of three children. She overcomes her family’s hardships via rice cropping and raising pigs. This is her first time with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). 

In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy piglets to support her pigs raising. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy piglets to support her pigs raising business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Biswa Trimuti Group-B

texts.en:
Dropati is a 23-year-old lady who lives with her husband and her two children in a small village of Koraput district in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing first from the left is Dropati; second is Dhanamati and third is Kunda. Dropati is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Dropati formed a group with nine other women from her village with the group name of "Biswa Trimuti Group-B".  These three members (Dropati, Dhanamati, and Kunda) are the part of the group. All the group members are engaged in different business activities, such as selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. 

Dropati, along with Dhanmati and Kunda, requested this loan of 54,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity. Dhanmati and Kunda will use their portion to purchase a cow and for agriculture respectively.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation

loans.name: Biswa Trimuti Group -A

texts.en:
Biswa Trimuti-A Group is made up of ten women from a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. Here the two members, Damani and Sanadei from this group, have requested this loan. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women, with a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses.

The lady standing on the left in the photograph is Damani and the lady standing on the right is Sanadei, aged 55 and 33 years respectively, and both have two children. Both the members live with their respective family and do paddy cultivation. They produce paddy and sell it at the market. Their family members help them in paddy selling at the market. They are planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, so they can produce more paddy and can increase their income. 

Damani and Sanadei are asking for a loan amount of 18,000 INR each to invest in their business activities. They will use this loan amount to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for their paddy cultivation. They want to construct a house for their family. They say, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon, 38, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and is a mother of four schoolchildren.

To support her family, she grows cassava and sells meat to earn more income. This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan successfully.

Sinuon leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 50-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 3 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. Razia intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 50 years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters, and her husband has a scrap recycling business and manages the household.
Razia's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle. Due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn profitable income.
Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To aaeincrease her husband's scrap recycling business

loans.name: Ma. Lanie

texts.en:
Ma. Lanie sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan helped her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and cover expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more with a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward buying additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for her tricycle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Ma. Lanie wants her business to become successful and stable. She dreams of a good life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Melba requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc., for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Melba would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc., for her business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 55 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nilda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc.  Nilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 40 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Susana has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group-A

texts.en:
Krupamani is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters. For the past five years, she has run a general store business out of a sheet metal structure that she has set up near the house.

Her shop is always well stocked with vegetables, cosmetics, bangles, and items for her tailoring business, such as thread and various colored cloth. She dreams of having a big, formal shop that’s filled with all of the grocery and cosmetic items the women in her village want, along with an expanded tailoring business.

She wants to use her loan to buy more of the necessary items, specifically bracelets, prepackaged food, and face creams. She would also like to buy more high-quality cloth to use for her tailoring. With the additional income, Krupamani hopes to be able to pay for her daughter to have a good education.

The lady standing in middle in the photograph is Krupamani.

loans.use: to expand her general store by purchasing vegetables, bangles, and high-quality cloth.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group-B

texts.en:
Sharamati, the lady standing first from the left hand side, is a 22-year-old woman who lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She is engaged in mushroom and vegetable cultivation. Her husband is a farmer, and he produces rice. Her husband helps her in this activity. Currently, Sharamati earns 4,000 INR per month from her livelihood, which is used in monthly household expenses.

Sharamati has a four-acre farming area where she produces mushrooms and vegetables and sells them in the market. Sharamati wants to rent farming land so she could produce more mushrooms and vegetables. For this, she has applied for a loan amount of 12,000 INR for each member.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this kind help.

loans.use: to pay rent for farming land so she can produce more mushrooms and vegetables.

loans.name: Biswa Trimuti Group - C

texts.en:
The "Biswa Trimuti Group-C" consists of ten women from a small village of Koraput district in Odisha, India. All the members of this group are engaged in different activities like animal rearing, vegetable selling, milk selling, etc. They help and support each other in their business activities, as well as in their personal lives. All the group members are dedicated and committed to enhance their businesses and make a handsome amount of money so that they will be able to educate their children and have a better standard of life. Jamuna, Chandrakanti and Muni, these three members are part of this group. In the picture the lady standing first is Jamuna, second is Chandrakanti and third one is Muni. 

Chandrakanti is 40 years old, a married lady, and lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her one daughter, aged fifteen years. Her daughter goes to a local school. She has been engaged in cow rearing and cow's milk selling for the last ten years. From this activity, she is able to contribute a small share to her family's household expenditures. She wants to register her child in a good school. 

Chandrakanti, along with Jamuna and Muni, has requested a loan to invest in their respective businesses for enhancing their business activity. Chandrakanti will use her portion to purchase a Jersey cow and renovate its shed. She is very excited to take out this loan, and she says, "We are grateful to Kiva and its lenders for providing us this opportunity."

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow and renovate its shed.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham Province, Sokha is 40 years old and a mother of two children. She can earn income to support her living via rice cropping. This is her third cycle with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. 

In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group-C

texts.en:
Laxmi, the woman standing in the middle in the photo, is 33 years old and married. She lives in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha state, India with her husband and two children.

Laxmi owns a grocery shop near her house where she sells basic household items such as rice, pulses, spices, sugar, edible oil, etc. Currently she earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity. She wanted to be an earning member of her family, which is why she started this business seven years ago.

Laxmi, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase edible oil, sugar, rice, pulses, biscuits, spices, etc. in bulk. She is really very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

Rinki and Mangali are engaged in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase edible oil, sugar, rice, pulses, biscuits, spices, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia  is 37 years old and married. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Razia ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenses. Therefore, Razia  has requested 40,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo  to serve more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers and crdate a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nasreen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
Sanjar is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Software Engineering. Here is his story:

“My name is Sanjar. I am an 18-year-old single student. I live with my mother and younger sister, who is a schoolgirl. My mother is a doctor. She is so proud of being a doctor, to help people and save their lives, but, unfortunately, she earns little, and we usually face financial difficulties at home. Thank God we have my grandfather, who is a pensioner. He helps us as he can, but, of course, he can’t do much. My parents divorced about 10 years ago, and my father left us. We don’t keep in touch with him, and he doesn’t pay us alimony.

From childhood my weakness is an education. I can say I am eager to know and learn something new every day. I have a dream to do a Masters in the USA, but to realize this plan, I have to build a good background here and now. The Department of Software Engineering is one of the best and most prestigious departments at the university. A number of AUCA alumni are employed at NASA, as well as branches of the US military. It is difficult to study, because I have a heavy course load. I have no time to be bored. It should be noted that students in this department are really strong. I am happy to be one of them.

I am a studious, bright and ambitious person. I believe that in my future I can achieve all my goals, one of which is to be able to support my family. I’m sure that education is the key to the country’s development. It is the investment for the future of every nation. I am hopeful that lenders will approve my loan so I can achieve my dreams and help my family have a better future.”

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Moussa est le seul homme dans le groupe avec le mouton sur la photo.
Moussa est un malien âgé de 52 ans, cultivateur et emboucheur, marié et père de 4 enfants dont un scolarisé, sa femme est ménagère et fait le petit jardinage afin d’avoir des condiments. Ils habitent dans un village très enclavé au Mali ; Moussa lit et écrit correctement en langue  nationale ceux qui lui permet d’assurer le secrétariat de son groupe dont il est le seul homme. Moussa rêve de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de son village en somme.
Il fait recourt au RMCR pour  prendre de l’argent pour  son l’embouche, c’est-à-dire qu’il achète des béliers maigres,  les mettent à l’embouche  pour être engraisser. Après des mois d’entretien il les revend et fait un bénéfice de 35.000fcfa au moins par bélier. Il s’approvisionne et revend ses produits dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. L’intérêt lui sert à acheter : des habits additionnels pour sa femme et ses enfants, des animaux (une façon d’épargner), de payer la scolarisions, les frais de soin sanitaire et de la nourriture quelque fois si la sècheresse frappe les champs. Les fumiers produit par les béliers aident Moussa à régénérer ses champs, ceux qui lui motive plus. Il exerce ce métier depuis 20 ans et ne rencontre pas d’obstacle entravant le bon fonctionnement de son activité
texts.en:
Moussa, age 52, is the only man in the group. He is standing next to the seep in the photograph. He's Malian, married, and the father of four children. Out of them, one goes to school.

Moussa is a farmer and he also fattens livestock. His wife is a housekeeper and a small-scale gardener who grows condiments. They live in a very enclaved village in Mali.

Moussa can read and write the national language correctly, which enables him to function as the group's secretary. He is the only man in the group. His dream is to improve the standard of living of his family and his village.

He is seeking help from Kiva's partner, RMCR, to get funds for his business. He buys meager rams and fattens them. After taking care of them for several months, he resells them. He turns a profit of at least XOF 35'000 per ram.

He gets his supplies and resells during the weekly fairs in his area. The profits are used to buy additional clothes for his wife and children, to buy animals (as a form a investment), to pay healthcare and school expenses, and to buy food when droughts occur.

Manure produced by the rams help Moussa to regenerate his fields, which is an additional motivation. He's been carrying out this trade for twenty years, and never faced obstacles preventing the smooth operation of his business.

loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and resell

loans.name: Sahnaz

texts.en:
Sahnaz is 43 years old, and a married woman. She, along with her husband, has been doing a business of buying and selling animals for many years. She is keen to provide a better standard of living for her family members.  

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 52 years old and works very hard to make a living.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, noodles, eggs, and candles to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, including those listed above and more.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, noodles, eggs, and candles to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 43 years old and two of her children are in school.

Evelyn has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes and related items to sell in her stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her stall

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena works hard to support her family. Ma. Magdalena is married and has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Magdalena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Ma. Magdalena has been in this business for eight years.

Ma. Magdalena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorinda

texts.en:
Lorinda is 55 years old and widowed, with eight children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lorinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Lorinda has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group-E

texts.en:
Sanjuta, the lady standing on the left in the picture, is 27 years old, living with her husband, parent-in-laws and children. Three years ago, her husband met with an accident and lost his vision. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her. In those days she had two cows so she managed to cover her family expenses by selling milk, but that was not sufficient. After one year she purchased another cow to earn more money as her children's study expenses are increasing. Now she wants to purchase another jersey cow so that she can sell still more milk and milk products. She said, "If I get a jersey cow, I can sell more milk so I can spend more money on my children's studies." 

She, along with Muktadei, has requested a loan amount of 24,000 INR from which she will use her portion for purchasing a jersey cow. She wants her children to graduate from a good college, and she needs to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a jersey cow

loans.name: Maa Kesherpaliani Group-C

texts.en:
The "Maa Kesherpaliani Group-C" is a newly formed group made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation.

Bhaila is the lady in the picture who is standing first from left, the featured borrower of the group. She is 46 years old and a married mother of two children. She sells seasonal fruits and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than 10 years. She sells fresh fruits like oranges, apples, bananas, pineapples, and guavas.

With her new loan, Bhaila plans to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings to better establish her business. Other members of the group, Mukta and Prabati, are engaged in milk selling and fish selling, respectively.

Bhaila and her group are very happy for this loan and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Maa Kesherpaliani Group-D

texts.en:
Manika is a 46-year-old lady who lives with her husband and her two children in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing first from the left is Manika.

Manika is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Manika formed a group with another woman, Baidi, from her village with the group name of "Maa Kesherpaliani Group-D". Baidi is engaged with vegetable cultivation to alleviate her family's poverty.

Manika is the featured borrower of this group. She motivated Baidi to form this group so they could help and support each other in their businesses and personal lives.

Manika, along with Baidi, requested a loan of 24,000 India Rupees (INR). She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Kesherpaliani Group-A

texts.en:
In 2014, three women from a village of Koraput district stepped out and decided to build a secured future for their families. They formed a group named “Maa Kesherpaliani Group-A”. The members of Maa Kesherpaliani Group-A are all women. One of them is Namita, who was selected as the featured borrower. The lady standing first from the left in the photo is Namita. 

Namita is 36 years old and is living with her husband and her child. Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered two other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. She leased some land and started vegetable cultivation on a small scale. She started with a limited supply of vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes and grew to sell more than seven varieties such as brinjal (eggplant), cucumbers, beans, carrots, and radishes. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village, as she sells fresh and high-quality vegetables. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Now she has a new idea of doing maize cultivation, for which she has requested a loan to utilize for the resources necessary to grow maize. A portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to pay for resources such as maize seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group-D

texts.en:
Sunamani, the lady standing on the left in the picture, is 31 years old, a married woman living with her parent-in-laws, husband and her two children. Sunamani owns a grocery shop from which she earns 3,000 to 3,500 INR per month. Her husband helps her to run this grocery shop. He brings grocery items from the nearby market. She is facing lots of financial problems with monthly household expenses and her children's studies. Now she wants to buy grocery items in bulk so she can manage more items in her shop. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 INR each for both the members and she will use her portion for purchasing sugar, tea, biscuits, edible oil, spices, etc. She wants to provide her family the basic necessities of living and save some money for her children's studies. Subarna is engaged in paddy cultivation.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing sugar, tea, biscuits, edible oil, spices, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Maa Kesherpaliani Group-B

texts.en:
Nila, aged about 27 years, is the featured borrower for the three members of the group "Maa Kesherpaliani Group-B" of Koraput district of Odisha state in India. Her family is composed of five members: herself, her husband, her parents-in-law, and one child. The member standing first from the left in the photo is Nila. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a grocery/general store in her village with the support of her husband for the last five years.

Nila, along with the other two members from her village, formed a group, and it is the first time they will take out a loan from People's Forum for development of their existing businesses. At present, her family income is about Rs. 5,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan. From the loan, she will purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, etc., as general household items for resale.

She has a dream: to build a house for her family. She is excited to have this loan, and she is very thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, shampoo, detergent, soap, rice, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 55-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education.

Rahila is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group -1A

texts.en:
Champa is a 31-year-old lady engaged in selling goats and goat milk. Currently, she has 10 goats. From this activity, she is able to make 3,000 INR per month. She, along with two other women from her village, created a group named "Maa Thakurani Group -1A" and Champa is the featured borrower of this group. In the picture, the lady standing in the middle is Champa. The group is made up of members having the purpose of helping and supporting each other in their business activities and in their personal lives. 

Champa lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her two children. Her husband is a daily laborer and sometimes he helps in Champa's business activities. Champa and her husband both take on all the family's responsibilities. Champa has a dream of making a house for her family and educating her children. Champa, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Champa will use her portion to purchase more goat kids for her animal-raising business. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more goat kids

loans.name: Falak Naz

texts.en:
Falak Naz is a 36-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Falak Naz is also providing sewing services to earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She is in need of different kinds of goods e.g. needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories, and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Falak Naz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy goods, e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 47 years old and married. She has managed a sari-sari store for five years and makes it grow as years go by. It has been a good business for her family because she has earned PHP 5,000 a month from this business. She decided to take a loan again to purchase additional grocery items to sell so that she can generate additional income.

In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. Amalia is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Laguna, Philippines. She is a single mother and has one child. She is employed to a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Alma works as a tailor. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company or client’s demand. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machines, but also often does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Alma is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They often have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Alma is asking for your assistance to prevent her from engaging with loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in returning it since the loan payment was being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for her pawned ATM card.

Alma hopes to give her family a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills at a quality for jobs, to cultivate savings consciousness, and to provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

**CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and married. Grace has three children who are in school.

Grace is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies needed to raise her livestock.

Grace has been raising pigs for eight years, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Hy's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Preah Vihear province, Hy is 55 years old and a mother of five children. For her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has involved this business for ages, and earns her about 13,900 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's healthy living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Morena works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling used clothing. Ma. Morena is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables for business to sell.

Ma. Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Victoria has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla is 61 years old and married with one child. Hermocilla works very hard to provide for her family.

Hermocilla runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Hermocilla has been in this business for 28 years. 

In the future, Hermocilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran  is 53 years old, a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son (also shown in the photo); he assists his mother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to a maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. 

She is positive about her future earnings, and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea

loans.name: Maa Kesherpaliani Group-E

texts.en:
Nilaindrei, shown in the photo standing first from left, is a 41-year-old woman who is married and has two children who are in school. She lives in a small village in Odisha, India.

Nilaindrei produces and sells flowers in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents, who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Nilaindrei’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Nilaindrei has more than 20 years of experience in this trade. She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group member could help one another and improve their standard of living.

Nilaindrei will use her loan to buy supplies (such as fertilizer) and to pay for labor so that she can maintain her flower plants. She dreams of increasing her flower plantings so that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group -1B

texts.en:
The Maa Thakurani Group -1B consists of three members from a small village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. All of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead. One person who deserves to be highlighted is Chandradei (in the picture the lady standing first from left), who works selling vegetables. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. 

Chandradei is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and others so that she can continue with her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Jay Ganga Mata Group-C

texts.en:
Alafa is a 22-year-old married lady living with her son, aged 2 years, and husband in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She owns and manages a tailoring shop where she stitches clothes for her customers, when they place orders for stitching. She stitches salwars, blouses, and suits, all of which are Indian traditional dress clothing, for her customers. She has one sewing machine in her shop. She has a very good relationship with her customers but she is not able to take orders in large amounts as she has only one sewing machine. She has a plan to purchase one more sewing machine for her shop and appoint another person as her helper, so that she can take orders in bulk and satisfy her customers.

Alafa and her group partner have applied for a loan amount of 12,000 India Rupees (INR) each. Alafa will use her portion for purchasing a sewing machine and fabric, and for appointing a person as her helper in her shop. She has a dream to have her son study in a good school and save some money for his higher studies. In the picture the lady standing in left is Alafa.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a sewing machine and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group -1C

texts.en:
Basanti is a 21-year-old lady who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing first from the right is Basanti. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Basanti joined a group with two other women(Samari and Padmini) from her village with the group name of "Maa Thakurani Group -1C". All the group members are engaged in different business activities such as selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc. to alleviate their poverty. 

Basanti is an active member of this group. She motivated Samari and Padmini form this group so they could help and support each other in their businesses and personal lives. Basanti, along with her group, requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 26 years old and married with one child who is in school, Sofia works very hard to provide for them.

Sofia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, condiments, and other groceries.

Sofia has been in this business for 11 years now. 

In the future, Sofia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, condiments and other groceries

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de joyería. Inicio el negocio hace 3 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como relojería y pulseras nuevas.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Carlos is a man with all batteries charged ready to meet the world and have a full life thanks to his efforts. 

He has a store where he sells jewelry. He opened it three years ago and despite the short time in operation it has been well received in the sector. 

He wants to expand his products and improve his sales by injecting capital into his business which is why he is asking for a loan to give him the opportunity of being more prosperous. The money will be invested in merchandise that he currently does not have such as new watches and bracelets. 

He has high hopes for his business and thinks that his future can be considerably improved thanks to the help of organizations such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that he currently does not have such as new watches and bracelets

loans.name: Ely Johana

texts.es:
Elsy es una joven de tan solo 23 años de edad, ella se separó de su pareja con la cual tuvo una princesa de 2 años de edad, ella trabaja desde su casa ofertando servicios de manicura, pedicura, peinados y aplanchados, actividades que aprendió gracias a unas capacitaciones que tomó.

Desde que inició su negocio ha ido escalando poco a poco, la idea es ir invirtiendo en equipos para darle forma a su negocio de salón de belleza pues aspira a que esta profesión sea el sustento de ella y su hija y el artífice de un sueño que es comprar una vivienda propia.

Elsy quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en las siguientes tres cosas:
•	Espejo
•	Tocador
•	Lava-cabezas
texts.en:
Elsy is a young woman aged just 23 years old. She is separated from her partner, with whom she has a little princess who is now two years old. 

Elsy works from home offering the following services: manicures, pedicures and blow-drying and hair straightening. Elsy learnt these skills via some trainings she completed. The business has been growing bit by bit since it started. 

The idea is to invest in equipment so as to create a complete beauty salon. Elsy aspires to have a profession that will support herself and her daughter and her dream one day is to buy her own home. 

Elsy wants a loan to invest in the following three things: dressing room area, a mirror, hair-washing equipment.

loans.use: to buy a dressing room area, a mirror, hair-washing equipment,to give her business the look and feel of a beauty salon.

loans.name: Iraj

texts.en:
Iraj is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two daughters; her children are studying. Her husband has been running his own garment business for the past 17 years. Her husband is only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Iraj's husband needs to purchase different types of garments in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Iraj is applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Iraj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her husband's garment business by purchasing in bulk

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group -1D

texts.en:
Maa Thakurani Group -1D consists of three women from a village of Koraput district in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. One of them is Somari, who was selected as the featured borrower of Maa Thakurani Group -1D. The lady standing first from the right side in the photo is Somari.

Somari is a 47-year-old widowed woman and is staying with her two children, who are in school. Her husband passed away seven years ago. She hopes to see her children as successful persons in their lives. She has a few acres of land in her village, and she is using her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her elder son is supporting her in this activity.

Somari and her group have requested this loan. Her portion will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation, including vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges. Somari and her group are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
After the 6 months of the loan period, the Sari Pertami group has been running their pig businesses well. The pigs grew healthy and fat. They gave them nutritious feed and vitamins. The group also had a high price when they sold the pigs together to the big buyer. Most of them are satisfied with the result.

Ni Ketut sold her piglets. Now she is well known as a piglet seller in her village. Having support from her husband, she is determined to increase the business to support her family. She will set aside the profit, save it and use it to pay the education needs of her children.

The Sari Pertami group is located in a village in the west part of Bali, with Ni Ketut as the head. They decided to have a new loan. Still with the pig business, they will use the loan to develop the business and they hope can have enough savings at the end and use it for business capital.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase a sow. She plans to save all the profit and hopes all the pigs grow well. One member can’t attend the meeting and the board of the group is responsible to receive her loans.

loans.use: to purchase a sow.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 54 years old and lives in Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has five children. Elma has a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business and earns approximately 9,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan to buy stock for her business. Elma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elma hopes to have her own display outlet.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 54 years old, is married with two kids and is a resident of Sina-ad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She has been in this business for more than a decade. 

She became a member of Paglaum MPC last June 2011. Recently, Nida decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable-vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
Brigilda is married with five children. She is 57 years old and lives in Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga. Brigilda is a farmer growing vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers so as to have more produce. Brigilda has been a member of PMPC for seven years. Someday, she hopes to harvest more vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for vegetables.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 43 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Elenita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 34 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Charity works very hard to provide for them.

Charity runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, groceries, etc.

Charity has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Charity would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, groceries.

loans.name: Amit

texts.en:
Amit lives in Bhubaneswar. He is a 25-year-old single guy. He is a bachelor student majoring in Banking and Finance. Amit chose this major because it is easier to find jobs in this field at this time.

He has been facing some financial problems that prevent him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. Thus, he has applied for an education loan to help him pay for his course fees.

Amit always has felt supported with the help of his father, who is a farmer. As the years go on, he feels more excited about his studies, for which he wants to have all of the necessary tools to continue being an excellent student. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to pay for his banking course fees. In his plans is to study a technical career upon finishing his undergraduate degree.

loans.use: to pay for his banking course fees.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, therefore her husband wants to buy a new rickshaw and increase the income to manage the household. 

Her husband wants to buy a rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing the rickshaw. Therefore Dilshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Dilshad is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing a new rickshaw

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 38-year-old married woman who has been running a school for 10 years. When she started her school, Nabeela faced many obstacles. However, she believes that if you are determined and if you work hard, you can achieve your dreams. 

Today, there are over 150 students in her school of which over 100 are girls. Nabeela is proud of her achievements, but wants to continue to improve her school. She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to construct new classrooms so that she can enroll more students.

loans.use: to construct new classrooms so that she can enroll more students.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shehnaz is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Vikas

texts.en:
Vikas is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Varanasi city, Uttar Pradesh, India but he lives in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. His family lives in the village from where he comes. His father works as a farmer from which he earns a very low income, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

Vikas is a student in KIIT University, Bhubaneswar where he studies Banking and Finance. He wants to complete the PGDBM degree to find a job in the future.

Vikas took a loan from People's Forum. This loan will help him to pay the university course fees. This will help him to finish his degree faster.

loans.use: to pay for his banking and finance course fees.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, y al engorde de toretes, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual inicio con una novilla que su padre le regalo, el objetivo de la crianza de ganado es para poder producir leche y así comercializarlas a los procesadores para que pueda tener mejores ingresos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 toretes para engorde y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Margoth, 57 years of age, lives in her own home with her husband. She makes her living raising cattle and young beef bulls. For more than 20 years, she has been making her living in this business, which she started when her father gave her a heifer as a gift.

The goal of raising cattle is to be able to produce milk and then sell them to processors in order to have better earnings.

She is applying for a loan to buy 2 young beef bulls to be able to continue with her work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy 2 young beef bulls.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 58 years old and is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Elisa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Welhilma

texts.en:
Welhilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Welhilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Welhilma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Otilia Patricia

texts.es:
Otilia, de 19 años, inicio con un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras y venta de empanadas hace aproximadamente 1 año con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus dos hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día sus hijos tienen 6 y 8 años y se han convertido en la alegría de esta mujer trabajadora.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la preparación de empanadas.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Otilia para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Otilia, 19, started a business of renting washing machines and selling empanadas approximately one year ago, with the intention of finding work that generates an income to survive. 

Now, she is tirelessly motivated to work by her two children, which is how she hopes to give them the best for their lives and development. Her two children are currently six and eight years old, and they have become this hard-working woman's happiness.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make empanadas. With this loan she will be able to support her business and her children, giving them a higher quality of life.

Support Otilia so that she can continue with her work!

loans.use: to buy supplies to make empanadas.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and has one child. Marilyn is a married woman.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds and fertilizer for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 7 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her business

loans.name: Mahesh

texts.en:
Extra efforts, all-nighters, and sacrifices are always worth it when it come to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life. Mahesh is well aware of this, because he has always counted his goal as becoming a good banker and financial adviser. Now he has reached the last step in completing his degree and entering the working era that any professional lives in.

Mahesh is asking for a loan to pay off his PGDBM (Post graduate diploma in banking management) course fees and accomplish his dream. He also hopes to specialize in banking and Finance, and in the long run, to establish a financial advisory services. This enthusiastic young man of only 24 years urges young people to make an effort reaching for their dreams because, just like him, they can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for his PGDBM course fees.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un comerciante de la zona del parque de bello, es ambulante, sale diariamente en su carro a vender su mercancía que son aparatos para realizar burbujas de jabón, dicha actividad le ha podido recoger dinero suficiente por lo menos para el mantenimiento de sus necesidades de 1 grado como lo son alimento, comida y techo.

Jaime es un hombre de 48 años separado por lo que su negocio es su único medio de distracción, de apoyo y como aprecia lo que hace busca tener sostenibilidad y seguir ejerciendo su profesión, goza ver los niños felices haciendo y reventando las burbujas de jabón.

Jaime quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para realizar el líquido para realizar las burbujas, igualmente los envases donde van empacados.
texts.en:
Jaime is a street vendor in the area of Parque Bello. He goes out every day with his cart to sale his merchandise, which are devices to make bubbles.

He has been able to make enough money to at least support his basic needs such as food and a roof. 

Jaime is 48 years old, he is separated, so his business is his main occupation. He likes what he does, so he wants to keep working in this job. 
He loves seeing the kids having fun playing and bursting the bubbles. 

Jaime wants to request a loan to buy the substance to make the bubbles, and also the bottles to carry it.

loans.use: to buy the liquid and the bottles to make bubbles.

loans.name: Tapas

texts.en:
Tapas is a 21-year-old single student who is from the Sukinda village of Jajpur district, Odisha. Currently, he is pursuing a post-graduate diploma in banking and finance management (PGDBFM) degree, majoring in banking, at a very reputed institute of Bhubaneswar, the capital city of Odisha state. His father is a farmer and his mother is a housewife.

Tapas is requesting a loan because he lacks the money to cover his course fees. This loan will help him earn the PGDBFM’s degree successfully. Following his dreams, Tapas hopes to have a good job and to save money to earn a Masters’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for his PGDBFM course fees.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one child, living in Siem Reap province, Sor is 33 years old. 

For her family's living conditions, she grows rice and she raises pigs to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about KHR 25,000 per day. 

This is Sor's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

Sor will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Enith De La Candelaria

texts.es:
Enith, es una joven de 29 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2008, monto su negocio de miscelánea, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Trabaja sola durante 14 horas todos los días.

Enith se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios y ropa, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Enith is a young, 29-year old lady who, for some time, has made her living doing various types of work, but always with a desire in mind to dabble in the commercial sector.

That is how, at the beginning of 2008, she started her general store, which has been very well received during the years that it has been in business. She works alone for 14 hours everyday.

Enith can be described as an enterprising and friendly woman, with vision and a great desire to get ahead. That is why she is motivated to apply for a loan, in order to invest it in purchasing merchandise such as accessories and clothes. The goal is to give the business a better image to attract more customers and offer them a variety of products to satisfy the needs and tastes of everyone who visits the business.

In this way, she will be able to earn money to continue supporting her home and to save to open various branches of her business and thus have a more prosperous future, where she will be able to clearly improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as accessories and clothes.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for ten years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Azra's husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore Azra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Azra's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost, and provide better transport facilities to earn more profitable income. Azra also plans to create savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Azra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Négueting est l’homme qui tient le mouton en main sur la photo.
Néguéting est un adulte de 55 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants non scolarisés ; sa conjointe est ménagère.
Néguéting fréquenta l’école et quitte prématurément au primaire pour rejoindre son père aux champs. Il lit et écrit en langue national ; Il habite en zone rural au Mali avec sa famille.
Il pratique l’embouche des moutons en plus de l’agriculture, il achète des béliers maigre les engraisse et les revend aux commerçants de bétail et aux bouchers. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés locaux et y revend ses produits.
Il fait un bénéfice de 25.000fcfa par tête, ses bénéfices lui servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
Il fait recourt au RMCR pour renforcer sa capacité dans l’exercice de ses activités, les fonds reçus sont utilisés dans l’achat de béliers pour l’embouche.
Néguéting  fait l’embouche depuis 13 ans et estime que le soutien de l’institution est capital pour le développement de cette activité.
En plus de l’intérêt  reçu, il trouve que l’engrais organique produit par les animaux est très encourageant, car ils augmentent la production de ses champs et réduit considérablement les couts d’achat d’intrants  pour l’agriculture. Les épidémies des moutons  nous fatiguent quelque fois, mais le service de la santé animal joue  un très grand rôle pour l’éradiquer.
texts.en:
Négueting is the man in the photo holding a sheep. He is a 55-year-old adult and a married father of three children not in school; his spouse is a housewife. He attended school and dropped out prematurely in primary school in order to join his father in farming. He reads and writes the national language; he lives in a rural area in Mali with his family. 

Négueting raises sheep in addition to being a farmer. He purchase underweight rams, fattens them, and resells them to animal traders and to butchers. He supplies himself from the local markets and resells his products there. He makes a profit of 25,000 francs CFA per head. His profits are used to improve his family’s living conditions. 

Négueting has turned to RMCR to bolster his capacity to do business. The funds in hand are used to purchase rams to fatten. He has been fattening livestock for thirteen years and thinks that the microfinance institution’s support is critical to developing his business. 

In addition to the profits made, he finds that organic fertilizer products from the animals is very encouraging, since he augments his crops production and reduces considerably the cost of purchasing farm inputs. Sheep epidemics sometimes are exhausting, but the animal health service plays a big role in eradicating them.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to resell later

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shehnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shehnaz also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 52-year-old woman, and a mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her son is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Shehnaz's son needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her son is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This way, she can help her son to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her son wanted to increase his fruit business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 40, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Angelina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angelina dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of groceries and other merchandise she needs to expand her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.en:
Maria Reina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and her four children are in school.

Maria Reina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

Maria Reina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Julio Rafael

texts.es:
Julio tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.
Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar surtido de ingredientes como harina, queso, levaduras, entre otros.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más optima pues tendrá una mejor materia prima.
texts.en:
Julio has a lot of experience in baking. Some time ago, he started his own bakery, which has given him very good results so far. He has always preferred to work independently. He works everyday from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm.
