He is currently in need of assistance to buy a variety of ingredients such as flour, cheese, and yeast, among others. The loan will allow him to work under better conditions and will be able to guarantee the quality of his products.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a large bakery which supplies various stores.

With this help, he will be able to work in a more optimal way, because he will have better ingredients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ingredients such as flour, cheese, and yeast, among others.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Rosenda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like coffee, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosenda has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like coffee, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando junto con su pareja se han convertido en muy buenos socios, no solo se unieron amorosamente, juntaron sus actividades para crear un solides financiera para el hogar que comparten. Orlando tiene un negocio de reciclaje y su pareja tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos, se colaboran mutuamente en ambos negocios algo muy bello.

Orlando por su parte es un hombre de 37 años de edad, como lo habíamos mencionado anteriormente tiene un negocio de reciclaje y es este donde quiere que centren su atención pues en la foto se puede observar la necesidad que le urge atender con rapidez y es el techo de su bodega que está en un pésimo estado y ya ha tenido problemas cuando se presentan lluvias.

Orlando solicita de manera muy amena un apoyo para poder reparar rápidamente el techo del negocio, la razón es que a una persona con su tipo de trabajo le sale más cómodo pagar por cuotas ya que tiene que tener capital de trabajo disponible para comprar el reciclaje que diariamente le ofrecen,
texts.en:
Orlando and his partner have become very good business partners. The didn't just get together romantically, they joined their businesses to create financial strength for the home that they share.

Orlando has a recycling business, and his partner has a food sales business. They work beautifully together in both businesses.

Orlando, for his part, is a 37-year old man. As was mentioned earlier, he has a recycling business, and that is where he wants to focus your attention, because in the photo, you can see the need that he urgently needs to attend to, which is the roof of his storeroom. It is in terrible shape, and he has already had problems when it rains.

Orlando is very pleasantly applying for assistance in order to repair the roof of his business quickly. The reason is that for someone in his line of work, it is easier to pay in installments, because he needs to have his working capital available to buy the recycling that is available everyday.

loans.use: to repair the roof, which, as you can see from the photo, urgently needs it.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nazia  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Preah Vihear province, Mao is 46 years old and a mother of five children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She can earn income of about 14,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day.

For Mao, this is her first time with VisionFund, a Kiva partner. In this group of seven members, she is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in better health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 30 years old and a single lady. Her brother (also shown in the photo with her) is running a small general store to make enough to support his family circle.

Rabia's brother is making a great effort to support his family. However, he faces a financial problem in the growth of his business. For this reason, Rabia has accessed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) for her brother, to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time. She is positive about her brother’s future earnings and will spend part of income on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to meet the demand of customers, time after time.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es: Oscar de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y caña de azúcar, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a ese rubro, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono y control de plagas para tener una buena cosecha y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 40 years old, lives in his own home with his wife. He works in agriculture planting corn and sugar cane. He has worked 14 years in this occupation. He sells his products in different markets near his house. He pays for household expenses with his earnings. 

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pest control in order to have a better harvest and thus have better income.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pest control.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to bolster her capital and buy a large stock of clothing to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Viviana Isabel

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace un tiempo se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Viviana y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Viviana is a very enterprising woman.  She has a great desire to get ahead and advance.  For some time she has been selling products like clothes, accessories, beauty items, and household items by catalog.  She sells these products mainly to her friends, neighbors, and relatives.  They know Viviana, and they also want her to progress in her business activity.

Ever since she was very young she has had an affinity for commerce and sales.  Therefore, she now has great skills in this field thanks to her friendliness and excellent quality of service.

She is requesting a loan to buy stock of beauty products and clothes in order to increase her inventory and improve her sales.  This way she will be getting good earnings for her household.  She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the support of the good-hearted people who support these types of projects together the Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy stock of beauty products and clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Alphonse Group

texts.fr: Alphonse a commencé à cultiver le café depuis son mariage et a été grandement assisté par son épouse Jeanne. Actuellement, ils ont 14 enfants et c'est grâce au café qu'ils parviennent tant soit peu à répondre aux besoins familiaux. Il a besoin d'une main d'oeuvre qui pourra l'aider dans le sarclage de son champ et espère pouvoir réaliser une bonne production afin d'élever les revenus de leur ménage. Il est le chef du groupe et pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: Alphonse started growing coffee when he was married and has been very much assisted by his wife, Jeanne. Currently, he has fourteen children, and the two manage more often than not to meet family needs. Alphonse requires manual labor able to help him weed his field. He hopes to be able to have a good harvest in order to increase their household income. He is the head of the group and appears in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for weeding

loans.name: Fallak

texts.en: Fallak, age 29, is a married woman. Her husband, also shown in the photo, is doing business selling milk. He sells in his locality on his motor bike door-to-door. He earns a good amount of income to support his family. With the support of Kashf Foundation, Fallak has gradually improved the business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to purchase another buffalo to increase sales and earn profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase sales and earn profits as well.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
To earn a living, Charlita owns a farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell in the local community. With her generated income from the farm, her previous loan was successfully repaid. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDPMC) in the year 2011 and it has been her partner in her business activities. 

Now, Charlita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for the garden plants so that they will become productive. She hopes for more income, to use for her family's better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the garden plants.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 38-year-old married woman with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emelita has a business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of native mats to resell.

Emelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of native mats to resell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and has ten children. Victoria is married and four of her children are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Victoria has been in this business for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, bread, coffee, soft drinks, and biscuits to sell in her store.

Analiza has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from bicycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, snack foods, bread, coffee, soft drinks, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 43 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Arlene has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wire, shells, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wire, shells, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Emilda has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelina is 49 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Angelina has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Angelina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Arcelinda

texts.en:
Arcelinda is a married woman who has two children, both of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arcelinda is 43 years old.

Arcelinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Arcelinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Arcelinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is a married woman who has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arleen is 34 years old.

Arleen has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Arleen has been in this business for six years. In the future, Arleen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Asiscla

texts.en:
Asiscla is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Asiscla is 47 years old and four of her children are in school.

Asiscla has a general store business in the Philippines. Asiscla requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Asiscla has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Asiscla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Carmelita requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Fabio De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Fabio es un hombre emprendedor y aplicado, desde hace 40 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 
El vive en el municipio de Envigado.

El trabaja de lunes a sábado durante 10 horas atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de aguacate, plátano, frutas, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Señor Fabio is an enterprising, diligent man.  Forty years ago he started a vegetable shop, and it has been a good business through the present time. 

Señor Fabio is lives Envigado.  He works from Monday through Saturday for ten hours a day offering his services to a pretty large number of customers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a mix of avocados, bananas, fruit and other items so that he can meet the needs of the customers who are requesting said products. 

The help of this loan will allow Señor Fabio to add variety to his business.  It will also offer him the profitable opportunity to improve his sales and his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a mix of avocados, bananas, fruits and other items.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma operates a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Emma requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy another bicycle for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles appreciates Kiva lenders for the support they gave him for his previous loan. Charles' yields increased because of the manure that was spread in the banana plantation. 

Charles now needs 500,000 UGX to pay tuition for his daughter joining secondary school. He will repay the loan with proceeds from the bananas. Charles is hard working and committed to meeting his loan obligations. Thank you, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Kousar  has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy q greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: maintenance of the field

loans.name: Koser

texts.en: Koser is 53 years old, married and a vigorous lady. She is the mother of three children. She, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Solution for her stitching unit and increase her productive hours as well as income.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Afi est une femme veuve qui vit à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à sa charge. Afi est très dynamique et prépare du riz qu’elle vend à ses clients et trouve favorablement sa rentabilité grâce à ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au marché trois fois par mois. Pour commander des sacs de riz et des charbons pour faire sa préparation et attirer plus de clients, Afi sollicite ce microcrédit pour la réalisation de ses objectifs et pourvoir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi, age 43, is a widow who lives in Adidogomé with two dependent children. She is a very dynamic woman who has made a profitable business out of a rice dish that she prepares and sells to her customers. She buys her ingredients at the market three times per month. 

Afi is seeking this loan to buy rice and charcoal in order to prepare her rice dish and increase her client base. This will help her to achieve her goals and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal and six sacks of rice.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is 55 years old and a widow. The man shown in the photo is Ruqia’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Ruqia has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ruqia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Beatriz has been in this business for 6 years now.

Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cows.

Analyn has been raising cows for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cows.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Saturnina is 59 years old.

Saturnina has a blacksmithing business in the Philippines. Saturnina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like iron bars and steel for her blacksmithing business.

Saturnina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like iron bars and steel for blacksmithing

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Erlinda has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Michelle

texts.es: Michelle de 21 años de edad, es la propietaria de una refresquería desde hace 2 años; sus padres quienes eran antes su dueño, impulsaron el espiritu emprendedor de Michelle entregandosela para que generara sus propios ingresos, en ella vende bebidas refrescantes, galletería, pasabocas y jugos naturales, que son el deleite de sus clientes, en  un clima cálido, que impulsa el consumo de bebidas frias pemanentemente. Michelle en su negocio ofrece los productos de contado y trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, compra a proveedores reconocidos en el sector, con los que sostiene  relaciones comerciales de excelencia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finacamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará refrescos e insumos para preparar alimentos como empanadas y diversos pasabocas. Con esta inversión estará mas surtido su negocio e impactará del deseo de compra de su clientela y esto es justamente lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa, pus su mayor desafio es lograr incrmentar sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Michelle, who is 21 years old, has been the owner of a snack bar for two years. Her parents are the former owners. Michelle's entrepreneurial spirit drove her to take it over to generate her own income. In her store she sells soft drinks, cookies, snack and juices, which are the delight of her customers. The warm climate always drives the consumption of cold drinks.

In her business Michelle offers products on account. She works from 8am to 7pm. She purchases from suppliers known in the area and maintains excellent business relationships with them.

Currently she is applying for financing through Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy soft drinks and supplies to prepare foods like fried pies and various snacks. This investment will expand her product selection and make her clientele want to purchase more; this is exactly what makes a Kiva microloan a success. Her biggest challenge is to increase sales in order to increase income.

loans.use: buy soft drinks and supplies to prepare foods like fried pies and various snacks.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre muy alegre, virtuoso, consejero, un luchador de la calle, en su “chaza” que es el nombre que se le denomina al puesto de trabajo pequeño ha logrado generar los recursos que lo han mantenido desde el año 1999, en ese entonces era empleado, acabo un contrato y como tenía una edad considerable se le hizo muy difícil conseguir trabajo y míralo ahora trabajando dichoso vendiendo productos como cigarrillos, mecato(snaks, papas en bolsa, chicharrones, rosquitas, entre otros productos expedidos en bolsa hechos  de la papa y el plátano principalmente).

Francisco es un hombre separado de su esposa, sus 68 años de edad le imposibilitan aspirar a algo mejor y él no quiere, su deseo es continuar con su negocio donde tiene su amigos, ese puesto de trabajo que le salvo cuando estaba mal, y con el que pudo apoyar a sus tres hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de cigarrillos, frituras, y refrescos. Es un Abuelo apóyalo, personas como él quieren demostrar que sus ganas de trabajar están intactas.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very happy, skillful man who gives advice.  He is feisty.  In his “chaza,” which is the name he has given to his small sales stall, Francisco has been able to generate the income he needs to support himself since 1999.  At that time, he was employed.  His contract was up, and since he was older, he had a hard time finding work.  And look at him now, working happily selling products such as cigarettes, "mecato" (snacks, potato chips, pork rinds, pastries and other packaged potato and plantain products). 

Francisco is separated from his wife.  At 68-years old, he finds it impossible to aspire to something better, and he doesn't want to.  His desire is to continue working in his busienss where he has his friends and his sales stall, which held him up when he was down.  Through his business, Francisco was able to support his three children. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase a mix of cigarettes, fried food and beverages.  He is a Grandpa; help him out.  People like Francisco want to show that through their desire to work, they can remain cheerful.

loans.use: to purchase a mix of cigarettes, fried foods and beverages.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman and has one kid who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Chari has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for his business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 56 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Eleuteria works very hard to provide for the family.

Eleuteria runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries.

Eleuteria has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 39 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juditha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Juditha has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as  rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Juditha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for the family.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock items like shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks, and noodles to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, 54 years old, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Imelda has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan, 39 years old, is married and has four children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 12 years, Joan has run a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Rubiela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Rubiela es una señora con un corazón emprendedor y muy tierno, su amor de madre le ha bastado para saber que debe esforzarse por sacar adelante a sus hijos con unos excelentes valores y educación.

Ella tiene en propiedad un lote vacio que desea convertir en parqueadero público, pero para poder lograrlo debe realizar algunas reformas y obras en este espacio.

Por esta razón solicita un préstamo, pues comprara los materiales y la mano de obra para iniciar con estas obras.

Apoya a una madre muy trabajadora, emprendedora y tenaz.
texts.en:
Rubiela, at heart, is a resourceful, loving woman. Her motherly love has been enough to show her that she needs to work hard to help her children get ahead with excellent values and education.

She owns an empty lot which she would like to convert into a public parking lot, but to achieve this, she first needs to carry out some renovation work on the space.

This is why she is requesting the loan, so she can buy the materials and pay for labor to start this work.

Support a hard working, resourceful and tenacious mother.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to start renovation work

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 58-year-old woman and a mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a milk shop. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Khalida's husband needs to purchase milk for his business so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. However, due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase milk. Therefore Khalida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase the milk. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has eight children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Esther has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. Her major business challenge is creditors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. Esther is requesting this loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 39 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. She has a computer shop, and she also caters in photocopying, printing, etc. She has had this business for seven years.

She availed a loan to purchase additional computer unit. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Violeta wants her children to finish their studies and have a stable job.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer unit

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Edis Alfredo

texts.es: Edis de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edis, aged 32, lives in his own home with his mother. 

For more than twenty years he has been growing corn, beans and sorghum, and selling his products in the various markets near his home. With his earnings he is able to pay some of the household expenses. 

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control etc. and to improve the land that you can see in the photo, so that he can continue with his farming and receive a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control etc. and to improve his land

loans.name: Anonia

texts.en:
This is Antonia, 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Willardo, a mechanic. Antonia manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Antonia operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy general herbal/organic products from wholesalers, then sell them with a little profit. Her products are herbal coffee, supplements and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Antonia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of products she needs to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 39 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 6 years, Josephine has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear. Josephine has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Josephine has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elpedia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from fish vending. Elpedia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Elpedia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is a married with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Josephine has been in this business for seven years. Josephine earns additional income from food vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rukhtaaj

texts.en:
Rukhtaaj is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Rukhtaaj has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rukhtaaj is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband in repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Preah Vihear province, Him is 35 years old. Because of her family condition, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income by working for others for a fee. She can earn an income of about 15,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day.

This is Him's first time with VisionFund, a Kiva partner. In a group of five, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle with good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 13 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Fozia has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Fozia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Fozia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Fozia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Aisara

texts.ru: Айсара, 61 год, замужем, есть 6 взрослых и самостоятельных детей, все женаты, за исключением младшего сына. У Айсары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством. У Айсары в хозяйстве есть 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,80 Га собственной земельной доли, где она выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, огурцы и помидоры для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Айсары и ее дружной семьи. Бизнес Айсары приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян и селитры для обработки почвы. Это поможет Айсаре выращивать органические продукты. Доходы от кредита Айсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Aisara is 61 years old and married. She has six grown-up and independent children who are all married, with the exception of her youngest son. Aisara has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming. Aisara has a 1.0 hectare plot of rented land and her own 0.80 hectare plot of land on which she grows wheat, corn, cucumbers and tomatoes for sale. Thanks to the hard work of Aisara and her close-knit family, Aisara's business brings in an average monthly income of up to 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Aisara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 120,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers, seeds and nitrates for cultivating the land. This will allow Aisara to grow organic produce. Aisara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she can save money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and nitrates to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Margareth is 37 years old and lives outside of Honiara city with her four children. Two of her children are in secondary school, and the other two stay at home.

She does marketing of cooked foods and sells them in nearby schools to help her family in everyday needs. Sometimes she finds it difficult when school holidays come, so she decided to run a bakery.

She requested 3,400 SBD from SPBD to start off her bakery. Meanwhile, she’s using a frying pan to cook her cakes. She believes that accessing more loans will help her build a proper bakery shed with all the right equipment to do her bakery business.

Margareth’s future plan is to own a bakery shop and supply all the nearby small shops with her bakery products.

loans.use: to start her bakery.

loans.name: Anahi

texts.en:
Anahi is 55 years old and has 2 sons. The oldest is 23 years old and the other one is 17. Anahi is divorced but she has her own house. She works at a drugstore as an executive assistant. Anahi works from Monday to Saturday and the distance from her house to her job is very long.

Anahi needs your help to pay college and school tuition. She hopes you can help her because her ex-husband doesn't support his family.

loans.use: to pay college and school tuitions

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom was selected to be group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Kandal province.

1- Sreymom (in picture) is 29 years old and lives in Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2008 and has one daughter. She is still young. Sreymom has sold flowers for one year of experience, while her husband has been a driver for a private company for five years. She would like to apply for a loan of $300 to purchase more flowers to sell everyday.

2-Sreymich (in picture) is 20 years old and lives in Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2014, but hasn’t a child yet. Sreymich is a housewife, while her husband has been a construction worker for three years .She would like to apply for a loan of $300 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s work.

Photo: Sreymom is on the left and Sreynich is on the right.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, and  flowers to sell

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a hardworking woman. She was born in a small town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is working at the mountains. For about three years, Shoira has been working at company.

She has a dream to have a nice comfortable house. She is planning to take a 5,000 somoni loan for renovating her house. Shoira is asking for financial support from the Kiva project to renovate her house and make better conditions for living.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Three years ago, Jennifer started Mighty Oaks Montessori School to offer families in central Massachusetts an exceptional early childhood education and childcare experience for their children. Jennifer had worked in education for over 15 years, and her experiences with the Montessori system made her determined to expand access to this teaching philosophy that emphasizes independent learning for children and respect for children’s differing development rates. 

She decided to open a school in her hometown of Auburn, Mass. In less than three years, her school has grown from six to 25 students, and currently serves children ages 15 months to 5 years old. Her efforts have been well-received by the community, and she has observed steady annual increases in enrollment. Recently, the school was able to move to a larger facility. However, the expenses associated with the move, hiring new staff, and purchasing new equipment have depleted the school’s savings.

With this loan, Jennifer will be able to pay her employees and school building rent through this summer, giving her enough time to regenerate profits from her growing school. In order to support herself and her two daughters, as well as expand the educational services of her school, Jennifer hopes to soon own her own school building, and expand resources for her children. Jennifer hopes to continue to provide an environment in which young children can develop an independent mindset, self-confidence, and a love of learning — skills that will be beneficial for the rest of their lives.

loans.use: to sustain the movement of her Montessori school to a larger building by paying her employees and rent through this summer

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a hardworking woman. She was born and lives in small town. She is married with two children. She has been in business for almost ten years.

After graduation from secondary school, her parents did not have the money to educate their child. She had to get a job to help her parents with the finances. She worked at a production factory. She started her first business by getting a loan for 2,000 TJS for the purchase of domestic chemistry for her activity for cleaning fabric clothes. She found a working place in a densely populated area. By this means she increased her business and raised her annual income. Additionally she started to produce perfumes for the residential population at accessible prices.

Habiba is requesting a loan of 2,000 TJS to enlarge her facility for turnover of perfumes and domestic chemistries for her activity for cleaning fabric clothes at accessible prices.

loans.use: to buy facilities for perfume and domestic chemistries

loans.name: Geghanush

texts.en:
Geghanush lives alone in the village Shrvenanc of Syunik region. Her husband died two years ago. Geghanush has three sons all of them are married and they live with their families. Geghanush is a pedagogue with many years of experience but now she is retired. 

In her native village, Geghanush is happy with her agricultural activities. In her orchard she has apples, cherries, nut and plum trees and her land gives a tasty harvest of cabbage, carrots, and greens. She says that when she was young she raised a greater variety of fruits and vegetables. As she got older the entire assortment became smaller but she still raises and takes care of it with love and pleasure and receives modest income from its sale. 

Geghanush is asking for this loan to buy young apple and cherry trees , vegetable seedlings and she also wants to buy a water tank, to store water to water her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy young apple and cherry trees , vegetable seedlings, and a water tank to store water to water her plot of land.

loans.name: Aysun

texts.en:
Aysun is married and has one child.  She has been working for 10 years as a beauty specialist, selling products through network marketing.  She earns good money through working in multilevel marketing.  Wanting to benefit from micro-credit loans offered to women, she is now on her third loan, with which she purchased more products.  She wants to earn money and for her children to have a good life.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aysun Hanım,evli bir çocuk annesi, güzellik uzmanı olarak çalışmakta ve network yapmakta.  On yıldır çalışma hayatı var kadılara verilen mikro krediden faydalanmak istemiş.  Network ürünlerinden almış güzel paralar kazanmış.  Üçüncü kredisiyle network ürünleri aldı ve para kazanmak istiyor.  Çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Dolores is 49 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Dolores has a farming corn business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years and earn additional income from farming rice. She would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a massage parlor business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like massage oil, lotion, towel, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like massage oil, lotion, towel, etc. for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Virginia requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Catherine, a youthful 26-year-old mum and a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, in the Central region of Kenya. Catherine is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with a lovely child. 

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, fruits, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Catherine has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family, “she said. 

Catherine mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Catherine is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she suffers so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan, Catherine is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Catherine feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Catherine will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and increase her income level. Catherine is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Catherine will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Leang Hy

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Phnom Srouch district, Kampong Speu province, Leang Hy is a 25-year-old single man. To earn a living, he has been teaching at a local private school for five years. Apart from teaching, he is also a security guard.

Leang Hy is a new member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is applying for a loan in order to continue his study at university. He is interested in studying to become an English teacher. Without a bachelor’s degree, it is hard for Leang Hy to have a better wage, which is why he needs to have a degree.

loans.use: to go to university.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sokkhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokkhoeurn is from a rural village in Prey Prorsorb district, Kratie province. Age 45, Sokkhoeurn is married with four children who are livng with her. To support the family, she has been planting cassava for 31 years. Some of her children have taken work as rubber tappers and factory workers. She can earn 5 USD a day. This is her fourth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR for her cassava plantation. It will be used to buy fertilizer, cassava stems, and a water pump. She hopes that the profit from the plantation will improve her family's living standard. 

Note: This picture is with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, cassava stems, and a water pump

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Thoern is aged 50 years and widowed with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, earning a living through farming rice and sometimes she also works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. 

Thoern can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 8,000 each day for future needs.

This is Thoern’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thoern will use her portion to buy fertilizers and to spend for labor. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en:
Voeun, age 20, lives with family members in a rural village of the Preah Vihear province and is a mother of two young children. She can earn income to support her family’s living by growing rice and working for others for a fee. She has involved this business for age and it earns her about 28,300 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day. This is first time for Voeun with VisionFund, a Kiva partner.

Voeun leads a group of four members to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Savong

texts.en:
Residing in Banteay Meas district, Kampot province, Savong is a 39-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is a secondary school student, while another child is preparing to enter university. Her primary income is from farming rice. She also raises livestock. She can earn 5 USD daily and save half of it. Being a new member with Visionfund (Kiva’s partner), Savong is seeking for a loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition fee. Her daughter is planning to study accounting. She hopes that all of her children receive a higher education so that they can have a better life. 

Note: This picture is with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fee

loans.name: Asia Naseer

texts.en:
Asia Naseer is a 55 year old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 6 years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Asia Naseer's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Asia Naseer has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more a profitable income.

Asia Naseer is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance .

loans.use: to help her husband increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 21-year-old lady who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son. 

She is a new active borrower from BRAC Pakistan, and her husband wishes to open a tuition academy to provide a better education for the children.  Therefore,  sana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan,  sana,s husband can afford to open the academy easily to provide a better education and thus earn a profitable income. 

Sana also plans to make savings from the profit of her husband's income and meet her family's needs in future.

Sana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to open an academy to provide education

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is an old man aged 52 with eight children, six of whom attend school. He deals in cattle fattening and also carries out farming such as growing matooke (cooking bananas) as his side business. He works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day. He started his business to supplement his income and to diversify his sources of income.

George has acquired this loan to purchase more cows for the business. His clients are cattle traders from different cities.

His future hope is to expand the business and to educate his children. The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital. He describes himself as a hardworking man who appreciates the work lenders are doing.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd mdi. She is a resident of Kitebi, in Kampala District.  She is also a married woman, aged 33 years old, with 3 children who all attend school.

Eron owns a workshop and is a tailor who makes school uniforms, sweaters, and other tailoring business in all parts of the country. However, in a bid to increase her working capital for the workshop, she decided to come to Ugafode for a loan of ugx1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), and she is very grateful to Kiva funders and Ugafode for the financial assistance given to her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more material for making clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to apply to her eastern crops.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 47 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband(who is also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Prosper Dev't Group Kawuku

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children. She is a new client who was inspired by a repeat client. She is grateful to Kiva lenders through UGAFODE and she has requested a loan of UGX 500.000. Rose is taking this loan to buy more beverages to increase the stock of her shop thus increasing her sales and profit.

She is hardworking and thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for being there for her and her group in times of financial need. She encourages fellow women to be innovative instead of depending on their husbands for everything.

The sixth person in the photo is the group chairperson who already has a running loan but not in this cycle (seated) first left. She signed the waiver form while the one standing in an orange blouse extreme right is the UGAFODE staffer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy beverages to boost the business.

loans.name: Rasheeda Bibi

texts.en:
Rasheeda Bibi is a 59-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband has owned a clinic shop for the past seven years. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of its members and income with her husband to manage the household.

Her husband needs to buy several items like tables, chairs, medicine tools, and other accessories for her medical clinic, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Rasheeda has applied the Kiva Loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help his husband  to earn a maximally profitable income so that she can fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Rasheeda Bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, medicine tools, and other accessories for her medical clinic

loans.name: Kuma

texts.fr: Kuma est une femme mariée avec un enfant. Kuma est âgée de 35 ans et travaille dynamiquement pour le bien-être de sa famille. Kuma vit à Yokoè pour vendre des pagnes dans les marchés et parcoure les quartiers pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour disposer de ses articles en permanence, Kuma s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Kuma demande ce crédit pour commander pagnes et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Kuma is a married woman with one child. She is 35 years old and works very hard for the well-being of her family. She lives in Yokoè and sells traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric at the markets and as a street vendor to meet customer demand. In order to have merchandise always on hand, Kuma stocks up twice a month. She is applying for this loan to stock up on pagnes and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 12 sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Elda

texts.pt:
A senhora Elda  é avicultora, tem 47 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 1 filho já maior de idade, sustenta um primo  e um neto ambos órfãos e vivem com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, chapas, pedra, blocos,  para ampliar o aviário e aumentar as rações para os pintos . 
Diz que seu sonho é  adquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal e diz que tem outro espaço onde tem projecto de fazer outra casa num futuro breve.
Principais desafios insufienciência de fundos  e diz que faz xitique mensal e faz depósitos no banco e irá solicitar mais empréstimos. Conta também com ajuda do seu esposo motorista.
texts.en: Elda is a 47-year-old poultry farmer. She is married and the mother of one adult son. She also supports a cousin and a grandson, both of whom were orphaned and live with her in her house. She says she will use this loan to buy cement, sheet metal, rocks, and cinder blocks to expand her chicken coop and to buy more chicken feed. Her dream is to buy a car for her personal use and she also says she has a plot where she plans to build a new house someday in the near future. Her main challenge is a lack of funds, but she has access to a monthly xitique [traditional savings system], makes deposits in the bank, and she plans to take out future loans. She also relies on the support of her husband, who works as a driver.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, rocks, and cinder blocks to expand her chicken coop and to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Idimo

texts.en: Idimo is a very friendly, polite and responsible woman. She is married, 43 years old, and the mother of three children.  Her oldest son is 22 years old and currently making a living abroad.  Her youngest son is 13 and a student  in secondary school.  Her daughter is 18.  Idimo works as a seamstress from home.  She receives orders and sews Tajik traditional clothes.  She is taking a loan to buy a sewing machine.  The machine she is currently using is in poor condition and Idimo needs to buy a new one in order to keep her job and her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Javshana

texts.en:
Javshana is a communicable woman. She was born in 1988. She is living in the western part of the country. She is a sewer. She sews traditional dresses for women. 

She is divorced and has one child. She experienced challenges about four years ago.  Her husband had tuberculosis and three months after the wedding, he died.She was pregnant and was thrown out of her husband's house. Now Javshana became stronger and has patience. She got a loan and bought a sewing machine. She is independent, feeds her family and supports her daughter. She is merciful for the Kiva project for the support of lonely women. 

Her mother is sick now and needs to be operated on. She wants to treat her in a medical clinic and is seeking financial support. Javshana is asking for financial support to treat her mother in a medical clinic.

loans.use: to pay to treat her mother in a medical clinic

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
You have never seen such wonderful national Tajik women's dresses such as those sewn by Mavzuna. She is 20 years old and single. The fast development of the modern world makes her more progressive. 

Two month ago Mavzuna was a participant at start-up training and decided to begin her own business, sewing national women's dresses. She needs to buy a new sewing machine and fabric. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
Nicasia es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, y una hija mujer de 16 años, y su negocio es el reciclado de llantas de goma.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, un área residencial y marginada de la ciudad, casas rústicas y antiguas muchas sin acceso a agua conviven formando un lugar de manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados. 
Nicasia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y se encuentra constantemente de viaje, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de diferentes artículos con materiales reciclados con neumáticos de automóvil. Los productos que fabrica, son; maceteros, alfombras, abarcas (especie de chinela), entretenidos columpios, contenedores y otros. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con bastante material de trabajo, hay gran cantidad de llantas tiradas en las calles y terrenos baldíos, sin contar las del relleno sanitario. “inicié mi negocio con ayuda de mi hermana, al principio sólo realizábamos alfombras y abarcas, luego continuamos con los maceteros, ahora quiero especializarme en la fabricación de muebles ecológicos…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con una empresa grande de muebles ecológicos, ella desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo, como; pintura, brochas, tornillos y otros para reciclar neumáticos de automóvil y fabricar muebles ecológicos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nicasia solicita un préstamo para reciclar neumáticos de automóvil y fabricar muebles ecológicos para ayudar a salvar el planeta.
texts.en:
Nicasia is a 46-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has two sons (ages 10 and 8) and a 16-year-old daughter. Her business involves recycling rubber tires.

Nicasia is a good mother who is enterprising, strong, patient, responsible, and hardworking. Her business operates in an area to the south of the city, which is a marginalized residential district. The homes there are old and made of basic materials. Many of them do not have access to running water. These homes coexist with factories located throughout the area. The weather is temperate, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 18-25 degrees Celsius.

Nicasia has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a robust physique. She wears traditional apparel (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in this area, but she also speaks Spanish to integrate herself into the general culture and to conduct business. Nicasia shares her life with her husband, who works and is constantly traveling. Her children are in school. They live in their own home, which is made of adobe and has a corrugated metal roof. Their home has well water, electricity, and sewage services. Her business involves manufacturing different products out of recycled materials obtained from automobile tires. These products include planters, rugs, slip-on sandals, children’s swing sets, storage containers, and other items. The advantage of this business is that she has plenty of material to work with. There are a lot of tires that are left out in the streets and in vacant lots, but have not reached the landfill. “I started my business with the help of my sister. At first we only made rugs and sandals. Later on we proceeded to make planters. Now we specialize in making eco-friendly furniture,” says Nicasia. Her dream is to have a large eco-friendly furniture business. She would like to buy materials for her work such as paint, brushes, screws, and other supplies for the process of recycling automobile tires and making eco-friendly furniture. Nicasia is in her first loan cycle with Emprender. She has been in this business for 10 years.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Nicasia is requesting a loan so that she can recycle automobile tires and make eco-friendly furniture, which will help save the planet.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for recycling automobile tires and making eco-friendly furniture.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a 63-year old widow and a mother of seven children. For 27 years, she has owned and managed a food vending business, earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. To reach her customers, Marlene travels around her village to sell food.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she requests a loan of  PHP 8,000 to purchase food ingredients such as sugar, flour, salt, and other seasonings. She's wants to increase her business so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to use in her food vending business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is grateful that she was granted a Php20,000 loan, which she used to buy ingredients needed in her bakery business. Her earnings help support her personal and household needs, and her aging parents.

She would like now to apply for Php 11,000 which she will use to buy flour, shortening, sugar, milk and other ingredients needed to bake her "hot pandesal" and partly for the maintenance of her oven. "Hot Pandesal" is a rounded bread that is very popular in the Philippines. It's a favorite during breakfast, but is also eaten as a snack. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund her daily needs. 

Lolita dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit, and she will open up branches of her bakery someday. She prays for the good health of her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to bake bread and maintain her bakery's oven.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
The borrower's name is Fernanda; she is 55 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow who works hard to support her daily personal and household needs and to help her parents.

Fernanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. Fernanda earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from her store, she has a tricycle unit for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day. 

To help her continue operating her general store business, Fernanda is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles, and soda. She will also use part of the loan to pay for tricycle tires and fuel. She is positive that this loan will boost her income as she expands her business.  She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely fund her daily needs.

Fernanda hopes to maintain and grow her small store and to own another tricycle so she can save for her old age and help her aging parents as well.  She prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her small store and pay for tires and fuel of her tricycle as well.

loans.name: Maria Claudia
