texts.es: Maria Claudia mujer de 39 años,  casada  y madre de dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 21 años, aún recuerda el inició su negocio el 25 de Enero del año 2009, cuando una directora de una empresa comercializadora de productos por catálogos, la abordó para explicarle las bondades de vincularse a una actividad comercial y ofrecer artículos mediante revistas que la empresa le suministraba; María observando que a sus compañeras les daba resultado este trabajo, decidió iniciar el suyo propio, con el cual poco a poco creció y posteriormente agregó el servicio de fotocopiaje y transcripciones. Sus ventas las hace de contado y a crédito, entre los vecinos del sector donde habita y a referidos, para quienes compra en almacenes especializados del centro de la ciudad trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora para ampliar sus capacidades de servicio en el negocio. Con esta inversión aspira a incrementar sus ventas, pues a futuro sueña con tener un local de mayor tamaño pues su sueño es apoyar la educación superior de sus hijos y no descansará hasta llevarlos  a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of two children, who are 18 and 21 years old. She still recalls the start of her business on January 25, 2009, when a director with a commercial business of products by catalog brought her on board to explain to her the benefits of joining a business activity and of offering goods through magazines that the business supplied. Maria, seeing how her friends had done in this work, decided to start her own. Little by little, her business grew and later, she added the photocopying and transcription services. 

Her sales are made in cash or on credit to the neighbors in the area where she lives and to referrals. For these people, she buys goods in specialized stores in the center of the city. She works daily from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. 

At present, she is applying her a Kiva loan, which is the first loan she has taken from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through the loan, she will buy a photocopier to grow her capacity to provide this service in her business. With this investment, she hopes to grow her sales. 

In the future, she dreams of having a bigger location. She also dreams of supporting the higher education of her children, and she will not rest until she makes them professionals.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia works hard to support her family. Amelia is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Amelia requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Amelia has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from e loading and food vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, and feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a special needs client from Iraq. He is 36 year old, married and has three children. One of his children is working to help his dad in supporting his family.

Amjad is a partner in a grocery store and has built good experience in this field. Now he is planning to open his own mini-market and to sell soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. Amjad is requesting a loan of 2,712 USD to buy a freezer and a juice fridge, as well as buyingadditional goods.

Amjad aims to grow his business and expand his shop in the future, so he can increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a juice fridge as well as additional goods.

loans.name: Amelia Rosa

texts.es:
Amelia una mujer soltera, que solo se tiene a ella, a lo largo de su vida ha construido su casa, poco a poco, como lo ven en su hogar hecho en madera, algo inestable, que necesita reparaciones pero al fin es su hogar y se siente muy orgullosa que lo que tiene porque lo ha logrado con sus habilidades culinarias pues se dedica a vender alimentos.

Su gran sueño es construir un hogar en material “concreto”, tener un piso de cerámica, ver su hogar hermoso y trabajara para cumplir ese sueño.

Amelia Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de:

•	Ollas
•	Estufa
•	Calderas
Este préstamo le permitirá mejorar su actividad y producir más alimento.
texts.en:
Amelia, a single woman who only has herself, has built her house little by little throughout her life. As you can see, there is some instability in her wooden home, but in the end, it is her home, and she feels very proud to have it because she has achieved it with her culinary skills, as she sells food.

Her great dream is to build a house of concrete materials, have a ceramic tile floor and see her beautiful home, and she will work to achieve this dream.

Amelia is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of pots and pans, a stove, and boiling kettles.  This loan will allow her to improve her activity and produce more food.

loans.use: to purchase pots and pans, a stove, and a boiling kettle.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin is originally from a village of the Kos Krolo district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living. Narin is a 42-year-old mother of four dependent children who are still in school. Vegetable selling is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for three years and her husband supplements the income by working for others. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is the third microloan for Narin. She has successfully used the loan to better support her business. Now she is requesting another loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 34, lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap province. She is a married mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and now they are still in school. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy. She has been in this business for several years. From the current business, she can earn about KHR35,000 per day. 
Sreyneang has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and she completely repaid the loan. Now she is applying for a loan to build a decent house for living. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living in.

loans.use: to build a decent house for living

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote village of Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province, Srey is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are dependents, and three are still in secondary school.

Srey has a cassava plantation to support her family. She is also a paid worker when she needs more money.

Srey had never been a client with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. This is her first time, and as a leader of her group, Srey is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her cassava plantation. She hopes that the profits from her plantation will upgrade her family's living standards significantly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

loans.name: Romli

texts.en:
Romli lives in Cibubur, located about one hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Romli lives there with his wife and his two children. He owns a stall where he sells small groceries, snacks, drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is asking a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because a previous loan from Kiva helped him a lot to provide services on weekends.

As the business grows, Romli is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Romli improves his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

In the photo, Romli is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidia lives in Cibubur, located about one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two sons. Lidia owns a small stall where she provides computer repair and mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. A previous loan from Kiva helped her to provide services on weekends and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business grows, Lidia is hoping to get more working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Lidia improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Lidia is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Laras

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Laras. Laras lives in Cibubur, a suburban area near Jakarta. Surprisingly, Laras is still a student. She joined Ruma in 2013, and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. 

She was interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to learn about how to start up a business since a very young age. Even if she is still young, she has a big spirit to learn about business. The previous loan from Kiva helped her have working capital so she could provide mobile payment services for her community. She thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business grows, Laras is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Laras improve her business, and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Laras is the one who is standing and smiling. She will be thankful for your endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 38-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband who is also shown in the photo with her. She has buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Mirash

texts.en:
Mirash and Shpresa or ‘hope’ in English are husband and wife and parents of two children, 10 and 2 years old. Livestock has been one of their activities for earning a living; in addition to that, Mirash works as a driver for a private company and his wife is a caretaker for their 10-year-old disabled daughter.  

Currently they’ve got one dairy cow and they sell one calf a year and also some raw milk, since they keep most of the milk for their use. On a dynym agricultural land that they own, they plant and produce only for their family’s use. 

The loan that Mirash is requesting now will be used to make some electrical installations and plumbing work in their home.

loans.use: to make some electrical installations and plumbing work in their family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Shazia's husband to cover the maintenance cost of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her son's motorbike workshop.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: This is Caroline, a dairy farmer. She is married with children. She grows fodder for her cow thus reducing on expenses. She is sells the milk produce in her local market and which this income she supports the expenses of her family and educates her children. She desires to increase her source of income and she wants to buy another dairy cow through KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members. Ayesha has been running her own beauty salon for the past 16 years. She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. Therefore, Ayesha has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Ayesha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her business of beauty saloon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Phonsawang Group

texts.en: Keo is excited that the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Keo and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Keo and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Keo and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Keo and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°12 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE « Epouses des enseignants n°12 », regroupent des femmes enseignantes et/ou dont les maris sont enseignants. Ce rassemblement est né il y a quelques années et les activités divergent selon les membres.
Madame Khadidiatou, responsable de ce groupe s’active dans le commerce depuis 2 ans, elle vend des tissus. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, dont son fils ainé âgé de 15 ans est scolarisé et dont elle est le principal bailleur. Et c’est grâce aux revenus de son activité, qu’elle réussi à assurer ces charges.
Khadidiatou  souhaite acquérir une parcelle et la construire, renforcer son activité et ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The borrowers’ group “Teachers’ spouses #12” is composed of women who are  teachers themselves and/or are married to teachers. This group was created a few years ago, and its members are engaged in various types of business activities.
 
Mrs. Khadidiatou, the group’s leader, has been in business for two years. She sells fabric. She is married and has three children. Her eldest son, 15 years old, is in school, and mainly depends on her for financial support. Thanks to the revenues from her business, Khadidiatou manages to meet her obligations. Khadidiatou would like to buy a land plot to build on. She would also like to bolster her business and open a cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Elvira is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. In the future, Elvira hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, of whom some are adults and others are school age. 

Daisy has been engaged in a hog fattening business for six years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three piglets, two sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog fattening business. 

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Daisy hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets, two sacks of booster and grower feeds.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married 45-year-old mother of three children who are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years.  

Lydia has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ruby works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. 

Having repaid her previous loan, Ruby has requested a new one for PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business 

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leah is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Leah has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her blacksmith business. Leah has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her blacksmith business

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Nyadzua has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods obtained on credit. 

With this loan, Nyadzua wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is single and lives with her brother. She does multilevel marketing.She buys cleaning equipment and cosmetics. At the beginning she hardly had money. She heard about micro loans and applied for one. With the help of her loan she bought materials and sold her products and gained money.  She is planning to save money and create job opportunities for other women like her.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita together with her husband operates a fishing business. Before, her husband works as a fisherman in their community. However, working as a fisherman only earns them PhP 400 per day and is hardly enough to cover their most basic daily expenses.  

To improve their income, Julita decided to bought a second hand boat in which they repaid on monthly basis and used it in their fishing business. Their income increased to PhP 900- 1,200 daily and they were able to repay the boat after a year. 

Julita and her husband wanted to expand the business and buy another boat however limitations in the capital get in their way in as much as education expenses for their children are also increasing. 

Her first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 was added to their savings to finally buy another boat for the fishing business. From the series of loans, their business and their life dramatically improved. From 1 boat,  they now have 3 boats. They were able to buy a second hand jeep which they use to transport their seafood catches to the market. They were also able to buy a freezer to stock their seafood catches in order to maintain their freshness while not yet transported to be sold.  They are also able to  employ 6 fishermen in the community. Julita was also able to set up a sari-sari store (small grocery store) in front of their house. More importantly, Julita was able to see her 2 children graduating in college. 

Today, Julita is requesting for a loan amounting to PhP 30,000. With the amount she wanted to buy 2 fishing new nets and materials for building their 4th fishing boat. Julita dreams of having her last child finish college and also aspires to continue helping her neighbors by employing them in their family's business.

loans.use: To buy  2 new fishing nets and materials to build a new fishing boat for their fishing business

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is 57 years old. A hardworking entrepreneur. Wholeday, he roams his community for scraps and recycle it. He learned this business from employment. Marcelo bought scraps from his community and sell it at a higher price but sometimes he does not have enough capital to buy much larger scraps.

His first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 was used as an additional working capital to his scraps business.

From a series of loan Marcelo now owns, not just a scraps business but also has a barbecue stall and a sari sari store (grocery store) his wife operates which gains PhP 200-300 daily and helps in their daily expenses.

Marcelo is requesting a re-loan amounting to PhP 25,000 to buy bronze, coppers, roofs and larger metal scraps to increase his income because these were more expensive compare to bottles and papers. 

Marcelo wanted to maintain his scrap business to not just help them in their daily expenses but also saves for their future old age, since they does have not anyone to depend on but themselves.

loans.use: To buy metals, coppers, roofs junks to sell it in higher prices to larger junk shops

loans.name: Fharida

texts.en:
Fharida is 45 years old with 3 children. A hard working entrepreneur.

Fharida used to have a stall for her buy and sell of ready-to-wear clothes and accessories business and 1 employed helper. But on 2010 the market was demolished as  the lot use will be converted to an office building.  Thus, displacing Fharida's business along with other vendors in the market. 

In order to maintain her income, Fharida decided to sell her ready-to-wear clothes and accessories on a house-to-house basis to contribute to the needs of her family and save in order to grow her capital. 

Fharida is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 22,000 to buy 25 pieces of bags, 50 boxes of perfumes and various accessories as an additional items  to sell to her customers.

Fharida hopes to save more and begin renting again a market stall or a boutique where she could sell her items. Where in the revenue of her income helps a lot in providing for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy 25 pieces of  bags, 50 boxes perfumes and various accessories as additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old, with 3 children ages 6, 5, and 3. 

Her husband helps Corazon in their wholesale grocery store business as their only source of income. Starting out in 2002 the couple opened a small retail grocery store in front of their house and earning a net of PhP 300- 400 daily. 

At that time, there was an opportunity to acquire a market stall for her to sell her groceries and she only needed funds to support the rental advances costs. She acquired a loan and was able to transfer the location of her grocery store in the market.Her customers grew and with it her earnings also improved at a net of PhP 3,000 - 5,000 daily. 

Corazon has 3 helpers in her grocery. She also supports one of them with his schooling. The other 2 helpers have families to support and their jobs are their only source of income. 

Today, Corazon wanted to venture into opening a computer shop, in addition to her wholesale grocery store, having known that there are no nearby shops in their community. She knows that computers and internets are highly demanded for students in their area who have needs for research and project print-outs.   

Corazon is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy 5 sets of desktop computers and peripherals for the computer shop she will set-up in front of her house.  With the new business, Corazon aims to increase further her income which she intends to serve the education fund of her children, and likewise continue to help other neighbors in her community to have employment.

loans.use: To buy 5 pieces computer monitors, 5 pieces CPU's, 5 pieces mouse and keyboards to start a computer shop

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, 51, lives in a rural village in Siem Reap province’s Kror Lanh district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school.

For the last 10 years, Neang has been farming rice and working as a paid worker. She also raises pigs to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day.

Neang has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycle already and she completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is going to ask for another loan to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 65 years old with 2 children. Her oldest, with her own family and her youngest a mute, are living with her.

Even with her high blood pressure she sell dressed fish and sell breakfast and noodles to help her husband a carpenter and her oldest with their daily expenses. 
She wanted to expand her business to accept bulk orders for her snack food but she has no capital.

Lucila is now requesting for a loan amounting to PhP 25,000 to buy 1 sack of flour, 10 kilos of sugar, 10 trays of eggs for (rice cake) making to add with her breakfast and noodles and 10 kilos of fresh fish for dressing to fill the bulk order of her customers. These new business will help her increase her customer and therefore a chance of increasing her income.

Lucila wanted to maintain her business to help with their daily needs, her maintenance medicine and to also save up for their old age.

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of flour, 10 kilos of sugar, 10 trays of eggs and other ingredients for rice cake making  and 10 kilos of fresh fish for dressing to fill the order of her customers.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is a resident of Tbeng Meanchey District in Preah Vihear Province. She is 21 years old and married with two children. One of her daughters has just started school, while another daughter is under six years of age. 

To support her family, Lon has been selling fish at the market for eight years. This earns her around $4 (USD) per day. This is her fifth time being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is pursuing a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy fish to sell. 

Lon hopes that her business will go well so that her family's living standards will be improved.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Bongani

texts.en:
Bongani is a young father of three who has been running a tuck shop for the last seven years. He is a hard worker and an enterprising individual who has grown his business from a small corner shop to being a major retailer in his community.  

He is requesting a loan to buy foodstuff, groceries and beverages. Bongani plans to stock larger quantities of these products. He explains that selling a 20kg bag of maize flour as opposed to the normal 2 kg packet, for example, would appeal to customers who have a monthly budget and hence buy groceries in bulk. These clientele, he believes, would provide a loyal customer base.

Bongani hopes to eventually grow his store into a supermarket that will create jobs for members of his community.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries, foodstuff and beverages

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old with 3 children ages 13, 10 and 3.

Her husband works as an overseas worker but their income never sufficed because his husband’s employment agency has violated the contracted salary agreement.

To help support the needs of their family and living in a community where the common livelihood is fishing, Maricel bought a second hand fishing boat from their savings which she lends to a relative to catch fish and divide the profit by half, a net of PhP 500 daily.

And to earn extra income when conditions are not favorable for fishing, she goes from house to house in her neighborhood to sell ready-to-wear clothes such as undershirts, undergarments, shorts and long sleeves shirts worn by fishermen.

Maricel is requesting for a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy  additional fishing nets for her boat to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes for her buy and sell clothing business which sustains their family's income during weather conditions that is not good for fishing. 

Maricel saves most of her income for the education of her children. Maricel also looks forward to a time when she can already have her husband back to the country and tending their own business so that husband needs not to be subjected to unfair labor practices and be with their family everyday.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her fishing boat business and additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothes for her buy and sell clothing business which sustains their income on weather conditions where fishing is not favorable

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody, 23 years old, married and with 3 children knows how it is to have everything one works for turn into ashes literally and take off from there. Two years ago, a fire that broke in her community turned Melody's house and small store into ashes which left them homeless and without a livelihood. To rebuild, Melody and her husband used the money they have been saving for their children's education to put up another store. With patience, the family was able to reconstruct their house and business started to pick up its regular sales. Not only that, she was able to place storage shelves and security screens to her store. She was also able to begin saving again for her children's education.  

Today, Melody is asking for a PhP 15,000 loan to to buy additional volume of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and sacks of rice as additional items to sell to her store and fill the demands of her costumers. Melody says that she also wants to save more for the future of her children and increase their resiliency to risks such as the fire that their family experienced before.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and sacks of rice as added in-demand items to sell in her store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 39 year old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in rice farming for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Eva also earns an additional income through her hog raising business.

Eva is asking to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Eva has hopes of making her business more sustainable and profitable. Eva also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Arielyn

texts.en: Arielyn is married. She is 32 years old and has three young children. Arielyn buys and sells bananas and charcoal to her regular customers at the public market. Her husband is her driver and they use their vehicle to transport their goods. Arielyn is now asking for additional capital of P10,000 to use in her business. She will buy more bananas and charcoal to sell. Arielyn wants to keep improving her sales and profits so that she will attain economic stability in her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Creselene

texts.en:
Creselene is married and has five children. She is 42 years old and resides at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Creselene manages a buy-and-sell coconuts business to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years, earning 6,500 PHP monthly.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Recently, Creselene requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more coconuts for sale.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonila has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Leonila requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional unit for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional unit for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.Teresa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Teresa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 47 years old and very hard working entrepreneur.

Liliosa has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Liliosa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Liliosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is a married woman with two children. She is 53 years old now and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Leonides has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Leonides requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Leonides would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is a 26 year old farmer from the Nyamira region of Kenya. She has been married for 5 years and blessed with a child aged 4 years.

5 years ago, Callen started farming on a 0.5 acre farm. She practises poultry, dairy, tea and maize farming. One of the challenges she has been experiencing over the years is milling cereal grains into a cookable form- flour. This has also taken a toll on her sales since end-user clients want flour, not seeds.

Her answer to this problem is to start a cereal grain milling business where locals can cheaply and conveniently process their produce into flour for food and/or sale. This investment will increase her family's income and elevate their livelihood. And thanks to you, this investment will also help her community to have a place near their home where they can process food for consumption and for sale.

loans.use: to buy a grain milling machine

loans.name: Lisilda

texts.en:
Lisilda is a married woman with five children. She is 39 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lisilda has a selling ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

In the future, Lisilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a business selling roasted whole pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Lydia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and ingredients for her business.

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a brilliant 35 year old farmer from Kapsowar, Kenya, with a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. She practises diversified farming. Her main source of income is milk. Besides being a wife and a mother, she is also a long-time loyal client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization dedicated to elevating the quality of life for rural smallholder farmers. Rebecca has a a great credit history with the company.

Rebecca is seeking a KES 130,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders into her business. With your money, Rebecca will buy a grain milling machine and set up shop where locals of Koibarak village, where she lives, can have their cereal produce processed into flour. Flour is a key ingredient to most staple foods in Kenya such as Ugali and Chapati.

Your investment will not only have a big financial and social impact on Rebecca's family, but it will also make grain milling easier and more convenient than ever for occupants of Koibarak village.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 47 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Ma. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, and candies.

Ma. Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bundi

texts.en:
Bundi is a smallholder farmer from Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a single mother looking after her family of 3 children. To provide for her family, Bundi started farming 15 years ago on her 0.5 acre farm. Today, she keeps 2 dairy cows, 5 heads of poultry and 2 goats. She also grows a variety of crops ranging from fodder to vegetables to banana trees.

Bundi is applying for a loan to expand the horticultural side of her business. She will spend the loan money to buy farm inputs and farm tools. She will be able to make initial loan repayments through the income she makes from selling milk.

Once the harvesting season is over, Bundi and her family will reap the benefits of this investment, thanks to you.

loans.use: to grow more crops on her fam

loans.name: Ma. Juditha

texts.en:
Ma. Juditha works hard to support her family. Ma. Juditha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Juditha requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Juditha has been in this business for 9 years now.

Ma. Juditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Martha Socorro

texts.es:
Martha, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y tiene tres hijos y su esposo es empleado en la alcaldía del municipio donde viven y también cultiva maíz. 

Martha, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde los 15 años de edad; sus padres le enseñaron como trabajar en la agricultura, actualmente, el cultivo que sembró está a 20 minutos desde su casa, su esposo le ayuda cuando no va a trabajar a la alcaldía, el horario de trabajo de Martha es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. Martha, se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno e ir a su parcela a trabajar.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y pagar el rastreo de la tierra. 

Martha, sueña con poder darle a su hija menor la oportunidad que estudie y que logre lo que ella no pudo tener y que tampoco le pudo dar a sus hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and studied through the seventh grade. She is married and has three children. Her husband works for the municipal government in the town where they live. They also grow corn.

Martha has been planting basic staple crops from the time she was 15 years old. Her parents taught her how to work in agriculture. She currently has crops that are located 20 minutes away from her house. Her husband helps when he is not working at his municipal job. Martha’s work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. She wakes up every day at 5:00 A.M. so that she can prepare breakfast and head out to her parcel of land for her work.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay to have her land tilled. Martha dreams of providing her young daughter the opportunity to study so that she can achieve what she wasn’t able to accomplish and to have the things that she could not provide for her older children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay to have her land tilled.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a married woman with eight kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kupha operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman and has four school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Nadzua dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil for her business.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
"Janepher is the group leader of her group in Webuye District, and she is representing 12 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 4 children. Janepher joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 15 years.

Like many other farmers, Janepher decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Janepher's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 7 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights, as, even though Janepher decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael is the group leader of his group in Webuye District, and he is representing 11 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of 3 children. Michael joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Michael decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

Michael's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights, as, even though Michael decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Aged 32 years, Saran is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Together, she and her husband can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

This is the second loan for Saran with VisionFund. She has used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to build a decent latrine for use by her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Try's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural district of Kratie province, Try, supports her family by growing corn which is the family's main source of income. She and her husband also grow cassava to generate additional money to support her two dependent children.

Try is new to VisionFund. After hearing about KIVA loans at VisionFund, Try has formed up a group of three female members to apply for a loan. Try has spent her loan portion on corn seeds and fertilizers. She hopes the crops would yield higher than previous years then she can sell them for more profit and hence she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Siem Reap province’s Kror Lanh district, Lorm is aged 40 years and married with two children, and all are still in school.

For more than 20 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs as primary sources of the family’s income to make a living, and they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Lorm with VisionFund. She is going to use her entire loan to buy pig feed for nourishing them. She hopes to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for nourishing them

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eunes

texts.en:
Eunes is a smallholder farmer from Kimaam village in Nandi Hills, Kenya, practising diversified farming. She owns 2 acres of land on which she and her husband of 30 years constructed their home. They have 3 children- youngest is 17 and oldest 27. 

Eunes' farm is a busy farm. The farm has so many activities going on that it is running out of space. Eunes has 4 dairy cows, over 100 head of poultry, tea crops and a side business. She also has excellent credit history, sufficient collateral and impeccable behavioural competency, which are among the things that make her one of Juhudi Kilimo's favourite clients. 

Eunes applied for a loan to buy a small plot of land where she can rear her dairy animals. Your loan will be of great relief to Eunes' family because right now they have to rear the cows in their family compound. Unlike humans, animals know no boundaries and they can be hard to live with at times because they can become destructive: For instance, cows' love for the taste of soap leads them to chew clothes that are hanging up. 

The additional land space will not only give Eunes enough room to rear her dairy cows, but also enough room for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for her cows.

loans.name: Jeins

texts.es:
Jeins es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 3 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Jeins busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Jeins tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Jeins¡
texts.en:
Jeins is a person who has had to go through many hardships in his life.  Nevertheless, he has always had the fortitude to overcome them and move forward along with his children.

Approximately three years ago, he desperately began the search for a source of income for his home, and that was how he began raising and selling chickens, a business that has been generating earnings with which he is able to pay his household expenses.

Jeins is seeking a loan that will enable him to make a purchase in order to care for his chickens and modify his chicken yard, and he knows he can accomplish this with Interactuar’s help.

Jeins is hopeful that the loan will allow him to move forward with his business, and he hopes that his business will grow and generate more income with which he can offer his children a better quality of life and greater opportunities for progress.

With a loan made today, you can improve Jeins’s life and business.

loans.use: to care for his chickens and modify his chicken yard.

loans.name: Guadalupe Concepcion

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 30 años de edad, es maestra, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 2 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en la Policia Nacional Civil (PNC) desde hace 15 años.

Guadalupe, trabajo como maestra durante 8 años; ahora se dedica al cuido de su familia y tambien cuida varios animales.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar ganado de repasto, para poder obtener un poco más de ingresos cuando los venda y asi poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.

El sueño de Guadalupe, es que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 30 years old. She is a teacher who is married and has 3 children who are 23, 20, and 2 years old and are students. Her husband has been working for the Policia National Civil (PNC) for 15 years. 

Guadalupe worked as a teacher for 8 years; now she cares for her family and also raises various animals. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy grazing cattle, in order to obtain a little more income when she sells them so she can help her children to continue studying. 

Guadalupe's dream is for her children to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Koun's Group

texts.en:
A father of six children, Koun is 59 years old and married. The family lives in a rural district of Kampong Thom province where sanitation needs to be improved. Koun supports his family by growing cassava and farming rice.

Since the businesses do not make money and he has concerns for his family's health, Koun led a group of four members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Each of them will spend their loan on water filters.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Cesar Edgardo

texts.es: Cesar de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pepino y pipián, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a ese actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cesar is 53 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife. He grows corn, cucumbers, and squash. Cesar has been in this business for approximately 30 years. He sells his products at different markets that are located near his house. With the income he earns from his sales, Cesar is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he can continue his work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies in order to improve his land.

loans.name: Edgar Yobany

texts.es:
El joven Edgar tiene 26 años de edad, obtuvo su titulo de secundaria como perito mercantil y contador público, logró obtener su licenciatura en contaduría pública egresando de la Universidad Autónoma, actualmente esta cursando su maestría en administración de empresas con orientación en finanzas.
Actualmente vive solo ya que su familia reside fuera de la ciudad, motivo por el cual desde que inicio sus estudios universitarios tuvo que aprender a valerse por sí mismo, se siente agradecido por los valores y costumbres que desde pequeño su madre le inculcó, ya que por eso él ha perseverado en cada meta profesional, dice sentir felicidad de saber que cada escalón de vida lo ha superado gracias a Dios y a su familia que nunca lo ha dejado solo y lo han apoyado.
Considera ser un joven emprendedor, muy positivo para enfrentar los diferentes retos de la vida, es agradecido con Dios y con su familia.
Su principal motivación para continuar con sus estudios, es su madre ya que ella lo ha apoyado incondicionalmente y mediante su crecimiento profesional Edgar siente honrarla de la mejor manera.
Considera que la mejor forma de apoyar al crecimiento de su país es mediante el estudio y la superación personal espera ver a su país en desarrollo creando fuentes de empleo y oportunidades para todos.
Agradece la oportunidad que se le brinda al proponerlo como posible beneficiado de la Fundación KIVA quienes dan grandes oportunidades para que nosotros los jóvenes podamos tener mejores expectativas laborables.
texts.en:
Edgar is a young man who is 26 years of age. He obtained his high school diploma in order to become a Chartered and Certified Public Accountant. Edgar also earned a degree in Public Accounting at Universidad Autónoma. He is currently pursuing an MBA degree with a concentration in Finance.

Edgar currently lives alone since his family resides outside of the city. He started his university studies because he had to learn how to be good at something. Edgar is grateful for the values and traditions that his mother instilled in him at a young age. For this reason, he has persevered in each of his professional goals. He says that he is happy to know that he has been able to get through each stage in life and excel thanks to God. Edgar also appreciates his family who has never left his side and has always supported him.

Considered to be a young entrepreneur, Edgar is very positive when it comes to facing different challenges in life. He is grateful to God and to his family. His primary motivation to continue his studies is his mother, who has supported him unconditionally. He feels that growing professionally would be the best way to honor her.

Edgar believes the best way to support the growth of his country is through his studies. Through his personal success, he hopes to see his country develop and create employment opportunities for everyone. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him. Being a beneficiary of Kiva gives young people the opportunity to set higher work expectations for themselves.

loans.use: to pay for his MBA degree with a concentration in Finance.

loans.name: Walter Manuel

texts.es:
Walter, un hombre de 33 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de La Unión y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 hijas.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 3 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras
y alimento para los mismos.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.
Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Walter!
texts.en:
Walter, age 33, has many dreams and aspirations in his life.  He lives on a farm in the municipality of La Unión, and he earns a living through the production and sale of chickens and eggs.

With this work, he hopes to provide for his family, which is composed of his wife and two daughters, and he has been doing this work for about three years in order to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of chickens and laying hens, and feed for them. With this loan, he will be able to have a stronger and more sustainable business. 

A loan you make today can improve Walter’s life and business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and laying hens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy calabash

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 41 years, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 21 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

Jean requested a loan from Urwego Opportunity Bank, which he will use to pay for his labors who who harvested the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for his labors

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 7 years old.  Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 18 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Eugen

texts.en:
Eugen aged 31 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of one and eight years. He is a farmer, and he has been producing rice for 12 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for growing rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

texts.en:
Adrien is 25 years old and married. Both he and his wife are farmers.Not yet get birth.They have been growing rice for three years.

Adrien is applying for a 575,000 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy more fertilizer and pay farm workers. His profits will be used to buy more seed for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Boniface is a farmer, and he has been producing rice for 20 years. His wife is a farmer, also. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay more workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Deo is 34 years old. He is married with two children aged 6 months and 4 years.Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 10 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

loans.name: Sylivie

texts.en:
Sylivie is 45 years old. He is married with seven children aged between 2 and 27 years. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 24 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a 49-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of fifteen farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Catherine has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Catherine described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Catherine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.5 acres of land and purchase a total of twelve solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: This is Vivian from a humble family. She is studying Finance and she desires to be a finance manger in an institution. She comes from a big family and her parents are very much strained supporting her younger sisters. She is in her last year and she has no financial assistance from her family while she desires to continue with her studies. With a KIVA loan she will be able to clear her Tuition costs.

loans.use: To pay for Tuition costs

loans.name: Girbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 34 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 6 years, one of whom goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 15 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sabunyuman Group

texts.fr:
Séba  est la dame qui est au bout avec sa main sur la brebis.  Une femme âgée de 48 ans,  Séba  est mariée, elle est emboucheur vivante dans une commune rurale au mali avec ses 3 enfants, 2 sont scolarisés. 
Son activité économique consiste à acheter  les animaux maigres, les engraissés et les revendre. Elle élève  aussi  des moutons. Pour bien mener  son activité, elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché  et fait ses  ventes au comptant au même lieu. Elle fait l’embouche des ovins. Sa brebis a mis bas à deux agneaux. Séba  a 3 ans d’expérience dans cette activité, ses ambitions tournent autour du bien-être de ses enfants en  éducation et la nourriture suffisante. Elle quitta l’école en huitième année fondamentale et se sert à assurer ses besoins par les profits générés  de son activité. Pour  avancer dans   l’activité, Sééba a fait recourt à l’IMF pour  acheter des moutons. Elle  n’a  pas rencontré de problème. 
les personnes additionnelles sont tous membre du groupe, mais n'ont pas pris le prêt cette fois ci.
texts.en:
Seba is standing on the far left in the photo with a sheep.  She is 48 years old, married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live in a rural commune in Mali.  

Seba buys thin animals (mainly sheep), fattens them up and then sells them on.  She buys her livestock from the main market and sells them for cash at the same market and she has been doing this for three years now.  This sheep has recently given birth to two lambs.    

Seba's ambitions concern the well-being of her children, their education and providing enough food for them.  She left school in the eighth year and succeeds in supporting her family thanks to her business.

To help her business to succeed, Seba works with the field partner to buy her sheep.  So far she has not encountered any problems.

The additional people in the photo are all members of the group, but they are not part of the loan this time.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and selling on.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Mamou est la femme qui  a pris un récipient en main à droit et au bout sur la photo. Une femme commerçante, Mamou  est veuve  de 40 ans, vivante dans une commune rurale avec  ses  3 enfants dont  2 scolarisés. Ses enfants sont  entre 15 et 5 ans.
L’activité de Mamou est la vente des savons qu’elle espérera toujours continuer à faire pour prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants en éducation, santé et habits. Avec  le profit  elle parvienne aussi à assurer le bien-être de ses enfants.
 Elle a  une expérience de 3 ans  mais avant elle faisait autres choses, elle veut acheter plus de savons avec l’argent emprunter. Avant  elle n’avait pas de moyen pour exercer cette activité c’est grâce au prêt  l’IMF qu’elle se débrouille maintenant assez. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché  et les vend au marché local et dans le village au comptant et à crédit. Souvent elle rencontre des petits problèmes au niveau de non-paiement de crédit.  
Les autres personnes sont tous membres du groupe mais elles n'ont pas pris de prêt cette fois ci.
texts.en:
Mamou is standing on the right in the photo, holding a large box.  She is 40 years old, widowed and lives in a rural area with her three children.  Her children are aged between 5 and 15 years, and two of them currently attend school.  

Mamou is a retailer of soap.  She hopes to be able to continue with her business in order to generate enough income to pay for healthcare, clothing, well-being and education for her children.  She has three years experience working in her business, before, she had other businesses but she didn't generate enough income.  Now that Mamou has started working with the field partner, she is doing better.  She plans to use her loan to buy soap from the main market.  She will then resell it at the local market and in her village, for cash and on credit.  She often encounters problems with non-payment of her credit sales. 
The other people in the photo are all members of the group, but they are not part of this loan.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap for resale.

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
A senhora Telma tem 29 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 02 filhos dos quais 01 frequenta a 1ª classe e o outro não tem idade escolar. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta mais uma sobrinha que também frequenta o ensino primário do 2º grau.
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção como cimento, pedra, area, varrões para a construção do seu salão de cabeleireiro. Ela sonha em ter um negócio próprio e ser empresária para poder ajudar  aos necessitados assim como ela também tem ajuda dos outros.  Tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Telma, age 29, is married and the mother of two children, of whom one is in the first grade and the other is not yet school-aged. In addition to her two children, she also provides for a niece, who is in the second grade. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials, such as cement, stone, gravel, and beams to build a hair salon. She dreams of having her own business and being a successful businesswoman so she can help others provide for their basic necessities, as she herself has benefited from the help of others. Her main objective will be to repay the loan on schedule. 

...and requests that the institution expand its services to other provinces. 

[...e pede a expansão dos serviços da  instituição a nivel interprovincial.]

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, stones, gravel, and beams to build a hair salon

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as trustworthy. 

Jones operates a retail business where he sells masking tapes, sand paper, paint and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years, and it is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of masking tape, sand paper, paint and other items. 

He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of masking tape, sand paper, paint and other items

loans.name: Marla

texts.es: Marla  de 50 años de edad habita con su familia,  en el municipio de Soledad, tierra de poetas cantantes, compositores y cumbia. Hace 1 año inició su miscelánea contando con un capital propio, con el fin de generar ingresos; Hoy vende en ella,  tarjetería, artículos para el hogar, y detalles femeninos que compra de contado a mayoristas,  que le permiten ofrecer un surtido diverso a su clientela, por quien trabaja de lunes a domingos sin cesar en un horario que inicia a las 8 de la mañana y finaliza a las 8 de  la noche. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio a quienes le vende al detalle  y de contado. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local para independizar el negocio de su vida familiar, conseguir el sosiego y finalmente brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  artículos escolares bisutería y papelería en general. Con esta inversión Maria podrá ampliar aún más el surtido y abordar una nueva clientela, lo cual fundamenta el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Marla is 50 years old. She lives with her family in the municipality of Soledad, a land of singers, composers and cumbia music. A year ago, she opened a general store with her own capital in order to generate income. Nowadays, she sells cards, household items and feminine ornaments that she buys cash from wholesalers, and which allow her to offer a diverse stock to her customers. She works from Mondays to Sundays without a break, from 8 in the morning to 8 in the evening. Her main customers are her neighbors to whom she sells as final customers and in cash. Her goal in the future is to open a store in order to separate her business from her personal life, to achieve calmness, and finally give a better quality of life to her family. Currently, she is applying to a credikiva, the first loan she takes from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy school items, custom jewelry and paper items in general. With this loan, she will be able to expand her stock and acquire new customers, which is the base for the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy school items, custom jewelry and paper items in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to assist him in meeting his target in milk supply to customers.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 29, married and blessed with two children. For the past five years she has operated a beauty products supply business and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES doing so.

Linet is applying for a KES 100,000 loan through VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add more products such as hair weaves, hair oil and chemicals and body lotions. She wishes to attract new clients so she can open a boutique and so expand her business.

With her anticipated profits, Linet will be able to continue educating her children and add more beauty products for sell. Her hopes and dreams are to be successful in her business and live a happy life with her family.
