loans.use: To buy more stock of beauty products such as hair oil and chemicals and body lotions for sell to her customers and make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a passionate smallholder dairy farmer based in Megun village in Eldoret area of Kenya. Her main income source is from selling milk. As her only daughter grows by the day, so does Ruth's financial obligation towards her health, education and general well-being. One of the ways she plans to increase her income is by increasing the volume of milk her cows produce. What better way to achieve this than by improving the animals' feed and water intake.
Ruth is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. This machine will chop hay into small and even pieces that cows enjoy eating. Traditionally, people use machetes to prepare feed. The problems arises when cows become selective, just like small children, when eating. Using a chaff cutter solves this because different varieties of fodder will be fed into the machine which chop and spew the mixture in smithereens. This eliminates any chance of cows being selective, and ensures that they get all the right nutrients and minerals from everything in the rations. The increased income from milk sales will be used by Ruth to meet her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Marc

texts.en: Marc is 33 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 14 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and sell it. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his business.The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in produce farming where he mainly grows coffee. He also earns extra income from raising goats. 

John is optimistic he can have a big, developed business, but he has been limited by inadequate capital and weather changes. 

John is requesting a loan to buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Tabith

texts.en: Tabith is 34 yaers old . a married woman. She has three children. She  operates a retail business where she sells  soap,sugar,pens,and others. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. and she requsting a loan of 900 ssp to expand the business

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en: Gladys has eight children and is always described as very hardworking, which is why she was selected to lead her group, which has 13 farmers in the Webuye District. She has been a farmer for 30 years and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year. She joined to get access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Her loan will include not only farming supplies but also a solar light, which she is very happy to get as that means she will now have light during the night and a place to charge her phone. With the profits she earns this season, Gladys is planning to repair her home. Her group will plant a total of four acres and receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize and buy a solar light.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en: Joseph has seven children and is always described as very hardworking, which is why he was selected leader of his group, which has 13 farmers in the Webuye District. He is happy to be working with the One Acre Fund for the first time this year. Joseph has been a farmer for 15 years and joined in order to have access to quality training and learn new farming methods. His loan will not only include farming supplies but also a solar light, which he is very happy to get so his children can study after dark. With the profits from this coming season, Joseph is planning to send his children to school. His group will plant a total of six acres and receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, and buy a solar light.

loans.name: Benkadi N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Bougoura tient la corde du chevre en main sur la photo.
 Bou goura est une Malienne éleveuse  de chèvre âgée de 50 ans ; mariée à un cultivateur et mère de 2 enfants de 14 à 17 ans tous vont à l’école.  Elle est alphabétisée, matrone de formation et elle exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans. Bou goura  s’approvisionne sur le marché local et vendre ses animaux dans le même marché. Elle emprunte de l’argent au RMCR pour augmenter le nombre de ces chèvres. Le profit dont elle procure la permet de se prendre en charge et d’aider son mari pour les charges de la famille. Ses rêves est que ses enfants aient de bon travail après leurs études. L’activité qu’elle exerce la rendre heureuse car elle participe au  développement de ses  enfants  dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Bougoura [the featured borrower] is holding the goat's rope in the photo. She is from Mali and is a 50-year-old sheep farmer. She is married to a farmer and the mother of two children between 14 and 17 years of age who both attend school. Bougoura is literate and a trained midwife, and has been running this business for 10 years. She gets her supplies from the local market and sells her animals at the same market.

Bougoura is borrowing money from RMCR in order to increase the number of her goats. The profit this will bring will allow her to stand on her own two feet and to help her husband with the family's expenses. Bougoura's dream is that her children find a good job after their education. Her business makes Bougoura happy because she can take part in the development of her children in her family.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Doukon a sa main sur le mouton sur la photo.
Doukon est une malienne âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, âgés de 28 à 12 ans dont 2 sont écoliers. Son mari est un agriculteur ce qui lui permet pendant l’hivernage d’avoir son petit champ. Ainsi pendant la saison sèche elle fait le commerce de friperies et l’embouche de mouton depuis plus de 6 ans. Son rêve est de pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille. Pour l’embouche l’achat des animaux se fait sur le marché local et pour la friperie l’approvisionnement se fait à Bamako. La vente de tous ses produits se fait sur le marché local en espèce et les bénéfices  lui permettent de prendre ses dépenses en charge et  vraiment d’aider son mari. Doukon a comme difficulté l’approvisionnement en friperie n’allant pas lui-même au marché, les fournisseurs tardent souvent de lui envoyer sa commande.
la cinquiéme personne est aussi membre du groupe mais n'a pas pris le prêt cette fois ci.
texts.en:
Doukon has her hand on the sheep in the photo. 

Doukon is from Mali and is aged 47, married, the mother of seven children aged 28 to 12 of whom two are presently schooling. Her husband is an agriculturalist which allows him, during the rainy season, to have his little field. During the dry season, Doukon has had a business selling used clothing and fattening sheep for more than six years. 

Her dream is to be able to be financially independent and help her husband cover family expenses. In the case of livestock raising, animals are purchased on the local market, and as for the used clothing, it comes from Bamako. The sales of all these products are done on the local market for cash, and the profit allows Doukon to cover her own expenses and really help her husband.  

Doulon's challenge is acquiring used clothing, since she does not go to the market herself and the suppliers are often slow to send her order.

The fifth person in the photo is also a member of the group, but is not a part of this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and also used clothes for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: La femme qui tient le mouton est Soun.  Soun une femme mariée,  âgée de 35 ans, mère de 6 enfants, le premier fils est âgé de 18 ans et 01 est scolarisé. Son mari est un cultivateur, elle  a été à l’école,  elle a abandonné l’école en 4 année. Elle fait l’embouche pour s’occuper de ses petits besoins, cela la permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différents marchés de la localité et revend dans les mêmes foires. Elle emprunte avec le RMCR pour acheter plus de moutons à nourrir. Par vente elle pourrait gagner 60 000 FCFA comme bénéfice au bout de 5 mois par tête. Elle exerce  l’embouche depuis 5 ans.  Elle aime cette activité car cette activité lui rapporte beaucoup d’intérêts.
texts.en: The woman holding the sheep is Soun, Soun is a married woman aged 35 who has six children. Her first son is 18 and one of her children goes to school. Her husband is a farmer. She herself went to school, but she abandoned her studies in fourth year. She fattens sheep to pay for her basic necessities and this enables her to improve life for her children. She buys her supplies in different local markets and resells her sheep at the same markets. She borrows from RMCR to buy more sheep for fattening. For each sale she can earn up to 60 000 FCFA profit after five months of fattening each sheep. She has been doing this work for five years. She likes this business because it brings in a lot of interests.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Stenely

texts.en: Stenely, is aged 58, widowed and has three children. She has been selling detergent soap, fabric conditioner, and dishwashing liquid in their village for almost six years. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 1,500 weekly. Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase raw materials for making fabric conditioner, detergent soap, and dishwashing liquid to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making fabric conditioner, detergent soap, and dishwashing liquid to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 40 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Lorna has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ferdinand's Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Ferdinand is representing his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Ferdinand has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also two solar lights, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Ferdinand is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 6.75 acres will be planted by Ferdinand's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 51 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Gertrudes has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gladys's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy another bicycle unit for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle unit for her business.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling food stuff to her neighbours and passerby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Mlongo dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of food stuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of food stuff for resale

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en: Un is 41 years old and married with two children. The family lives in the Dambae district, where planting rubber trees is common. To support her family's living expenses, Un has been planting rubber trees for almost twenty years. As she does not have sufficient capital, Un led a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund Cambodia. Un will use her loan portion to get more rubber trees; she is hoping to generate more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rubber trees for growing

loans.name: Martin's Group

texts.en:
Martin, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Martin is representing his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Martin has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Martin is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Martin's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mrs. Brak ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Brak was selected to lead this group, which has applied for a loan from Maxima. The group has six members who live in a village in the Ponhea Leou district of Kandal Province, Cambodia.
1- Brak is 50 years old and has four sons and one daughter. Three are married and two work in a garment factory. She is a housewife and her husband has been a carpenter for ten years. Brak will use her portion of this loan, $250, to repair her house.
2-  Sokhim is 33 years old and has one son and two daughters who are still very young. She and her husband have worked in a garment factory for five years.  She will use her portion of this loan to buy a motorcycle to use for commuting.
3- Noeun is 52 years old and has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and one works in a garment factory. Noeun is a housewife, while her husband is a carpenter with ten years' experience.  She will use her portion of this loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to use to get to and from work.
     In the photo, we see Brak on the right.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and repair a house

loans.name: Jaime Alexander

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 21 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio de transporte, tiene más de 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que cuenta con clientela fija de la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Jaime brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 21 years old, and lives in his family’s house in the district of Pucará, which is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra.  The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture and in raising animals.

He provides public transportation service with his own motorcycle taxi.  He has more than two years’ experience in the business, so he has regular customers in the area.  

The loan will be used for repairing and maintaining his vehicle, as it is in bad condition.  With this, Jaime will provide better service to his customers, which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle, which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mose operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of a high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
Dolly es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Dolly y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Dolly desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros, compra de sillas y mesas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Dolly is a humble and hard-working woman who has devoted a great part of her life to caring for her children.  She lives in the El Carmen De Viboral municipality, which is where she works spectacularly in the kitchen.  Her business is making food by order.  She makes things like tamales,sausages,empanadas, and corn cakes, among others.  She sells these foods primarily to her neighbors.  They know Dolly’s talent for cooking, and they know they will always get delicious, well prepared food.

Dolly wishes to increase her food sales, and she wishes to work more comfortably.  It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to buy some kitchen utensils and supplies to continue making her recipes.  She will buy things like chicken, flour, and cheese.  She will also buy tables and chairs.

This loan will allow her to get ahead with her business in order to get the income needed to give her the chance to continue supporting her family.  This opportunity is provided to her by the Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, chicken, flour, cheese, and other supplies as well as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Maria, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Bello, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su casa.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 9 horas.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.
Maria ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Maria is humble and hard-working.  She is a tenacious woman who has devoted a great part of her life to caring for her children.  She lives in the Bello municipality, which is where she earns a living preparing various foods.  She makes things like lunches and breakfasts in a small restaurant at her house.  She works alone every day for nine hours.

Her food is well-known by the neighbors in the area.  They visit her restaurant because they know that they will be able to eat delicious food.

Maria has decided to improve her restaurant and increase her sales.  For this reason, she turns to a loan to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes.  This loan will allow her to get ahead in her business in order to get the income needed to give her the chance to continue supporting her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en: Quirina is 51 years old, married and has eight children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her livestock. Quirina has been in her current line of work for three years, and has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, a 36-year-old mother of one son, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband, solely responsible for maintaining the family, is a vegetable-vendor by profession, selling vegetables such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. 

Lubna's husband needs to purchase a variety of vegetables to expand his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. She has therefore requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan for that purpose. Lubna is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to expand her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is 45 years old and mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her children and her husband, who supports the family by selling milk. Her husband needs to buy milk to expand his business, improve sales and earn the maximum profit, and Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to make this purchase possible. Khalida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a restroom in her house.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enhanced her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Edna also operates a utility vehicle for transportation service, and she wishes to add more units to increase her profit. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to replenish her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Rowel is 17 years old and is the youngest of 5 children in the family. His mother Josefina supports the family through her cosmetics business in the Philippines.

Rowel is studying a Bachelor of Science in Architecture and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course.

Josefina is borrowing PHP 15000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Rowel for the First Year Second Semester of the year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Rowel plans to be gainful employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 37 años de edad es propietaria de una miscelánea ubicada en el municipio de Soledad, donde habita. En su negocio  vende artículos para el hogar, confitería, mercancía escolar,  entre su clientela de vecinos y referidos, que le compra de contado y a crédito. Gloria inició su miscelánea  hace 3 años, como parte de la tradición familiar, de allí a que su sueño sea tener un local de mayor tamaño, para ganar más dinero y poder aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder continuar el legado emprendedor. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará juguetería, accesorios,  auriculares etc. Con esta inversión ampliará el capital del negocio y ofrecerá un surtido que impactará la decisión de compra de sus clientes, para continuar vendiéndoles de lunes a domingos sin cesar, en un horario que inicia desde las 9 de la mañana y que finaliza a las 8 de la noche, con el fin de crecer y cumplir todos sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and the owner of a small notions store located in the municipality of Soledad, where she lives. In her business she sells articles for the home, notions and school supplies to her clientele of neighbors and referrals who buy from her for cash and on credit. 

Gloria started her notions shop two years ago as part of family tradition, and from there she conceived the dream of having a larger shop to earn more and be able to improve her family's quality of life and be able to continue the legacy of enterprise. 

Currently she is applying for a kiva loan, his first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy toys, notions, headphones etc. 

With this investment she will expand her business's working capital and offer a better selection to her customers, so that she can continue selling to them from Mondays to Sundays, on a schedule that begins at 9 in the morning and ends at 8 at night. Her aim is to expand and fulfill all her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: To buy toys, notions and headphones.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 63 years old and married, with four children. With one child still in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like candles, sugar, coffee, juice, beer, snack foods, and sanitary pads.

Melanie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as candles, sugar, coffee, juice, beer, snack foods, and sanitary pads. 

Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like candles, sugar, coffee, juice, beer, snack foods, and sanitary pads.

loans.name: Bunsaro's Group

texts.en:
Bunsaro lives in a wooden house located in the Banteay Srey district of Siem Reap province.  She is 50 years old and the widowed mother of four children. One of her children is still in school. 

Bunsaro supports her family by selling mattresses. After successfully repaying her previous loans, Bunsaro is leading a group of five female members to apply for loans from VisionFund. 

Bunsaro will use her loan portion to buy more mattresses to sell. She hopes to make more money for her youngest child's education and food.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses to sell

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Banteay Srey Distrcit

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée âgée de 25 ans. Elle vit à Apédokoè avec son enfant. Ablavi vend des sacs de sortie afin de gagner le revenu pour soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ablavi demande ce financement pour commander des sacs de sortie et faire plus de bénéfice. Ablavi souhaite élargir son commerce dans son quartier et nécessite ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 25 year old married woman. She lives in Apédokoè with her child. Ablavi sells handbags in order to make revenue to support her husband in providing for the family's needs. Ablavi stocks up twice a month at the market. Ablavi is asking for this financing in order to order handbags and make a larger profit. Ablavi wishes to grow her business in the neighborhood and needs this loan to reach her objectives.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags

loans.name: Rajabi

texts.en:
Rajabi is an honest woman. She is 53-years-old. Rajabi lives with her family in the Khuroson district. She has a secondary school education. Five years ago, Rajabi started her own business. She began to sell children clothes. Her husband helps her. Rajabi wants to expand her activity and support her children.

To increase her activity she needs to buy new modern children's clothes.  Her main problem is lack of money. That`s why she applied for a loan. Rajabi hopes for Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: To buy children`s clothes and expand her activity

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°13 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°13, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
La présidente s’appelle Khady, elle a 24 ans, marié et s’active dans le commerce depuis 6 ans. Son commerce qui consiste à vendre du détergent, de l’eau de javel en grain ; de la glace, de la crème glacée, du jus de fruit. Elle place dans le voisinage, fait l’ambulant et vend aussi la glace dans une école de la place.
Khady souhaite ouvrir une boutique dans l'avenir.
texts.en: The group, Gie Teachers' Wives #13, brings together teachers and/or teachers' spouses who are in business. They gather in networks in order to share their interests among themselves, but also to be able to take advantage of financing more easily. They are coming to IMCEC for the first time to request a loan. The president of the group is named Khady. She is 24 years old, married and has been in the business for 6 years. Her business is to sell detergent, powdered bleach, ice, ice cream and fruit juice. She makes sales in the neighborhood, sells on foot and also sells ice cream in the local school. Khady wishes to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase various products, including detergent, powdered bleach, etc. to resell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 63 years old, and she is married, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosario has a welding shop business in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosario has been in this business for 11 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for her welding business

loans.name: Mierlen

texts.en:
Mierlen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mierlen requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Mierlen has been in this business for 7 years now.

Mierlen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pelagia is 49-years-old and has one child who is still in school.

Pelagia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pelagia requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell at her fish stall.

Pelagia has been in this business for 10 years. Pelagia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell at her fish stall

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona works hard to support her family. Ramona is married and has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines.

Ramona requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Ramona has been in this business for 7 years now.

Ramona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Cruza

texts.en:
Cruza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items of ready to wear to sell.

Cruza has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Evelisa

texts.en:
Evelisa works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a business selling fish in the Philippines.

Evelisa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Evelisa has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Evelisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Manuela Del Camen

texts.es:
Ella es manuela una madre responsable, un ama de casa que dedica su cuerpo y alma a su familia, es madre de dos hijas una de un año de edad, otra de 12 años, vive en las zonas rurales, apoya financieramente a su pareja con una venta de pollos que tiene en su casa, ella los engorda y posteriormente los vende.

Para Manuela hay algo que la llena de orgullo, este año se celebra una fecha conmemorable y son los 15 años de su hija, fecha que esperaba con ansias pues se encuentra realizando todo el esfuerzo posible para poder celebrarla, esta es la razón por la que necesita vender y vender y vender, un propósito, una ilusión, un deseo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento pues tiene la corazonada de que venderá y podrá juntar el dinero necesario para la tan esperaba fiesta de 15 años de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
Manuela is a responsible mother, a housewife who devotes her heart and soul to her family. She is the mother of two children ages 15 and 12. She lives in a rural area and helps her partner financially through the sale of chickens that she keeps at her home. She fattens them and afterwards sells them.

For Manuela there is something that fills her with pride. This year she will celebrate a notable event, her daughter's 15th birthday, a date she is anxiously awaiting as she is doing her very best to be able to celebrate it. This is why she needs to sell and sell and sell; a purpose; a dream; a wish. 

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and feed as she has the feeling that she will sell them and be able to put together the money she needs for the so awaited 15th birthday party of her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To buy chickens and other poultry.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is single and a mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.

Mwanasha is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 25-year-old smallholder farmer from Kuserwo village in North Rift Kenya. Daisy practises livestock farming and milk is her major source of income. This year, Daisy set out to grow and diversify her farm business to make more returns and manage business risks.

Daisy is applying for a KES 50,000 loan to pay for a fold of sheep. The newly acquired animals will produce wool and other by products that will generate more income for Daisy's family. The new products will also make her farm more diversified and less likely to suffer risks associated with having one product. She plans to make initial loan repayments using income generated from dairying.

loans.use: to buy a sheep

loans.name: Boravy's Group

texts.en:
Boravy is aged 25 years and married. She has two children who are dependents and not yet in school. She lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, 

To support the family, Boravy and her husband have been in farming and planting potatos for five years. The current business earns her family about KHR 26,700 per day to meet her family’s needs. 

This is the first cycle for Boravy to be a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to expand her potato farm. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and send her children in school.

loans.use: to expand her potato farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dendi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!  Now it’s time for you to meet Dendi, one of Ruma's agents.  Dendi lives in Sukabumi, a suburban located in West Java, around three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Dendi lives there with his wife and his children (two sons and one daughter). 

Dendi works as a civil servant. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn to start up a business through technology. Right now, Dendi procsses mobile airtime credit sales and bill payment services for his community.

As the business grows, Dendi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits.  Your loan will be very useful to help Dendi improve his business and accordingly help his community, which needs access to such services. 

Dendi’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to prrovide an e-commerce business for his customers, a Ruma latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Dendi is standing in front of Ruma’s banner. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity and water) for members of his community.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 60-years-old, a married mother of 6 children, and often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Beatrice has been a farmer for more than 40 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Even though she is new to the program, Beatrice wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Beatrice hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights, as, even though Beatrice decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rose, often described as an extremely resourceful person. She is 35 years old, and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Rose is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund.  This means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. 

Rose says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Rose will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Ablavi  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier de Yokoè avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Ablavi est très dynamique et vend des fruits pour satisafire favorablement ses clients. Son activité procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ablavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Ablavi demande ce crédit pour commander quelques bananes et des oranges pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 31-year-old married woman living in the Yokoè neighborhood with two children in her care. Ablavi is very energetic and sells fruits in order to satisfactorily meet the needs of her clients. Her business makes the necessary profit to allow her to help in taking care of the needs of the family. Ablavi stocks up three times per month at the market. Ablavi is asking for this loan to order some bananas and oranges to resell and make even more profits.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of oranges and 2 baskets of bananas

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured) is 38 years old, She lives at Dongkor district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1997. She has two daughters. They are attending school.

She has done packaging for a factory for thirteen years in her experience, while her husband has been a policeman for twenty years in his experience.  Phallin is applying loan $250 for a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balconies, doors, glass for windows, and payment for the labor.

loans.name: Bibisharifa

texts.en:
Bibisharifa is one of the active clients of Humo. She is 47 years old and the mother of three children. She works as a cleaner in the court of Khuroson district. 

Bibisharifa has also been involved in animal husbandry for ten years. This activity is her main income and for her family, too.  Bibisharifa works from early morning till night providing her children. 

Currently, Bibisharifa has just one calf. She wants to purchase a few livestock to fatten and sell, but unfortunately she does not have the money. 

Bibisharifa needs your understanding and goodness. In the future she would like to get a larger loan.

loans.use: To purchase a few livestock to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Theresa.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 3. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her and helps her with the house chores.  In 2009, Theresa established her hair product business. She began her business just to be self reliant after dropping out of school. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,080,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Theresa has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy different types of hair product for her customers.  She did not meet her target of opening another outlet at the center of town due to the current crisis in the country, but still plans to do that in the future with the help of this loan.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair products

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Catherine. Catherine is a 35-year-old farmer from Mugirangio village where she practises dairy farming. Catherine and her husband are celebrating their 15th anniversary this year! The couple is blessed with children with ages ranging from 5 to 12 years. 

Catherine's main source of income is milk. She co-owns a three acre land that they use to keep three dairy cows. Recently, one of her cows delivered a calf. Catherine is afraid that the upcoming rainy season will be harsh on her calf who does not have a shelter. She is appealing to Kiva lenders to lend her a loan to construct shelter for her animals. 

Your investment will help Catherine build a pen that will provide a comfortable and conducive environment for the proper development of her calf and that of future calves.

loans.use: to construct a pen for her calf

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married, with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major business challenges. Charity dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSH 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her cereals shop.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is 31-years-old and is often described as a very reliable person. She has one child and is married. As a group leader, Ann is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Ann's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing two solar lights as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Ann and her group will receive a total of 15 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of five and 18 years old. Her children all go to school. 

Beatrice is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 18 years. With the loan, she would like to pay the workers who harvested rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested rice.

loans.name: Lilian Wangui

texts.en:
Lillian is 51-years-old and married with 3 children.  She is a business woman engaged in a shoe business in which she buys and sells both second hand and new shoes. 

Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, (HiH EA) trainings, she has been able to improve her entrepreneurial skills, financial management and embrace a saving culture. She is borrowing the loan to add stock to her shoe business. 

Lilian is happy about Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To add more stock to her shoe business and thus increase her profit.

loans.name: Pheas

texts.en:
Pheas, from a rural village of Siem Reap province’s Sreysnom district, is aged 40 years and married, with three sons and a daughter.  Two children attend school; one child is too young. To make a living and support her family, Pheas raises rice, and her husband works in Thailand. 

This is the first micro loan for Pheas. She will use her portion to buy solar lighting for her home. 

With this loan, she hopes her family can have enough light to use, reduce its daily expenses, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting for her home.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, a 31-year-old  woman, joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming and she is borrowing to buy fertilizers and manure in order to increase vegetable production.

Leah is grateful to Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure in order to increase vegetable production

loans.name: Meshak

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Meshak; he is 46 years old, married and has six children.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013, to be trained in entrepreneurial skills. This has helped him run his retail shop business more effectively. 

He is borrowing from Kiva to add stock of foodstuffs, such as sugar, salt and flour, in his shop to help meet rising demand from his customers. He hopes his business will earn more profits to enable him to provide for his children's school fees and general family needs.

Meshak is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support, and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy stock of foodstuffs, such as sugar, salt and flour that will help meet rising demand.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 53 years old and married with two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Cecilia has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Gelma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Salamatu. She is married, and has two children, ages five and 11 years old. She has one additional dependent living with her whom she helps with her education.  

In 2009, Salamatu established her groceries, drinks and cosmetics sales business. She began her business in order to help her husband in the running of the home. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,250,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more drinks, cartons of sardines, milk, luncheon meat, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 2,000,000 SLL. 

In the future, she plans to build a house and to improve the level of her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more soap, sweets and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mary Konima

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mary.  She is married, with two children ages 13 and 6. She has two additional dependents who live with her; she is assisting them in their education. 

In 2004, Mary established her business selling jeans, suitcases, shoes, and shirts. She began her business after she was affected by the war. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Mary would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of jeans, shirts, and shorts.  

Her living standard has improved a lot due to the previous loans she received with ARD through KIVA.  Although she has encountered some difficulties in the present crisis in the country, she was able to repay her loans.   

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and expand her business In the future.   Mary plans to expand to a bigger shop.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more teeshirts, jeans, and suitcases for her shop

loans.name: Alodie

texts.en:
Alodie is 37 years old. She is married with two children, ages two and four years old, who do not yet go to school. 

Alodie is a farmer and has been farming for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to pay workers who harvested rice. She plans to make savings and buy food for home consumption.
  
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested rice.

loans.name: Samin

texts.en:
Samin is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Samin operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan,  she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is one year old. 

Christine is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 12 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice, and then she will sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.name: Erma

texts.es:
Erma es una mujer muy trabajadora, amoroso, protectora, vive en la zona de Sincelejo que de momento es una zona donde la inseguridad, la pobreza, y la desigualdad son temas que tratan de superar día a día a través de emprendimiento y gracias a empresas como Interactuar que vienen a darles la mano y ayudarlos a cambiar la cara de Sincelejo.

Erma es madre de tres hijos y se desempeña como comerciante de productos de uso personal y acolchados, algunos de sus productos lo podemos ver en la foto.

Su sueño los centra en su familia y quiere hacer que estos tenga una mejor calidad de vida y un hogar más digno por ello está destinando sus ganancias a reparar su hogar y dejarle a sus hijos una buena herencia.

Erma quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual destinara en la compra de surtido de acolchados y productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Erma is a very hard-working woman who is loving and protective.  

She lives in the Sincelejo Zone, which at the moment is a zone where insecurity, poverty, and inequality are problems that people are trying to overcome every day through entrepreneurship, thanks to institutions like Interactuar  that come to lend a hand and help them change the face of Sincelejo.

Erma is the mother of three children, and a businesswoman who sells products for personal use and quilts, some of which we can see in the photo.

Her dreams are centered on her family, and she wants to do something so that they can have a better quality of life and a decent home.  That is why she is using her earnings to repair her home and give her children a good legacy.

Erma wants to request a loan for the purchase of an assortment of quilts and products for personal use.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of quilts and products for personal use.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Cheung Prey district's Kampong Cham province, Mao is 31 years old and married with two children. Rice farming is the family's main source of income and labor fees from construction work is her second source of income. 

This is Mao's second loan with VisionFund. She requested this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her rice field. Moreover, she plans to use some of the money to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds, and also to build a latrine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Prech

texts.en:
Prech is 57 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Dambae district of Battambang province. She has four dependent children. 

Cassava and mango growing are the primary source of her family’s income.  She has been in this business for 39 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately KHR 60,000 per day. 

This is the third micro loan for Prech with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Net is a 65-year-old married mother of 10 children. Eight of her children are on their own and have employment, while the rest are still dependent on her.

She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and as workers. The current businesses earn her about 19 USD per day and she spends around 10 USD per day. 

This is the sixth loan cycle for Net. The past loans have helped her to better support her family and increase the business.

Now she is applying for another loan cycle to buy some potatoes to plant. With this loan, she hopes to expand her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy some potatoes to plant

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 60 years old and married. She lives with her family, including her three children, in a rural area located in the Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province.

Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living, and she has been in this business for 40 years. To better support the family, she also works as a worker.

Sokha’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for seven cycles already and has completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have a better standard of living and have enough equipment to use.

She is now leading her group to request a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more money and start a new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Yorn is aged 44 years and married. She has four children; two are dependents, and two of them are too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for over 20 years, and they supplement the family’s income by working as workers in the local area. The current business earns them about 77,800 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Yorn’s group consisting of two female members. She completely repaid the first cycle loan, which helped her make her life better. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to buy a water pump to supply water for her farming business. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and buy one motocycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to supply water for her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yusup

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Yusup. Yusup lives in Solo, a city located in Central Java, around six hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Yusup lives there with his wife and his only son. 

Yusup owns a stall, where he sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits. He learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. His community sees Yusup as a friendly and trusted mobile airtime credit provider, and that's why it's really easy for Yusup to attract many customers.

As the business grows, Yusup is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to process more mobile airtime credits for his community members and bill payment services for his community members as well. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yusup in improving his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

Yusup’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his customers, with Ruma's latest product, called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Yusup is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.,) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Kitoben Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Zeddy, a member of the Kitoben Women Group.  Zeddy is 36 years old and married, with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. 

She farms maize and potatoes. She has learned and gained more experience in enterprise start-up and development.  She also learned skills in financial management that have helped her manage her business well.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides. This will enable her increase her production, improve her income, and thus be in a position to educate her children. 

Zeddy is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides to improve farming.

loans.name: Ogulbegim

texts.en:
Ogulbegim is an affable and wise woman. She is 50 years old. She lives with her four children in the Jomi district. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Ogulbegim and her husband try to provide their children. 

Ogulbegim has been involved in livestock business for more than fiveyears. She has good experience in it. Now she would like increase the quantity of her livestock. Ogulbegim does not have enough money and for this reason she applied for a loan. She hopes that with the help of Kiva lenders she can purchase livestock and expand her business. From the profit of her activity, Ogulbegim wants to improve her life condition. In the future she wants to continue the partnership.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of her livestock.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan rooted her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs.

Isabel is very positive that she can improve her business further if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to purchasing additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit. This will help her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Isabel wants to see her business thrive for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Salaphine is 37 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of one year old and nine years old. One of the children goes to school. 

Salaphine is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past seven years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and will then sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en:
Nobert is a 30-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years now he has been a banker, and with the money he makes, he has been able to buy a motorcycle for a passenger transport business. 

He is a very determined man and wants to become a central bank governor in the future, and that is why he is upgrading his studies. 

Nobert wants to have a modern home, and is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, like cement and sand, to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like cement and sand, to build his house.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Bintihamisi operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is 37 years old and married with one daughter who is under school age. Planting rubber trees is the family's main source of income. 

This is Thy's fourth loan with VisionFund. She applied for this loan after she successfully repaid her previous three loans. This time Thy asked for the money to buy fertilizers for her rubber plantation. She also reserves some money for paying the land plowing fees. 

This year Thy hopes to make more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for a land plowing fee and fertilizers

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра, 52 года, замужем, есть 4 сыновей. У нее средне-специальное образование, с 1989 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Зухры на сегодняшний день есть 4 коровы, 20 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль Зухры составляет от 15,000 сом до 20,000 сом (KGS), в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку племенных овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Зухры, а также накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Zuhra is 52 years old, married, and she has four sons.  She has a specialized-secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 1989.  She currently has four cows, 20 sheep and two horses on her farm.  She makes between 15,000 and 20,000 som (KGS) every month.  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for breeding, fattening and resale.  The earnings from her business will allow her to improve her well-being and to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy and raise additional sheep for breeding, fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fabian De Jesus

texts.es:
Fabián, de 22 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Medellín, en este negocio vende papas fritas.

Fabián trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde, es un hombre muy responsable, juicioso y aplicado con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.
