Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como el costo de los insumos, la competencia en el sector y las fuertes lluvias que azotan su puesto de trabajo.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar un carro de papitas nuevo para ofrecer un empleo y mejorar sus ingresos.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor cantidad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fabián, 22, has opted to start a food business near his house located in the municipality of Medellín. In this business, he sells potato chips.

Fabián works every day from 6 in the morning until 5 in the evening. He is a very responsible, level-headed man and is applied with his business. Among his most latent dreams is the ability to have a restaurant where different types of food are offered and he can offer employment. He confronts multiple difficulties like the cost of the supplies, competition in the sector and the strong rains that lash against his place of work.

He is applying for an economic support to capitalize his business and buy a new potato chip cart to offer a job and improve his income. The loan will impact his life and his business in a very favorable way - he will be able to fulfill his dream and have a better quantity of food to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a new potato chip cart to offer a job and improve his income.

loans.name: Jeniffer Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jennifer joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the 2011, to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management. She is 29 years old and does vegetables farming.

She is borrowing a loan to buy manure and fertilizers so that she can increase productivity of her vegetable farm in order to earn more income and meet customer demands in the local market. 

She is happy with Kiva and all the lenders and promises to pay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer in order to increase farming productivity.

loans.name: Theang's Group

texts.en:
Theang is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom attends primary school while the other is too young to attend school. 

Theang lives in a rural village in Kratie province’s Snoul district. She and her husband earn a living through planting potatoes, which they have been doing for six years.

Theang’s group consists of two female members who have been members of VisionFund for one cycle. Theang successfully used the first loan to better support her family. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Pech lives with her family in a decent house made with bamboo walls and located in a rural district of Kampong Cham province. She supports her family by farming rice, a business she has been doing for almost 30 years. Among her four children, she still has three to support. 

Pech's Group is comprised of six female members. Pech requested a loan to buy fertilizers and also reserve some money for labor expenses. She hopes to generate enough money to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor expenses.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthon is 33 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She has three dependent children to take care of, and now they are in school in the local area. 

Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living, and she has been in this business for 13 years. To better support the family, she sells grocery items as well. 

This is the third microloan for Chanthon’s Group, consisting of two female members. Chanthon completely repaid the past two loans, which have helped her make her life better and given her enough ability to support her children’s studying. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more groceries for resale. 

With this loan, she hopes to expand her grocery store and buy more products for sale, in order to earn more income to improve her standard of living and to be able to keep sending her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Wisdom Quarry Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is James. He is a member of Wisdom Quarry Self Help Group in Limuru Kenya. He is 31 years old. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which has helped him realize his strength in the farming business. 

He grows carrots, cabbage and potatoes and has one dairy cow. He requests a loan to boost his farming by buying manure. He believes that this will help him increase his profits and family income.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more manure to improve farming productivity and earn more income.

loans.name: Nouth's Group

texts.en:
Nout is 50 years old and married with three children, two of whom are dependents. She lives in a rural village in Srey Snom district. She has a rice farm, sells cake and raises pigs to earn income to support her family’s needs. 

Lack of working capital is a main challenge for her family’s business, so she decided to borrow a loan from VisionFund Cambodia.

Nouth’s Group consists of four members who are all female. Nout has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have sufficient food and helped her to better support the business. Currently, she can earn about 36,000 KHR per day from the business. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and feed for raising pigs. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and feed for raising pigs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one girl, Theary, aged 22, supports her small family by farming rice. Moreover, she raises pigs for sale to generate additional income. 

Leading a group of four female members who all are new to VisionFund, Theary will use her loan portion to buy more piglets to raise. Also, she will use some portion of this money to buy pig feed. 

Theary wishes to earn more income so that she can build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lucy, who is 27 years old, married, and living with two of her children. She practices dairy farming and runs a grocery business selling vegetables like kale, spinach, tomatoes, and cabbages.

She is borrowing a loan to add stock to her grocery business. She feels that this loan will assist her to increase her income level and that hence she will be able to feed her family, provide good clothing for her children, and also pay their school fees.

She is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to add stock to her grocery shop and hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Toukaranké Group

texts.fr: Badji, membre représentatif de ce groupe est une femme mariée, mère d'un enfant. Badji et les autres membres sont des femmes dynamiques qui exercent des activités diversifiées qui se résume à la restauration, au commerce de détail, etc. Badji fait le commerce des bazins. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour faire une commande au Mali pour vendre à ses clients. Après vente, son bénéfice lui permettra de se prendre en charge ainsi que sa famille. Badji aimerait accroître son activité dans un avenir proche.
texts.en: Badji, the representative member of this group of married women, is the mother of one child. Badji and the other members of the group are energetic women who work in diverse fields, which come down to food preparation, retail sales, etc. Badji sells basins. She needs this loan to make an order in Mali to sell to her clients. After the sale, her profit will allow her to take care of her needs and her family's. Badji would like increase her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase basins of different qualities to sell.

loans.name: Mugumoini Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady lifting her hand is Grace, a member of Mugumoini Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to get entrepreneurial skills and training.

Grace is married and blessed with two children and is living with her family. She is 57 years old and practices mixed farming, where she farms maize, beans and dairy. She is borrowing the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and buy feeds to increase production for more income.

Grace is happy with her Kiva loan and all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and feeds to increase production for more income.

loans.name: Blanca Lydia

texts.es: Blanca de 73 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza para sostener la economía de su hogar apoyada en su negocio, en el cual vende productos como: ganchos de cabello, colas, prendedores, etc. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 38 años junto a su grupo familiar. Blanca desea invertir en su negocio ya que desea tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ganchos de cabello, colas, prendedores, pulseras, aretes, etc. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan optar a una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Blanca, 73, is an entrepreneurial woman who pushes herself to sustain the economy of her home, supported by her business, in which she sells products like: hair clips, hair bands, bracelets, earrings, etc. She has lived in her own home for 38 years along with her family group.

Blanca wishes to invest in her business since she desires to have a better quantity of products to offer to her clientele. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: hair clips, hair bands, bracelets, earrings, etc. and, in this manner, obtain more income that permits her to opt for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in hair clips, hair bands, bracelets, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N° 14 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°14, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit. 
Awa âgée de 34 ans est la responsable, elle s’active dans le commerce depuis près de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l’un a 10 ans et l’autre, 2ans.
Awa vend des produits halieutiques : moule, poisson séché et fumé, autres fruits de mer. Elle veut développer son commerce et diversifier. D’ ailleurs son projet serait d’ouvrir un grand restaurant et de construire sa maison.
texts.en: The group, Gie Teachers' Wives #14, brings together teachers and/or teachers' spouses who are in business. They gather in networks in order to share their interests among themselves, but also to more easily be able to take advantage of financing. They are coming to IMCEC for the first time to request a loan. Awa is 34 years old and the leader of the group. She has been in the business for nearly 10 years. She is the mother of two children, of which one is 10 and the other is 2. Awa sells fish-related products: mussels, dried and smoked fish and other seafood. She wants to develop her business and diversify it. Incidentally, her project would be to open a large restaurant and build a home.

loans.use: acheter des produits halieutiques: moule, poisson séché et fumé pour revendre

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is 26 years old and from Kisumu. She is married to Elliam, who is a businessman and helps support his family by providing additional income.

Hamisa supports seven people in her family.  She has two children, who are 8 and 6 years old.

She has operated a food kiosk for the past five years, and she makes a monthly income of KES 4,000. 

She is taking her third loan from VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastic seats.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to support her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and seats for he food kiosk.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Susan has been in this business for 16 years now and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Wenelina

texts.en:
Wenelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell chocolate business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of chocolates to sell to her customers.

Wenelina has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Wenelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of chocolates to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Chizi operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a gorgeous lady from Igoki village in Central Kenya. She practises mixed farming for a living. She started farming 15 years ago on a one acre piece of land. Her main income source is bananas. Outside the farm, Doris is a single mother to a 15 year old child. 

Doris is making a killing selling bananas. She would like to grow more so that she can sell more. The main challenge she is facing is lack of enough capital to expand. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to plant more crops. Most of the money will be spent on labour since digging gigantic holes on the ground that will act as beds for the crop is very labour intensive. She will also use the money to buy farm tools and farm inputs. 

Income from this investment will help her to provide a better living condition for her family and better education for her child.

loans.use: pay for labor, tools, and farm inputs for growing bananas

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Ismael has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay her for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan Ismael is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Mwanasha has operated a cereal shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Mwanasha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad.

Maria vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Maria tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Le dedica 6 horas diarias a su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her daily effort, has achieved getting her son ahead, providing him a good quality education. Maria lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. A long time ago, she started to sell personal use products by catalog. With a large effort, she's overcome many problems that have presented themselves.

Currently, Maria has some very good orders on behalf of her customers. Since she doesn't have a lot of capital, she is looking for a loan to be able to buy personal use products and respond to the large orders that her clients have. She dedicates six hours a day to her job.

Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her business and, from this, be able to offer a good quality of life to her son and better economic stability. She knows that by the hand of Interactuar, she can achieve it.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to sell.

loans.name: Johanna Carolina

texts.es:
Johanna, de 22 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta sexto grado, no pudo continuar estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 5 años de edad y el otro de 5 meses de nacido; vive con su pareja, sus hijos, su madre y una hermana.

Johanna y su pareja, se dedican a la corta de caña, pero además ella le ayuda a su mamá a vender en el cafetín, en donde venden distintas clases de comida.- Desde hace muchos años se dedica a cortar caña, este trabajo lo aprendió por la necesidad que tenia y para ayudarle a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, pan, para el cafetín que tiene con su mamá.

El sueño de Johanna, es poder comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda de ladrillo, porque por el momento está viviendo en la casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
Johanna, 22 years old, is a homemaker. She studied until sixth grade; she couldn't continue studying due to a lack of economic resources. She has a partner and has two children, one is 5 years old and the other is 5 months old. She lives with her partner, their children, her mother and a sister.

Johanna and her partner work cutting sugar cane. Additionally, she helps her mother sell in the small café, where they sell different types of food. She started cutting sugar cane many years ago. She learned this work because of the necessity she had and to help her partner with the expenses of the home. Her schedule is from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM.

The loan that she's applying for is to buy snacks, soda and bread for the small café she has with her mom. Johanna's dream is to be able to buy land to construct a brick house, because for the moment she's living in the house of her mother.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soda and bread for the small café she has with her mom.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan is a 44-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joan has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Joan described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, aside from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Joan’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 53 años de edad, anteriormente se desempeñaba como una trabajadora interna en una empresa X, la cual tuvo que dejar por una enfermedad que no menciona buscando un apoyo más por sus capacidades de salir adelante que por lastima.

Ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y fritos como pasteles de pollo, su negocio lo ha logrado construir con la ayuda de préstamos y de su familia que siempre la apoyan y la motivan para que sea una gran empresaria.

María quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de abarrotes, y compra de insumos para realizar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
María is a 53 year old woman. She used to work as an internal employee in a different business, which she had to leave because of an unmentioned illness. She is seeking more support for her ability to get ahead from the pain.

She is married. She has three children and she works selling groceries and fried food like chicken pies. She has achieved constructing her business with the help of loans and that her family has always supported and motivated her so that she can be a great businesswoman.

María wants to apply for a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of an assortment of groceries and to buy supplies to make her food.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store and buy supplies to make her fried foods.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly es una joven de 28 años de edad, alegre, trabajadora, honrada, pujante, madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, se separó de su esposo por razones que no quiere nombrar, sale adelante con su negocio de panadería, siendo su lema el que persevera alcanza dado que dicho negocio le ha permitido solventar sus necesidades económicas, y ahora quiere comprar el local donde opera pero al ser costoso primero tiene que ahorrar para llegar a hacer un buen negocio.

Lucelly trabaja la sorprendente cifra de 16 horas cada día y lo debe hacer si quiere cumplir sus propósitos que todos ellos tienen un fin, el cual es ser mejor empresa para tener mejor calidad para ella y su  hija.

Lucelly  quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para fabricar sus panes, comprara algunos abarrotes, y refrescos.
texts.en:
Lucelly is a young woman, 28 years hold. She is happy, hardworking, honest, vigorous, and the mother of a small 2 year old girl. She separated from her husband for reasons that she doesn't want to say. She is getting ahead with her bakery business, her motto being "she who perseveres achieves." Given that the mentioned business has allowed her to fulfill her economic necessities, she now wants to buy the storefront where she operates. But, because it's expensive, first she has to save to get to do good business.

Lucelly works the surprising schedule of 16 hours every day and she has to do it if she wants to achieve her objectives: they all have an end, which is to be the best business and to have better quality for she and her daughter.

Lucelly wants to apply for a loan, which she will invest to buy supplies to make her breads. She will buy some groceries and sodas.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her breads and continue nurturing her dream of buying the storefront.

loans.name: Celestine's Group

texts.en:
Celestine, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Celestine is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Celestine has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Celestine is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 6.25 acres will be planted by Celestine's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, a 65-year-old woman who is married and has six children. She does potato farming. The training she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run her business effectively.

Grace has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizer. She plans to keep back some of the profits generated to help expand her business and provide for her children's education.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en:
Saroem is 36 years old and married with one daughter and one son, and she lives in a rural village in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs, which they have been doing for ten years. The current business earns them about 17,000 KHR per day and their daily expenses are around 11,000 KHR. 

Saroem’s Group consists of three female members who have been members of VisionFund for four cycles. Saroem successfully used the first loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living conditions and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 38-year-old a member from United Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from trainings in enterprise development and financial management.

Joyce's economic activity is in vegetable farming, and she wants to buy fertilizers and manure to increase production and earn more income from her vegetable farm. She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to increase production on her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Premanand

texts.en:
Premanand is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four school-aged children. To take care of his family, he cultivates several vegetables and fruit on a large scale.

Previously, Premanand received two loans from Seva MFI for his poultry and vegetable business. All those loans were fully repaid on time.

For the transportation of his machine and vegetables, Premanand wants to buy a van (panel truck) and for this he wants to borrow 10,000 SRD.

loans.use: to buy a van (panel truck) to transport his vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more broiler chickens and ducks and feed for them.

loans.name: Jose Eusebio

texts.es: Jose de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo nuevamente las paredes ya que están hechas de adobe y están bien deterioradas, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra asi el su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Jose, 30, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked in agriculture for several years. With what he obtains from his work, he achieves fulfilling some expenses of his home. He wants to improve his home, newly constructing the walls since they are made of adobe and they are very deteriorated.

As he doesn't have sufficient capital, he is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to pay for labor. Therefore, his family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Parzaim

texts.ru: Парзаим, 54 года, замужем, 3 сыновей. Образование средне-специальное, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Парзаим в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 5 овец, на участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 21,000 сом (KGS). Парзаим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока. На полученные доходы от кредита Парзаим планирует и дальше увеличивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Parzaim is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three sons.  She has a specialized secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years.  She started her own business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns five cows and five sheep, and she also grows corn on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 21,000 som (KGS).

Parzaim has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows.  This will allow her to sell larger volumes of delicious organic milk.  With the earnings from her loan, she is planning to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to produce and sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling rice, juice, sweets, soaps, biscuits, milk, and soda. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of rice, juice, sweets, soaps, biscuits, milk, and soda. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, juice, sweets, soaps, biscuits, milk, and soda

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Sofía una mujer casada, dedica a su esposo y a su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, dulces, chocolates, snaks, galletería entre otros, su tienda tiene una existencia desde el año 1980, complaciendo clientes, haciendo amigos y generando progreso para ella.
Su negocio nació como necesidad económica, ella quería una mejor calidad de vida, un mejor hogar, sentirse útil y mírala ahora 35 años después dando pelea en su tienda.

Sofía en el momento quiere solicitar un crédito el cual destinara para el pago de unos impuestos pues le gusta mantenerse al día con temas legales para que la dejen operar tranquilamente su tienda.

Con el monto solicitado pagara los siguientes impuestos:
•	Industria y comercio
•	Sayco y acimpro
texts.en:
Sofía, a married woman, is dedicated to her husband and her business selling staple family goods like sweets, chocolates, snacks, cookies, among others. Her store has been in existence since the year 1980, pleasing customers, making friend and generating progress for her.

Her business was born of economic necessity. She wanted a better quality of life, a better home, to feel useful and look at her now: 35 years later, fighting back in her store.

Currently, Sofía wants to apply for a loan which she will use for the payment of some taxes. She likes to stay current with legal matters so that they will let her operate her store in peace.

With the amount requested, she will pay for the following taxes: industry tax, business tax, and Sayco and Acimpro [two Colombian royalty taxes].

loans.use: to pay for industry, business and royalty taxes.

loans.name: Edgar Dario

texts.es:
Edgar un hombre de 50 años de edad, luchador, pujante, animado, que a raíz de su negocio de taller de mecánico cambio drásticamente su vida, pues antes era un simple empleado y su vida era dura, y al momento de reaccionar y buscar el camino del emprendimiento supo que fue salir adelante.

Su familia la constituyen dos partes, una es su hogar donde vive junto con su pareja con la cual tienen dos hijos un hombre de 14 años y una dama de tan solo 8 añitos de edad y su otra familia que es la del trabajo la constituyen sus 4 empleados.

Con ánimos de crecer su negocio, enseñar a sus empleados a ser emprendedores, aumentar su familia, ser competitivo y agresivo en el mercado quiere solicitar un préstamo que usara en la compra de un comprensor y el resto del capital lo destinara a remodelar un poco su taller.
texts.en:
Edgar is a man of 50, a fighter, vigorous and lively, who changed his life drastically due to his mechanic shop business. Before, he was a simple employee and his life was hard. At the moment of reacting and searching for the path of entrepreneurship, he knew that it would get him ahead. 

His family is made up of two parts. One is his home where he lives with his partner, with whom he has two children: a 14 year old boy and a girl only aged 8 small years. His other family is that of his work, which is made up of four employees.

With excitement to grow his business, to teach his employees to be entrepreneurs, to grow his family, to be competitive and aggressive in the market. He wants to apply for a loan that he will use in the purchase of a compressor. He will allocate the rest of the capital to remodeling his shop a bit.

loans.use: to teach his employees to be entrepreneurs to buy a compress and repair his shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Esther; She is 57-years-old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 in order to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management.

She is a green grocer and sells vegetables such as cabbages, onions, tomatoes and kale in a nearby market. In addition she keeps livestock and does farming. She wants a loan to buy animal feed for her livestock and fertilizers for more production. She believes this will increase her income which she plans to use support her children’s education by paying school fees. She is very happy to Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to increase production and provide more income to support children's education.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 37 years. He is married with no child at the moment. He does tailoring. He has been in the business for two years. His monthly income is eighteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase tailoring material like clothing material and thread. He plans to use the profits to improve his family’s standard of living.

In future he hopes to open a boutique and have a financially stable family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material for tailoring

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a small holder farmer from a remote village in the North Rift region of Kenya. 18 years ago, Rael started farming on a 14 acre piece of land that she owns together with her husband Emmanuel. This year, Rael and her husband will be celebrating their 35th anniversary! Their marriage gave life to two children, one aged 21 and the other 35. 

Rael's farming activities range from dairy to poultry to sheep to tea and to vegetable farming. To Rael, progress is as important as life itself and yet the 14 acre area of land has become too small to accommodate expansion. She is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase a small plot of land to create room for more farming. 

Your loan will help Rael to increase her farm activities, make more income to support her family all the way to her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 57 old. She is married with two children aged 16 and 23 years, both of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 30 years. With the loan, she would like to pay the workers who harvested rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested rice.

loans.name: Gulzita

texts.ru: Гульзита, 31 год, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Гульзиты высшее образование, работает в школе, преподавателем русского языка, также уже 8 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Гульзиты имеется 3,0 ГА арендованного и 1,80 Га собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть корова. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Гульзиты составляет 8,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коров. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и развитие полеводческой деятельности.
texts.en: Gulzita is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a college education and she works as a Russian teacher in a school.  She has also been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry for the past eight years.  She started her farming business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three hectares of leased land as well as 1.8 hectare of her own land, on which she cultivates beans annually for resale.  She also owns one cow.  Her farming business brings her a monthly income of 8,500 som (KGS).  Eager to further develop her activity, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her number of domestic animals and to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una vendedora de productos de la canasta familiar la cual cuenta con un largo recorrido pues inicio su tienda en el 1980, inicio una tienda como necesidad económica, con poca experiencia pero con ganas de trabajar y con el pasar del tiempos e ha ido enamorando de esta profesión, ese placer de compartir e interactuar con los vecinos en el momento no lo cambia por nada.

Tiene su tienda muy bien organizada y cuenta ya con gran conocimiento y experiencia y con su negocio busca tener una sostenibilidad que le permita tener un resto de vida tranquila, aunque tiene 63 años se siente como una joven llena de ánimos como para vivir 100 años más.

Sofía le gusta tener su negocio al día bien surtido, con los impuestos pagados ara no tener problemas para operar, los impuestos son la razón que la tiene aquí en este momento y es que necesita un préstamo para pagar:
•	Impuesto de industria y comercio
•	Impuesto de sayco y acimpro 
Este apoyo significara mucho para esta mujer que le queda más fácil pagar por cuotas y así invertir parte de su capital en surtido.
texts.en:
Sofía is a seller of staple family products, with which she's had a long journey: she started her store in 1980. She started a store because of economic necessity, with little experience but with the desire to work. With the passage of time, she has become in love with this profession, this pleasure of sharing and interacting with the neighbors. In the moment, she won't change it for anything.

She has her store very well organized and already has great knowledge and experience. She is looking to have sustainability with her business, which permits her to have the rest of her life peaceful. Although she is 63, she feels like a young woman full of energy and like living for 100 years more.

Sofía likes to have her business well stocked during the day. With the taxes paid, there will be no operating problems. The taxes are the reason that she  has here in this moment and is that she needs a loan to pay: industry taxes, business taxes, and Sayco and Acimpro taxes [two Colombian royalty taxes].

This support will mean a lot for this woman, who finds it easier to pay in installments and therefore invest part of her capital in stock.

loans.use: to pay taxes to operate normally.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of twelve farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Elizabeth has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Elizabeth described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Elizabeth’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of thirteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 54-years-old. She is married with three children aged between 15 and 23 years old, they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to pay the workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals such as goats and sheep.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José, de 48 años de edad, es agricultor, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, de 15, 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian, su pareja se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la comunidad donde viven.

José, se dedica a la panadería, la agricultura, la siembra de hortalizas y a la crianza de pollos de engorde, en lo cual también le ayuda su pareja, desempeña estas actividades desde hace 36 años, estos trabajos los aprendió de sus padres.- José, trabaja también eventualmente como vigilante en un cañal.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 4 terneras, para cuidarlas y dentro de un tiempo venderlas para obtener un poco más de ingresos y poder darle lo necesario a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.

El sueño de José, es ampliar su negocio ganadero, que sus hijos estudien para que tengan mejores posibilidades de trabajo y ahorrar para poder construir una vivienda de ladrillo, digna para su familia, ya que en la que  están viviendo es de barro y está en mal estado.
texts.en:
José, 48 years old, is a farmer. He did not have the opportunity to finish school. José is married and has four children ages 15, 13, 11, and 5. All of them are in school. José's wife makes a living selling candy in the community where they live. 

José makes a living as a baker and a farmer. He sows crops and raises chickens that he fattens with the help of his wife. José has been doing this work for 36 years. He learned this trade from his parents. He also works as a security guard in a sugar cane field. 

The loan that José is requesting is to buy 4 calves that he will raise and later sell to earn more income and be able to provide for his children so that they may continue studying. 

José's dream is to expand his business raising livestock, for his children to keep studying and have better opportunities for work, and to save to build a brick house. That way his family can live with dignity; right now the house they live in is made of mud and is in bad shape.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy matooke (starchy bananas).

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
This is Lora, 33, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Edwin and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her every day expenses.  

Lora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lora dreams of giving her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
She is a 42 year old lady from the Kisumu region. She is married and supports 4 children in her family.

She sells new clothes; a business she has been doing for the last 14 years and generates a monthly income of KES 20000.

She has applied for her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a wholesale shop for clothes and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kijiko Ushindi Women Group

texts.en:
The lady lifting her hand in the photo is Hannah. She is a member of Kijiko Ushindi Women's Group, which joined Hand in Hand, Eastern Africa to benefit from the training. She is 50 years old,and married with six children. 

She is a small scale farmer and grows potatoes, cabbages, carrots and has two dairy cows. She is borrowing Kiva loan to boost her small scale farming by buying certified potatoes seeds and fertilizer.

She is happy that her future will improve and she will be able to improve her family upkeep and provide better education for the children. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and manure to increase production and hence realize more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Taj  Unnisa

texts.en:
Taj Unnisa is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 4 children.

Her husband (shown in the photo) deals in the construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Taj Unnisa applied for a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. He was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

She feels positive about her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Esta hermosa Joven se llama Ana, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, quiere estudiar, progresar y sacar su familia adelante que inicio hace tres años un negocio de café internet-tienda, su razón era apoyar su familia que es muy bajas de recursos y poder generar dinero para pagar sus estudios superiores.

Varias son las razones para apoyar esta maravillosa persona y ellas son:
•	Es una joven con ánimos de estudiar, ser una profesional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
•	Es muy casera, ella trabaja, estudia y se mantiene en su hogar que centra mucho en su futuro.
•	Tiene su futuro claro como emprendedora, todo el conocimiento que está adquiriendo lo usara para emprender y ser generadora de empleo.
Ana se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la reparación de sus equipos de cómputo y comprar accesorios que son los productos que vende en una vitrina ubicada en la sala de internet.
texts.en:
This beautiful young woman is named Ana. She is 22 years old and single. She wants to study, improve, and to help her family get ahead. Three years ago she started a business: an internet cafe and store. Her reason for doing this was to support her family, which has very few resources, and be able to pay for her higher education. 

A few reasons to support this marvelous person are that:
•	she is a young woman who wishes to study, become a professional, and improve her family's quality of life. 
•	her home is important to her; she works, studies, and maintains her home, which is central to her future. 
•	she has a clear future as an entrepreneur, all of the knowledge that she is gaining she will use to be productive.  

Ana is requesting this loan to invest to repair her computer equipment and buy accessories--products to sell in a display case located in her internet cafe.

loans.use: to repair her computers and buy accessories to sell in a display case.

loans.name: Manuel Gabino

texts.es:
Manuel, de 75 años de edad, actualmente se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, hortalizas y granos agroindustriales, vive solo, tiene 8 hijos, pero todos tienen sus propias familias.

Manuel, desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cosechando granos básicos, agroindustriales y hortalizas.- Este año ha cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y 7,000 metros cuadrads de arroz, los beneficios que tiene es que su cultivo está cerca, esto hace que se le facilite el manejo de todos sus cultivos.

Manuel, necesita el dinero para comprar abono y pesticidas para sus cultivos, porque se acerca la época para comenzar a sembrar y tiene que preparar la tierra.

Manuel, quiere seguir trabajando así como lo ha hecho toda su vida, ya que tiene la bendición de tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 75, currently works growing staple grains, vegetables, and agroindustrial grain.  He lives alone.  He has 8 children, but they all have their own families.

Since he was young, Manuel has worked in agriculture, harvesting staple grains, agroindustrial grains, and vegetables.  This year, he has cultivated 7,000 square meters of beans, 14,000 square meters of corn, and 7,000 square meters of rice.  The advantages he has are that his crops are close, which makes it easy for him to manage all of his crops.

Manuel needs the money to buy compost and pesticides for his crops, since the season to begin sowing is approaching and he needs to prepare the land.

Manuel wants to keep working like this, as he has done his whole life, since he is blessed to have good health.

loans.use: to buy compost and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: MAURA: Es una señora emprendedora de 48 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita, casada con 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en un anexo de madera que construyó pegado a su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para aumentar los productos que oferta en su pequeño negocio, comprar. Granos básicos, chiverias, papel higienico, detergentes, entre otros productos. Su sueño es crecer y surtir con otros productos que le generen más ganancia y poder crear las condiciones que le permitan a ella tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Maura is an entrepreneurial woman who is 48 years old. She was born in Puerto Cabezas and is of the miskita ethnicity. She is married and has three children who are all adults and independent. With the goal of generating her own source of income and helping with the household expenses, three years ago she opened a small store in a wooden annex built onto the side of her house. 

Maura is requesting this loan in order to increase the products she offers in her small store. These items will include basic household items, dairy products, toilet paper, detergents, and other products. Her dream is to grow and stock her store with other products that will generate more profits and be able to create the conditions that will permit her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic household items, dairy products, toilet paper, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°15 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°15, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
La  dame Aminata est la responsable de ce groupe. C’est une femme mariée qui est mère de 6 enfants dont sont ainés est un garçon âgé de 18 ans et la cadette a 2 ans. Madame Aminata possède un frigo chez elle : elle vend de la glace, fabrique de la crème glacée, qu’elle revend chez elle ou dans les écoles. Ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter du sucre, du pain de singe, de l’oseille, de la pâte d’arachide pour la fabrication des jus et crème à commercialiser. En période d’années scolaires ses recettes journalières sont plus intéressantes et peuvent aller jusqu’ à  6000f. Grâce à cela, elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales.
Le souhait de madame Aminata, est d’ouvrir une boutique ou un magasin et de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The "spouses of teachers #15" group is composed of women who are teachers and/or are married to teachers, and work as vendors. They have joined forces to show  solidarity and also to be able to obtain financing more easily. This is the first time they reach out to UIMCEC to apply for a loan.

Mrs. Aminata is this group's leader. She is married and has six children: her eldest is an 18-year old boy and her youngest is a two-year old girl. Aminata owns a refrigerator. She sells ice and prepares ice cream for sale out of her home or near schools. This loan will allow her to buy sugar, fruit of the baobab, sorrel, and peanut paste in order to prepare juices and ice cream for sale. During the school year, her daily sales are  higher and can go up to 6,000 West African francs. Thanks to this business, she helps her husband with household expenses.
Aminata's wish is to open a store or warehouse and to diversify her activities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit of the baobab, sorrel, and peanut paste in order to prepare juices

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 27 years old and married. She has been blessed with 2 children, aged 11 years and 9 years, whom she supports. Sylvia has a food kiosk which she has run for ten years now. She is taking her second loan to purchase stock like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and salts to prepare food for her customers.She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business and children is to open a hotel and  educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and salts to prepare food for her customers.

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es:
Arelis es una muy buena caminadora y se le hace mención es porque gracias a las rutas y caminos que ha recorrido ha logrado hacer buenos amigos que le sirvieron para ofrecer sus servicios de manicura y pedicura, ella se desplaza a todas partes a pie, la razón principal es que el transporte es muy escaso debido a que vive en zonas rurales.

Hablando un poco de la vida personal de Arelis es una mujer que vive en la zona de montería, tiene 26 años, comparte el hogar con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hermosas princesas de 7,8 años de edad y la más bebe de tan solo 3 meses de nacido, son ellas su fuente de fuerza, inspiración, su motor para buscar un mejor futuro y aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es capacitarse, tener una sala de belleza y con el tiempo varias  sucursales.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como lo son una nueva ponchera para remojar los pies, separadores de dedos, barnices, esmaltes, alcohol, tijeras, cortaúñas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Arelis is a great hiker and it is worth mentioning that thanks to the routes and paths that she has hiked she has made good friends to whom she has offered her manicure and pedicure services. Arelis travels everywhere on foot because transportation is scarce in the rural zone where she lives.

To say a little bit about Arelis personal life: she is a woman who lives in the mountains. She is 26 years old and shares her home with her husband, with whom she has three beautiful daughters ages 7, 8, and 3 months. They are her source of power, inspiration, and the reason to search for a better future and aspire to a better quality of life. 

Her dream is to get trained, have a beauty salon, and, in time, other branches. 

Arelis is requesting this loan in order to buy basic household items such as a new wash basin to wash feet, toe separators, varnish, nail polishes, alcohol, scissors, nail clippers, and other items.

loans.use: to buy a wash basin, toe separators, varnish, nail polish, alcohol, scissors, nail clippers, and other items.

loans.name: Meliza Andrea

texts.es:
Criada en el campo, siempre priorizar la familia, trabajar duro, ser honesta y humilde fueron las enseñanzas que le dejaron los padres de la señora Meliza quien no solo pone en práctica estos valiosos valore si no que trata de transmitírselos a sus hijos, pero no solo unos lindos sentimientos fueron las enseñanzas de sus padres, aprendió del campo y la cría de animales, haciendo de esta ultima su principal y única fuente de dinero, adopto dicha actividad por que le permitía estar cerca de sus dos hijos que tan solo tiene 7 y 5 años de edad.

Como se puede ver en la foto las cocheras de Meliza están vacías y es esa la razón por la que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en una cerda de cría, lechones, este préstamo le permitirá abastecer su negocio y seguir poniendo en práctica esta emblemática profesión.
texts.en:
Raised in the countryside, always to prioritize  family, work hard, be honest and humble where the lessons that Meliza's parents taught her. She not only puts these values in practice but also teaches them to her children. Her parents taught her more than these beautiful sentiments, they also taught her to work in the fields and to raise animals. Meliza has been doing this to generate her only source of income. She started working in this way because it allows her to be close to her two children who are only 7 and 5 years old. 

As you can see in the photo, Meliza's pens are empty. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in a breeding pig and piglets. This loan will allow her to stock her business and continue practicing this emblematic profession.

loans.use: to fill her pens with pigs: to buy a breeding pig, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Cristobal Miguel

texts.es:
Desde el 2004 se convirtió en emprendedor el señor Cristobal, sus cocheras tienen un tinte tradicional, la paja, la madera, todo con un toque campestre que hacen memoria a los ancestros antioqueños quienes les enseñaron a ejercer esta actividad.
Cristóbal es todo un señor, es un padre responsable de 4 hijos menores de edad, siendo su principal propósito en la vida ser lo suficiente tanto como padre como empresario para que estos no pasen necesidad, puedan estudiar y salgan adelante en el camino que quieran elegir.

Cristóbal en sus cocheras ofrece un empleo, pues él tiene que realizar algunas actividades como mayordomo.

Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de 10 lechones, alimento, vacunas e insumos para el aseo de su corral.
texts.en:
In the year 2004, señor Cristobal became an entrepreneur.  His piglets have traditional coloring.  The straw, wood and everything have a rural touch which bring to mind his Antioquian ancestors who taught Cristobal to run his business.

Cristóbal is a real man.  He is the responsible father of four dependent children.  His main goal in life is to be sufficient enough as a father, as well as a business owner, so that his children never lack for anything, so that they can study and get ahead on the paths they may choose. 

Cristóbal also offers employment in his barn, and so he also acts as a foreman at times. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ten piglets, feed, inoculations and supplies to keep his corral tidy.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets, feed, inoculations and supplies for keeping his corral tidy.

loans.name: Mdoe

texts.en:
Mdoe is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mdoe operates a grocery selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is a 26-year-old married woman with 4 kids. Her brother-in-law (also shown in the photo) is running a bookstore in his locality. He earns a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. In order to cater more customers, he needs to purchase stock of pens, pencils, markers, and note books. For this reason Rashida has applied a loan of 25000 PKR for her brother-in-law. It will help him in catering to more customers to increase his net income.

loans.use: to purchase stock of pens, pencils, markers, and note books.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée, Adjo est une femme âgée de 30 ans et vit avec ses cinq  enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Adjo vend des oignons en se promenant dans le quartier pour trouver un revenu pouvant couvrir leurs charges quotidiennes. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour avoir plus de revenu Adjo demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs d’oignons destinés à la vente et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is a 30-year old woman who  lives with her five children in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Adjo sells onions as an itinerant vendor in order to earn a revenue allowing her to cover everyday expenses. Adjo stocks up at the market three times a month. In order to  increase her revenues, Adjo is applying for this loan to stock up on bags of onions for sale  and in this way  provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions.

loans.name: Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group

texts.en:
Peter, the man raising his hand on the photo, is a member of Tulaga Muruaki Self Help group. He is 48 years old and married with two children who are in school. Peter is in the business of selling timber and also practices mixed farming and grows potatoes and cabbages.

He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy timber to add stock to his timber business in order to increase his income from timber sales. 

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase timber to add stock to his timber business to increase his income from timber sales.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°16 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°16, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit. 
La présidente s’appelle Oumy, elle s’active dans le commerce de produits halieutiques depuis 2000. Elle a démarré avec un capital de 50 000f. Ayant trouvé une clientèle qui en demande toujours, elle a augmenté l’offre et a pu profiter du bénéfice pour réinvestir d’avantage.
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Oumy appui son mari et participe aux charges familiales.
Comme vœu, elle désire ouvrir un grand magasin devant chez elle et vendre de l’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
The "spouses of teachers #16" group is composed of women who are teachers and/or are married to teachers, and work as vendors. They have joined forces to show support for each other and also to be able to obtain financing more easy. This is the first time they reach out to IMCEC to apply for a loan.

The name of this group's leader is Oumy. She has been selling fish products since 2000. She launched her business with a starting capital of 50,000 West African francs.  Eventually she has developed a loyal customer base, increased her sales volume and was able to have a profit margin to reinvest in her business.

Oumy is married and has four children. She helps her husband with household expenses.
Her wish is to be able to open a store by her home to sell groceries.

loans.use: to buy smoked and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°17" Ngassamack 1" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°17 » Ngassamack 1 », rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit. Madame Awa,  est la responsable de ce sous groupe, elle possède une étale devant chez elle, où elle vend des produits halieutiques, du poisson séché et fumé. Awa a démarré, il y a son commerce grâce à l’appui de son époux qui lui avait remis un peu d’argent. C’est ce capital qu’elle a fructifié jusqu’à maintenant, et puisque sa demande a augmenté, elle souhaite augmenter ses produits afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Pour lui rendre la monnaie de la pièce, elle donne un coup de main à son époux en s’occupant des besoins des enfants.
Awa souhaite construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
The "spouses of teachers #17/Ngassamack 1 "group is composed of women who are teachers and/or are married to teachers, and work as vendors. They have joined forces to show support for each other and also to be able to obtain financing more easy. This is the first time they reach out to UIMCEC to apply for a loan.
 
 Mrs. Awa is the leader of this subgroup. She has a sales stand by her home, where she sells  dried and smoked fish. Awa launched this business thanks to the support of her husband who had given her some money. She has been able to increase this capital over time; because of the growing demand, she would also like to increase her stock now in order to meet her customers' needs. In turn, she helps her husband by providing for their children's needs.   Awa would like to build her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy fish products for resale.

loans.name: Nazish

texts.en: Nazish, age 28, is a married woman. Two years ago, she decided to support her family by starting to stitch clothes at her home. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nazish is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is a 54-year-old woman from the village of Islari. She has invalid daughter, who gets monthly assistance from local government. To meet her family's basic needs, Tsitsino is engaged in agricultural activity, but she has insufficient income and the family lives in poverty. 

Tsitsino has a great desire to start another business and generate more stable income. She requested a loan from local financial institutions but without any success. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Tsitsino has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business and also expand her agribusiness. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Tsitsino will start selling fast-foods and also buy a pig and raise it. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will greatly increase. Tsitsino and her daughter will be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to start selling fast-foods and also purchase a pig

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a business for 15 years. She runs a retail business earning a monthly income of KES 34,000.

She will be using the loan to purchase maize, beans, flour, cooking oil and sugar and hopes she will be able to repay her loan as well as buy food for her children. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, flour, cooking oil aand sugar to help her to pay the loan and buy food for her children

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has had a retail shop business for four years. She will be using the loan to purchase more clothes for sale and hopes this will help her to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan. This is her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale to help her to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan

loans.name: Drake

texts.en:
Drake is a 28-year-young man who lives in Nyakiziba, Kakiika. He lives with his family of six children. He has never gone to school but he educated all his children from his business. What is interesting about this gentleman is that during the dry season he goes to a far-off district and buys beans, maize and coffee - this is usually during harvest season. 

He is trying to diversify his agriculture by planting bananas. He has requested for a loan to mulch his coffee plantation so as to increase yield of coffee together with bananas which will supplement the cereal sales and therefore increase his income. He appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 48-year-old, married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Musarat has requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to consistently meet her customers’ demands. This will allow her to increase her net income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to consistently meet customers’ demands.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is a 38-year-old hardworking woman who has 6 children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Rubi’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Rubi has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces for consistently meeting the demands of her customers. She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces for consistently meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a happily-married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shakeela is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, a 31-year-old married woman, is running a tailoring business to provide for her family. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Nazia has availed a Murabaha loan of 15,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena  is a 42-year-old married woman and for many years, with help of her husband, has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 34-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, and to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: Majeedan is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been in the tailoring business for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses and their children's educational needs. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
