Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces to meet the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Majeedan hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces to meet the orders on time.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra  is 35 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Beatrice Wangari

texts.en:
Beatrice joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management, to enable her create and sustain her enterprise.

Beatrice is 35 years old, married  and blessed with four children which are still in school. She is doing vegetable farming and dairy farming as a way of earning a living. She wants to buy fertilizer and dairy meals so that she can increase her stock to get more income, enabling her to pay school fees for her four children.

She is happy with Kiva and all lenders at large.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and dairy meals to increase her stock and get more income to enable her to pay school fees for her four children.

loans.name: Lonjezo Group

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old, and married with six children. Considering the fact that her family was living under the poverty line, she started obtaining loans in order to alleviate her family’s level of poverty. 

Judith sells second-hand clothes to people in her community. She started this business in order to pay school fees for her children and their medical bills. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more bales of second-hand clothes.  

She plans to improve her family’s living standards and hopes to build a better house for her children.  With the help of the loan she has been obtaining in the previous years, she is now able to provide basic needs to her children without facing any difficulties.

loans.use: buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Arturik

texts.en:
Arturik is an Armenian from Velikaya Znamenka. He is 50 years old and married with two grown children. Back in 1989, Arturik and his family moved to Armenia hoping to start a life there. However, it was hard to manage a living there, which is why within the next 3.5 years the family came back to Ukraine. Today Arturik owns some land in this town. Arturik decided to use his land property to construct three spacious greenhouses and two smaller ones for seedlings. He has been growing his farming enterprise since 2009. At this moment Arturik grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes in his greenhouses. He also owns a small orchard with a variety of fruit trees and a vineyard. 

Arturik needs an additional 15,000 UAH to buy fertilizers and plastic film to cover all of his greenhouses in the upcoming farming season. Arturik is planning to expand his greenhouses by growing more vegetables and fruit as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plastic film to cover all of his greenhouses in the upcoming farming season

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is from Dneprovka, Kamenka region. He is married with two children. Andrei owns a big lot of land in his hometown. He started growing vegetables 12 years ago. At this point, Andrei has four big greenhouses and an additional one for seedlings. He grows tomatoes, radishs, cabbage and cucumbers. All his greenhouses have good heating systems. Andrei is a skillful welder, which helps him organize his farming business, as well as to have a part-time job welding boiler tanks and greenhouses for other farmers in his region. 

Andrei needs to buy a load of coal to ensure that his heating system functions as necessary and the temperatures in the greenhouses this early spring are correct. The funds he had available were not sufficient for these purposes, which is why he had to seek financial assistance. In the future, Andrei would love to expand his agricultural business buying more land and building additional greenhouses on new property.

loans.use: to buy a load of coal to ensure that his heating system functions as necessary and the temperatures in the greenhouses this early spring are correct

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. She has had a Kiosk business for 10 years.

She will be using the loan to purchase stock like cooking oil, salt, soap and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children and also buy food for the family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business to a supermarket and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock like cooking oil, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old. She is married to Haron and they are blessed with one child. She has been operating her dairy farm for five years and earns KES 12,000 per month.

Elizabeth has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply milk for more income. She will use the profits to purchase tailoring materials like clothing, threads, etc.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with a stable business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Lesrima

texts.en:
Lesrima is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with 1 child. He has had a motorcycle transport business for 5 years. He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle and serve more customers as well as make more income. He hopes this will help him educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

His hopes and dreams for the future are buying more motorcycles and being successful. He will use the anticipated increased income to buy more goats for sell and increase his overall income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle and serve more customers.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: Josephine is a group leader, aged 40 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 4 and 18 years, they all go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in a business for 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy soap, sugar, and salt for sale. The group is called TUZAMURANE which means “come together” in English. The group members sell different items and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

loans.use: to buy soap ,sugar, and salt for sale.

loans.name: Amiina

texts.en:
Amina is a first time borrower of the institution applying for a loan of 1,000,000. She’s married with four children and a resident of Kawanda a small town. She operates a carpentry work shop which she took over after her father passed away.
Client wants the loan to pay school fees for her two school going children. Client is so thankful to the funders who are willing to help people they don’t even know and her future plan is to help her children through technical school to acquire skills and help her manage and expand the business.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid has been running a school for the past seven years. Running a school is not an easy task, and requires hard work on a daily and sustained basis. Rashid is prepared to work hard in order to fulfill his goal of providing the children in his community with a good education. All children should have the opportunity to be successful, and this starts with education. Today, there are 150 students in his school. Rashid requires a loan of PKR 75,000 to purchase chairs for his students so that he can provide a comfortable working environment for his students to learn effectively.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for his students so that he can provide a comfortable working environment for his students to learn effectively.

loans.name: Antisa

texts.en: Antisa is 63 years old married woman, from a small village Onoghia. She lives with her pensioner husband. Her salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. With the help of her husband Antisa is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of her family's income. She is involved in cattle and horse breeding, and in cultivation of nuts. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Antisa wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of 2900 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her husband, enabling her to purchase all needed tools and set-up a greenhouse. They will cultivate vegetables and will sell it locally in a good price. Antisa and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To set up a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Kerina

texts.en:
Kerina is  57 years old and a mother of three children aged 34, 33, and 24 years old.
 
She is a soft-spoken lady who commands a lot of respect in her community leading various community projects. Kerina was working as a domestic worker until her retirement a few years ago. She has decided to defy her aging body and start a business selling hot food within her neighborhood. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase a fryer for making chips, as well as for deep frying fish and chicken. This loan will give her the needed boost to move into a new stage of her life, where she can remain active and improve her and her family’s lifestyle. 

She hopes to run a successful business that can provide jobs for others in her community.

loans.use: to buy a fryer

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una joven de 28 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora y luchadora quien está casada y es madre de dos hijos los cuales están pequeños. Norma se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace aproximadamente 5 años aunque sus padres siempre han tenido cultivos de café aprendió a trabajar con ellos quienes le mostraron que sabiendo administrar, cuidar y dar el mantenimiento adecuado a la plantación que es rentable en estas zonas porque es alto y un clima apto. Es así como Norma aprendió a cultivar café. Cuando la cosecha esta lista esta se lleva a vender a las bodegas donde ofrezcan el mejor precio por la calidad. El desafío que se presenta en estos días es el alto costo de los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y abonos para la asistir la propiedad. La propiedad está ubicada a 2.5 kilómetros involucrándose únicamente ella y su esposo buscando a veces personas para que apoyen a terminar los trabajos mucho más rápido siendo un poco difícil ya que casi no se encuentra personas que quieran trabajar y que sean honradas. Sus metas dar mediante la compra de insumos como el abono alto 100, formula cafetalera entre otras el mantenimiento a la parcela de café ya que está un poco dañada la otra parte la cual fue afectada por la roya teniendo como objetivo la siembra de 2 manzanas ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro y con mejores oportunidades esperando ser apoyada para salir adelante.
texts.en: Norma is an enterprising and hard working 28 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of two children who are still small. Norma has worked growing coffee for approximately 5 years. Her parents always worked growing coffee and she learned the trade from them. They taught her that knowing how to manage, take care, and provide an adequate maintenance to the plantation is profitable in these zones, because of the altitude and good climate. That is how Norma learned to grow coffee. When the harvest is completed, it is taken to the stores who offer the best price for its quality. Her challenge nowadays is the high cost of the agricultural inputs such as manure and fertilizers to help maintain the fields. The property is located at 2.5 kilometers and it is tended solely by her and her husband. Sometimes they look for people to help them finish the chores faster, but it is difficult to find people who want to work and who are honest. Her goal is to purchase inputs such as the Alto 100 fertilizer and to maintain the coffee fields which are partially affected by the roya (yellow rust,) she will be able to seed two blocks of the field. This will allow her to offer a better future to her children and better opportunities. She hopes to be helped to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase Alto 100, coffee fertilizers to attend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Smith Tanor

texts.en:
Smith is pursuing a Bachelor of Science Degree in Nursing at the University of Ghana and hopes to attain higher educational laurels in the future to help build his country. The loan is to help pay for his tuition fees. He has a passion for his chosen profession because he is the kind that readily offers support to the needy, thus the career path he has chosen. The completion of his studies would see him at a top management position and also make his family and community proud.

In the next couple of years to come, he hopes to become a lecturer at the tertiary level, imparting the skills and knowledge acquired at school to everyone that comes his way. Attaining greater heights in life is his major goal, which is motivation enough for him to strive for gold in every aspect of his life.

“But for the timely intervention of this loan my offer of admission would have been left hanging, an opportunity I would not have liked to miss.
Ghana is a peaceful place to invest considering our rich mineral resources in gold bauxite, diamond to mention but a few and also there other viable ventures worth exploring”.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Watsala Group

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old with three children, and only one child goes to school. She owns a grocery store which she depends on, for her main source of income. She has been running this business for almost a year now.

She will use the loan to expand her business in order to increase her profits; this will enable her to send her children back to school and help her parents in the village. She plans on hiring someone to help her in running the business and hopes to build a house for her family members.

She has a experienced a positive change since she started obtaining the loans as she is now able to send her children to better hospitals and she is able to cover for their medical bills.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries

loans.name: Raul Emiro

texts.es:
Raúl trabaja como criador de cerdos, es un hombre de 41 años de edad, solitario pero con ganas de salir adelante. 
Es residente de la zona rural de Sampúes, Raúl es más que sincero, el no busca tener enormes riquezas, busca la tranquilidad y la estabilidad, vivir sin nadie que lo persiga por una fortuna, pero tener lo suficiente para vivir dignamente.
Aunque es separo no olvida que con su ex tuvo dos hijos ellos ahora tienen 18 y 14 años de edad, cada semana les envía dinero para su sostenimiento y está muy pendiente de todo lo que necesiten.

Raúl solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, cuido de cerdo y adecuación de las cocheras, en la foto se ve su deterioro y sus cerdos se están lastimando al dormir o incluso en alguna caída.

Los beneficios que quiere ganar son los siguientes:
•	Mejorar sus ventas
•	Mejorar la condición higiénica de sus cocheras
•	Lograr una estabilidad económica, al tener mercancía para trabajar.
•	Optimizar su forma de trabajar.
texts.en:
Raúl works raising pigs. He is 41 years old, single but with the desire to get ahead. He is a resident of a rural zone of Sampúes. Raúl is overly sincere. He is not looking for great riches. He wants tranquility and stability with no one chasing him for his fortune but with enough to live in dignity. Although he is separated he doesn't forget that he has two children with his ex-wife who are now 14 and 18 years old. Each week he sends them money for their support and keeps an eye out to see they have all they need. Raúl is requesting a loan which he will invest in buying pigs, products to care for pigs and to fix up the pigsty. In the photo you can see the deterioration and his pigs hurt themselves while sleeping and sometimes fall. The benefits that he wants to obtain are:

improve his sales
improve the hygienic conditions in the pens
achieve economic stability by having merchandise to work with
optimize his method of work

loans.use: to invest in pigs, products to care for pigs and fixing his pigsty.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and equipment for hair salon

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a hardworking young man aged 36. He grew up in the family of his uncle under harsh treatment until he went to boarding school. Having been bright, he completed the loan and later graduated. He used his savings on pocket money to start his first boutique in the town of mbarara. He bought a few clothes to sell. He dreams of buying a farm land and buy cows for milk. He is requesting for a loan of ugx2,000,000 to buy more items to expand his shop to a whole sale shop so that he can accumulate enough money to educate his young brothers in good schools. He appreciates the financial support of kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and bags for sale.

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en: Teuta wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan which she used to purchase materials for her handicraft work. The loan has helped her to be able to continue with her business and earn money for her family. Now, she is requesting a second loan in order purchase more materials for her work. She would like to be prepared for the upcoming spring and summer season which is typically busy for her for weddings and engagement parties. During these seasons she has so much demand and clients that she has to work long hours and late into the night. She promises to pay on time and wants to thank the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To buy material for her work.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en:
Sarwari is a 53-year-old married woman.  She is a very talented lady and excels in her work stitching clothing, and has received a lot of appreciation from her community.  Some years ago she started a tailoring business to run her household activities.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Sarwari has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors to stitch up more dresses on time.  This will boost her earnings allowing her to spend it on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He also owns a barber shop. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, and sugar and renovate his barber shop. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, and sugar and renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.en:
Mikhail is from Kamenka. He owns three land lots there. Two of his pieces of property are used for greenhouses. Mikhail has five big greenhouses there and four smaller ones for seedlings. He has been running this farming business for 10 years now. Mikhail grows tomatoes, cucumbers and potatoes in his greenhouses and sells them wholesale and retail at the local marketplace. 

Mikhail is seeking to invest 25 000 Grivnyas in the purchase of plastic film needed to renew all the coverings for his greenhouses this upcoming spring season, making sure there are two layers of film stretched over each of his greenhouses. Mikhail has another land lot next to his private house where his wife and 8-year-old son also live. He is hoping and planning to construct more greenhouses on this property in the summer if the situation in the country doesn't get worse.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film needed to renew all the coverings for his greenhouses this upcoming spring season

loans.name: Esther Naana

texts.en:
“I am Esther, a third year student at the Methodist University College, pursuing a course in Management Studies. The loan is to help pay for my tuition fees.

Working towards my goals is more than an inspiration to me because it would help me achieve higher heights in my education and also have many job opportunities.

I have an interest in my profession because of the love I have for people. The completion of my program would enable me to gain extra knowledge to impart on my community and family and in addition, increase my income.

In the next five to ten years ahead, I would hold a top position at any organization I find myself; moreover I would be able to manage my subordinates well.

My other alternative for financial support would have been to take a part-time job elsewhere for extra income.

Ghana is a very peaceful country and the inhabitants are God fearing”.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps livestock. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in climate. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to improve his farm production by 50% within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 37-year-old married woman from the village of Vakhani. She lives with her pensioner mother-in-law, 2 school-aged children, and her husband. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Maia is engaged in cattle and cow breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivating family-owned agricultural land. Her husband sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. The family mostly has seasonal income, so they need an additional source of income to live normally.

Maia sought credit from local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program--that is, the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo--enables the rural poor to get a loan to start or re-start businesses. Maia's application was approved under the program framework for a loan of 6000 Georgian laris (GEL) to purchase a mini-bus for use on a bus line. Her husband will be the driver and will generate significant income to help ensure the welfare of the family and a good education for their children.

The family will be very grateful for the chance to better their lifestyle and generate significant income.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to have a stable source of income

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she makes charcoal briquettes for sale. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are hotels and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as weather changes.

Faith will use the loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy raw materials for making charcoal briquettes. Her business goal is to be able to supply more people within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making charcoal briquettes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tires. His business goal is to be the most preferred tire seller in the area within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barber shop materials to enable him to expand

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that, in the future, she will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be resilient. He operates a retail business where he sells cakes, bread and other items. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cakes and bread. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business greatly. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cakes and bread

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are individuals. 

He will use the 85,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a marketable place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a fashion design store within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Najlaa

texts.en:
Najlaa is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three children, who are attending school. Najlaa and her husband cooperate to maintain their respectable standard of living.

Najlaa has owned a beauty salon since 2010, where she provides customers with beauty services such as hairdressing and make up. Currently, she is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more beauty products and hair dyes. She intends to improve her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services. In the future, she plans to take out additional loans with the aim of developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and hair dyes

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as capable. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area for business, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital.

Everlyne will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en: Reginah is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a butcher shop where she sells goat meat. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to open other butcher shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she can open other outlets all over the country. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Rowilma

texts.en:
Rowilma is 42 and is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a factory worker, and they have two children of which the eldest is in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send their children to school. 
Rowilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from her small general store, she is also a dealer of personal products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day. 
To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods and instant noodles. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send their children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.
Rowilma hopes to maintain and grow her business. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as being honest and reliable. He operates a farm where he grows maize, wheat, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Javier

texts.en: Javier is 39 years old, and he lives at El Alto. He is a taxi driver and is married to a woman who sells clothes. Javier is the father of four children. He needs a loan to buy a new engine for his vehicle. Javier would like to have a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair oils to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Laonai Group

texts.en: Khuan understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Khuan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Khuan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water. Khuan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kolamougnou Group

texts.fr:
Bintou est la cliente qui qui tient le bélier en main.
Elle est une malienne emboucheuse des ovins. Bintou n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle est âgée de 27 ans ; mariée et mère de  trois(03) enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Bintou a fait recourt au RMCR parce qu’elle a la faiblesse de pouvoir financer son activité comme elle le voudrait. Elle achète ses béliers dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone.
Avec son prêt de 150 000 FCFA, elle a payé deux béliers à raison de 100 000 FCFA et les 50 000 FCFA sont utilisés pour leurs soins vétérinaires et leurs aliments bétails. Bintou fait ses ventes dans les foires  de la  localité. Elle peut avoir des bénéfices variant entre 20 000 à 40 000 FCFA par bélier.
Bintou exerce cette activité il y a trois(03) ans. Grace au prêt du RMCR son activité marche bien. Elle n'a pas de difficulté par rapport au déroulement de son activité.
texts.en:
Bintou is the woman holding the sheep.  She comes from Mali and raises sheep and goats.  She is 27 years old, married and mother to three children, one of whom attends school.  Bintou never had the chance to attend school herself.

Due to a lack of funds to run her business, Bintou works with the field partner, RMCR.  She buys her animals at the local, weekly markets.  She plans to use her 150,000 francs CFA loan to buy two sheep (100,000 francs CFA) and animal feed and veterinary care (50,000 francs CFA).  Bintou sells her sheep at the local fairs.  

Bintou makes between 20,000 francs CFA and 40,000 francs CFA profit per sheep, and she has been doing this for three years.

Thanks to her loan with RMCR, Bintou's business is going well and she doesn't have any problems with it.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Sitan est la cliente qui tient en main la corde du mouton.
Agée de 41ans, Sitan est  une malienne embaucheuse des ovins, mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants dont deux (02) écoliers. Sitan n’a pas été à l’école.
Elle achète ses béliers dans les foires hebdomadaires environnantes. Avec son prêt de 100 000F ; elle a payé un bélier à 50 000F et les autres 50 000F sont utilisés pour faire le commerce des pièces de rechange de vélo. Elle fait ses ventes dans les mêmes foires hebdomadaires. Ses bénéfices varient entre 15 000 à 30 000F par cycle de prêt.
Sitan fait l’embouche des ovins il y a 03 ans de cela ; mais grâce au soutien de prêt du RMCR son activité se développe mieux. Sitan n’a pas de difficulté pour son activité mais elle souhaite que le RMCR continue à les soutenir.
texts.en:
Sitan is the woman holding the sheep.  She comes from Mali and raises sheep and goats.  She is 41 years old, married and mother to four children, two of whom attend school.  Sitan never had the chance to attend school herself.

Sitan buys her animals at the local, weekly markets.  She plans to use her 100,000 francs CFA loan to buy a sheep (50,000 francs CFA) and bicycle spare parts (50,000 francs CFA).  Bintou sells her sheep at the same local fairs.  

Sitan makes between 15,000 francs CFA and 30,000 francs CFA profit per loan cycle, and she has been doing this for three years.

Thanks to her loan with RMCR, Sitan's business is developing well and she doesn't have any problems with it.  However, she would like to continue working with RMCR.

loans.use: to buy sheep and bicycle spares for resale.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr: Agé de 56 ans, N’golo est un  emboucheur des ovins, malien . Marié, père de deux (02) enfants scolarisés niveau (7°et 3°année  fondamentale).N’golo a été à l’école niveau 3°année de l’école fondamentale. N’golo a fait recourt au RMCR pour renforcer son activité. Il achète ses béliers dans la foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Avec son prêt de 60 000 FCFA, il achète un bélier à raison de 35 000F pour l’engraisser. Les 25 000F sont utilisés pour l’achat de cinq(05) baignoires d’arachide les stocker puis les revendre à l’approche de l’hivernage. N’golo fait ses ventes dans la même foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Il fait un bénéfice variant entre 20 000 à 30 000F par cycle de prêt. N’golo fait l’embouche depuis plus de 15 ans. Grâce au prêt du RMCR, son activité marche bien. N’golo ne se plaint pas trop seulement souvent les béliers sont chers.
texts.en:
N'golo is 56 years old, married and father to two children who both attend school (3rd and 7th year primary).  He comes from Mali and raises sheep and goats.  N'golo attended school up to the 3rd year of primary.  

In order to strengthen his business, N'golo works with the field partner, RMCR.  He buys his animals at the local, weekly markets.  He plans to use his 60,000 francs CFA loan to buy a sheep (35,000 francs CFA) to fatten up.  The other 25,000 francs CFA will be used to buy five lots of peanuts to stock and resell before the winter season.  N'golo sells his sheep at the local fairs.  

N'golo makes between 20,000 francs CFA and 30,000 francs CFA profit per loan cycle, and he has been doing this for more than fifteen years.

Thanks to his loan with RMCR, N'golo's business is going well and he doesn't have any problems with it, apart from the high cost of sheep.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and sacks of peanuts for selling on.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is 39 years old, and he is a tailor. Luis has two daughters, and he takes care of his grandpa. Luis needs a loan to buy silk, wool, and other materials for his business. Now he needs to make school uniforms. Luis would like to have his own house in the future. Luis appears in the picture with the materials he uses.

loans.use: to buy silk, wool, and other materials for his business

loans.name: Sepriana

texts.en: Sepriana has been married for 18 years. She has four kids. Sepriana lives at Viacha. Her husband is a mason. Sepriana sells milk and makes cheese.  She needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Sepriana wants to sell more milk so that her husband can help her and quit his job that is dangerous. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: To buy a new milking cow

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°18 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°18, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit. 
Maimouna est la responsable de ce sous groupe qui est composé de cinq membres toutes actives. En ce qui la concerne, elle vend des tissus, des chaussures et sacs. Elle a commencé en 2008 en allant chercher le produit à la Mauritanie et en venant l’écouler dans son lieu de travail et dans le voisinage.
Maimouna veut ouvrir une cantine dans le marché, y mettre les produits qu’elle vend et diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The 'Epouses des enseignants No. 18' Group is made up of teachers and wives of teachers who all work in retail.  They work together to support one another in their businesses and benefit from loans.  This will be the first loan for this group with the field partner, UIMCEC.

Maimouna is the leader of this group of five working women.  She sells fabric, shoes and bags.  She began in 2008 by going to Mauritania to buy supplies for resale locally at her workplace and in her neighbourhood.

Maimouna would like to open a small shop at the market to sell her products and diversify the range she offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: San Rafael Quiche Group

texts.en:
Quiche is a large municipality located in the department of the same name. Many in the area are involved in commercial ventures including the sale of animals, vegetables, fruits, as well as crafts and gifts.

Amada is the 37-year-old President of the Friendship Bridge “San Rafael” Trust Bank. She gained the confidence and respect of the women in her Trust Bank who benefited from her strong leadership skills during the final cycles of their last loan. Amada is a widow and sadly has no children. This makes her feel very depressed at times but with the help and support of her fellow Trust Bank members, she is able to move ahead. Amada is the owner of a small convenience store and also sells firewood. She is requesting a new loan that she plans to use to purchase pasta, rice, sugar, beans, butter, eggs, snacks and bread. She wants to have plenty of inventory on the shelves to meet the demands of her current customers and attract new ones. A small portion of her loan will be used to buy firewood to resell. This will be the 5th loan cycle for Amada.

Although Spanish is the “official” language in Guatemala, it is generally spoken as a second language after another native dialect. The ladies in the “San Rafael” Trust Bank speak a native dialect called “Kiche”. This language is spoken by the Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who visits them at their monthly meetings. The Loan Officer will witness all transactions for the loans and then will offer educational training. Last month, the topic was goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, rice, sugar, beans, butter, eggs, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°20" Ndoffène" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°20, rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
La responsable, madame Mbathio, âgée de 61 ans s’active dans la vente de poissons et de légumes ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Et dont les recettes servent en partie à la gestion des dépenses du foyer. Elle tient une étale dans le marché du village. Madame Mbathio n’ayant jamais bénéficié d’un crédit, veut renforcer son capital pour pouvoir acheter des caisses de poissons et des sacs de légumes et satisfaire sa clientèle.
Mbathio veut développer son commerce et diversifier en vendant des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
The 'Epouses des enseignants No. 20' Group is made up of teachers and wives of teachers who all work in retail.  They work together to support one another in their businesses and benefit from loans.  This will be the first loan for this group with the field partner, UIMCEC.

Mbathio is the leader of this group.  She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than ten years.  Her earnings help to provide for the expenses of her household.  She runs a stall at the village market.  

Mbathio has never had a loan before and she would like it to improve her working capital and buy cases of fish and sacks of vegetables to sell to her customers.  

She would like to develop her business and sell a wider range of food products.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°19" Ngassamack" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE « Epouses des enseignants n°19 », regroupent des femmes enseignantes et/ou dont les maris sont enseignants. Ce rassemblement est né il y a quelques années et les activités divergent selon les membres.
La présidente s’appelle Aida, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a démarré son activité en 2006 avec la vente de produits halieutiques, elle n’avait alors qu’un capital de 50 000F. Elle a développé petit à petit son activité et a même diversifié en y associant la vente de fourneaux artisanaux à petit échelle. Avec le crédit, elle va pouvoir augmenter ses produits.
 Aida appuie dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer, étant donné que son mari est en retraite. Voyant que la clientèle est là, elle souhaite avoir un fond plus consistant afin de pouvoir développer son commerce de fourneaux plus particulièrement.
texts.en:
The 'Epouses des enseignants No. 19' Group is made up of teachers and wives of teachers who all work in retail.  The group was formed several years ago and they all operate different businesses.

Aida is the group president.  She is married and mother to seven children.  She began her business in 2006 with a capital of 50,000 francs CFA and sold fish products.  Slowly she built up her business and now she also sells artisanal stoves.     

Aida will use her loan to buy more stock for sale.  Her husband is retired so Aida is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

There is a large market available for her products and Aida wants to develop her stove selling business in particular.

loans.use: to buy fish products for resale and also stoves.

loans.name: Mhinduro Ndishe Group

texts.en:
Early each morning, groups of bleary-eyed Zimbabweans, who spent the night sleeping at a bus depot in Johannesburg, scramble their blankets and check the condition of their goods. Amongst those who wake up to the Johannesburg morning sun is Maidei. The 39-year-old mother of three boys occasionally leaves the comfort of her home to endure the hardships of sleeping in an open space in a desperate bid to make a living. She is one of the hundreds of women who travel the Sadc region buying goods for resale back in Harare.

Ever since Maidei was retrenched in 2008, she has travelled hundreds of kilometres to the City of Gold to restock her family roadside market. She has lost count of how many times she has slept on the pavements of the border post. Her only source of income has been from this small business selling clothes. A loan from Thrive Microfinance has helped Maidei increase the quantities of the goods she buys in South Africa. This has helped her increase the stock in her flea market. She has been able to feed, clothe her family, and send her children to school. She hopes that a loan from Kiva will help her group, Mhinduro Ndishe (meaning God is the answer), increase their stock of goods that are in demand and finance some physical improvements to their roadside markets.

loans.use: To buy a greater range of goods for resale.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is married and has an infant child. She is 25 years old and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao.
 
Cherly earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She has now been in this business for about 3 years and is well-known for the good quality of the services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 3,000 per month. 

Cherly is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. In her previous loans she never had delinquency as she is very diligent and loves accuracy, which also contributes to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase new sets of foot spa

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned that she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently she has requested a loan to purchase 2 additional piglets for commercial sale, and bags of feed for her growing hogs. 

She wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday she hopes to repair her house in order to provide her family with a safe and decent place to live.

loans.use: to purchase 2 additional piglets for commercial sale, and bags of feed for her growing hogs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is gaining a profit through her retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities like rice in the local community. At the age of 38 and married, she never gets tired of displaying her wares and tending her stall as she is passionate about selling. She earns a small income from this which sufficiently supports her family. 

Marilyn is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to purchase more sacks of a variety of rice to sell, in order to increase her inventory and sales.

Marilyn continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the determination and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of a variety of rice to sell, in order to increase her inventory and sales

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée très entreprenante qui vit avec son enfant dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Agée de 22 ans, Adjo est vend des pains en parcourant  tous les coins de son quartier pour satisfaire ses clients. Adjo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans une boulangerie du quartier. Son gain l’aide à satisfaire favorablement les besoins de son ménage mais désire augmenter son profit. C’est pour cela qu’Adjo demande ce crédit pour financer son achat de pains et scolariser son enfant.
texts.en:
Adjo is a very enterprising, married woman.  She is 22 years old and lives with her child in the Adidogomé district.  She sells bread on foot throughout her district.

Four times a month, Adjo buys more supplies from the bakery in her neighbourhood.  Although her earnings help with the costs of her household, Adjo would like to earn more.  This is why she has requested this loan.  She wants to increase her profits and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy 267 loaves of bread for resale.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Etant femme mariée et mère d’un enfant, Kafui est âgée de 26 ans et vit à Apédokoè. Pour permettre à sa famille de bénéficier d’une situation favorable, Kafui vend des mèches pour aider son mari à pourvoie aux besoins quotidiens. Kafui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché pour revendre dans son atelier. Dans le but de commander de nouvelles mèches, Kafui demande ce crédit pour rendre possible ses achats et avoir la rentabilité nécessaire afin de favoriser l’éducation de son enfant
texts.en:
Kafui is 26 years old, married and mother to one child.  She lives in Apédokoè and works to improve the living standards of her family.  To do this, she sells hair extensions.

Four times a month, she buys further supplies from the market and then sells them in her salon.  Her loan will generate a profit which will be used to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy 30 hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Cornerstone Group

texts.en:
Cornerstone is a group of four women who live in Dzivarasekwa.  These women strengthen and encourage each other to work hard to make a living despite the current state of the economy.

Zvikomborero, a member of this group, is a widowed woman and has three children who are school going. She has been an outstretched arm for her church, helping less privileged children by giving them food and clothes.

She is a caterer by profession and has been in the business for almost 13 years now.  She started this business together with her late husband.  When her husband passed on, her in-laws decided to inherit most of the equipment, which they had used for the business with her husband, such that she was left with a few pieces of equipment that were not enough for business.  Since then, she has been selling edibles like peanut butter, plus floor polish, chocolates and sweets in order to raise money to buy new equipment.  In addition, she has managed to send her children to school with the little profits that she has.

She has managed to buy a few pieces of equipment and has since started selling burgers and chips at a sports club at Belgravia in Harare. With the money she is getting from Thrive, she will purchase more equipment for catering since sometimes she gets hired for wedding and funerals.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her food catering business.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans. Akpéné et vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Akpéné entreprend une activité de vente de friperie pour soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Akpéné s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Akpéné demande ce financement pour commander des draps et des serviettes et faire plus de bénéfice afin d’être efficacement utile dans l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akpéné is 35 years old, married and lives in Adidogomé with her two children.  She sells second-hand linens to help her husband support their family.

Once a month, Akpéné buys further supplies from the market.  She will buy sheets and towels with her loan, increase her profits and contribute more to supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets and towels for resale.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
In Harare, a young woman named Ruth rises before dawn to pack sausages into small packages. She runs a business producing sausages and mincemeat. After that, she walks to a nearby local market with a sack full of sausages balanced on her head and a bucket filled with sausages in her hand, to supply retailers, vendors, and the locals. She repeats this cycle until all her daily customers have been supplied. In the evening, she goes back home to cook for her three children. She is exhausted, yet she must wake up in a few hours to make sausages for the following day’s supplies.

Although Ruth did not have much secondary education, she demonstrates sharp business skills by building relationships with her customers. She is one of the million African vendors who offer fresh products to their low-income consumers.

Ruth just received a $250 loan from Thrive Microfinance. She has been able to purchase supplies for her business. She is part of a group called United, which has four energetic women. Ruth and her fellow group members hope that a loan backed by Kiva will help their growing businesses generate more revenue for their work. Their focus is to end poverty in their families, help their children attain basic education and someday own houses of their own.

loans.use: To expand her product range.

loans.name: Jingle Mary

texts.en:
Jingle Mary has a coconut farm in Aloran and makes good earnings every quarter from doing this type of work. This is the primary source of income for her family. 

Jingle Mary makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting more dwarf coconut seedlings. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income. Recently she needed an amount of money to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

Jingle Mary wishes to sustain her business and provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings

loans.name: Thera Mae

texts.en:
Thera Mae and her husband make a living through a retailing business. 

Thera Mae runs a lumberyard in Aloran and earns a promising income to support their family. She signed up membership with PMPC to gain access to insurances and capital. Now she wants to increase her inventory so she has taken out a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. 

Thera Mae hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana has a coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. 

Marciana makes it a point to have good land preparation in order to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. 

Marciana wishes to have more produce and to be able to supply agricultural commodities in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha makes good earnings on her rice farm in Oroquieta. This is the primary source of their income, supporting their needs. 

Editha wants to increase crop yield on her rice farm this cropping season so she approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase rice fertilizer.

She has high hopes that she will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice fertilizer

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid
